callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - FSE 2025

We invite you to contribute to the FSE 2025 program by submitting to one or more tracks. Each track of FSE 2025 has its own submission site and submission deadlines. Please refer to each page for the details.

## FSE 2025 Tracks

*   **Research Papers:** The latest innovations in theoretical, empirical, conceptual, and experimental software engineering research, from both industry and academia. Submission Link: [https://fse2025.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025.hotcrp.com)
*   **Industry Papers:** A venue for outstanding real-world application of software engineering techniques, tools, methods, processes, and practices. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-industry.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-industry.hotcrp.com)
*   **Ideas, Visions and Reflections Papers:** The goal of this track is to present radical, innovative, thought-provoking new ideas, and research directions, as well as lessons learned from the past. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-ivr.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-ivr.hotcrp.com)
*   **Journal First:** Presentations of papers published recently in prestigious software engineering journals. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-journal-first.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-journal-first.hotcrp.com)
*   **Student Research Competition:** A great opportunity for undergraduate and graduate students to experience the research world, present their research results to conference attendees, and compete for prizes. Submission Link: [http://fse2025-src.hotcrp.com](http://fse2025-src.hotcrp.com)
*   **Demonstrations:** A highly interactive venue for researchers and practitioners to present and discuss the most recent advances, experiences, and challenges in the field of software engineering supported by live presentations of new research tools, data, and other artifacts. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-demo.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-demo.hotcrp.com)
*   **Artifacts:** The artifact evaluation track aims to review, promote, share, and catalog the research artifacts of accepted software engineering papers. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-artifacts.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-artifacts.hotcrp.com)
*   **Doctoral Symposium:** Brings doctoral students working in software engineering together, allowing them to present and discuss their research goals, methods, and preliminary results in a constructive and international atmosphere. Submission Link: [https://isstafse2025-ds.hotcrp.com/](https://isstafse2025-ds.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Workshops:** Workshops are an interactive forum for exchanging views, advancing ideas, and discussing preliminary results in various areas of software engineering research and applications. Submission Link: [https://fse25workshops.hotcrp.com](https://fse25workshops.hotcrp.com)
*   **Software Engineering Education:** Venue for sharing of research and innovation in software engineering education. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-seet.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-seet.hotcrp.com)
*   **Tutorials:** An opportunity for conference participants to gain new insights, knowledge, and skills in a broad range of areas of software engineering. Submission Link: [https://fse2025-tutorials.hotcrp.com](https://fse2025-tutorials.hotcrp.com)

## Submission Policies

*   Papers submitted for consideration to FSE should not have been already published elsewhere and should not be under review or submitted for review elsewhere during the reviewing period.
*   Authors are required to adhere to the ACM Policy and Procedures on Plagiarism and the [ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions](http://www.acm.org/publications/policies/simultaneous-submissions).
*   To prevent double submissions, the chairs might compare submissions with related conferences that have overlapping review periods. The double submission restriction applies only to refereed journals and conferences, not to unrefereed forums (e.g. arXiv.org).
*   To check for plagiarism issues, the chairs might use external plagiarism detection software.
*   All publications are subject to the [ACM Author Representations policy](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/roles-and-responsibilities).
*   All authors and co-authors are subject to ACM Publications Policies, including ACM’s new [Publications Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/research-involving-human-participants-and-subjects).
*   Possible violations to any of the above policies will be reported to ACM for further investigation.

## Submission Format

*   All submissions must be in English and in PDF format.
*   Papers must not exceed the page limits that are listed for each call for papers. Refer to each track's submission page for specific limits.
*   Authors should use the official "ACM Primary Article Template", available from the ACM Proceedings Template page.
*   The resulting format should be two-columns.
*   For LaTeX users, the following code can be used at the start of the document:
    ```latex
    % For main proceedings (research track)
    \documentclass[sigconf,screen]{acmart}
    % For companion proceedings (all other tracks)
    \acmBooktitle{Companion Proceedings of the 33rd ACM Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (FSE '25), June 23--27, 2025, Trondheim, Norway}
    ```

## Double-Anonymous Review Process

*   The **Research Papers Track** employs a double-anonymous review process. Please check the call for papers for other tracks to see if they also use this process.
*   Authors must ensure their submissions do not reveal their identities:
    *   Leave out author names and affiliations from the body of the submission.
    *   Cite related work by themselves in the third person (e.g., "the prior work of XYZ" as opposed to "our prior work").
    *   Do not include URLs to author-revealing sites (tools, datasets). Replication packages are encouraged and details can be found in the [FSE Open Science Policy](https://conf.researchr.org/track/fse-2025/fse-2025-open-science-policy).
    *   Anonymize author-revealing company names; use general characteristics of organizations instead.
    *   Ensure paper acknowledgements do not reveal the origin of the work.
*   Papers that do not comply with the double-anonymous review process (for tracks that employ it) may be desk-rejected.
*   Authors are advised to postpone publishing submitted work on arXiv or similar sites until after the notification of acceptance.

## Important Dates

*   **Workshops Proposals Submission:** **Tue 15 Oct 2024**
*   **Research Papers: Paper Registration:** **Thu 5 Sep 2024**
*   **Research Papers: Full Paper Submission:** **Thu 12 Sep 2024**
*   **Ideas, Visions and Reflections Papers: Submission Deadline:** **Thu 16 Jan 2025**

callForPapers:
# GD 2025: Call for Papers

The 33rd International Symposium on Graph Drawing and Network Visualization (GD 2025) will be held in **Norrköping, Sweden, from September 24–26, 2025**. A pre-conference PhD school will take place on **September 22–23, 2025**.

GD 2025 is concerned with the geometric representation of graphs and constitutes the algorithmic core of Network Visualization, motivated by applications where it is crucial to visually analyze and interact with relational datasets.

## Invitation to Contribute

Researchers and practitioners working on any aspects of graph drawing and network visualization are invited to contribute papers and posters and to participate in the symposium as well as the graph drawing contest.

## Tracks

GD has two distinct tracks, and papers submitted to one track will not compete with papers submitted to the other. Regular papers must be submitted explicitly to one of the two tracks.

### Track 1: Combinatorial and Algorithmic Aspects

This track is mainly devoted to fundamental theoretical graph drawing advances, such as combinatorial and algorithmic aspects. Topics include (but are not limited to):

*   Design and analysis of graph drawing algorithms
*   Geometric and topological graph theory
*   Computational topology of graphs on surfaces
*   Graph representations
*   Geometric advances and computing in graph drawing
*   Combinatorics and optimization in graph drawing

### Track 2: Experimental, Applied, and Network Visualization Aspects

This track is mainly devoted to the practical aspects of graph drawing, such as experimental evaluations of graph drawing related algorithms, the development and/or evaluation of related libraries and tools, or systems and interfaces in different application areas. Topics include (but are not limited to):

*   Engineering of graph drawing algorithms and network visualization systems
*   Interfaces, methods, and high-quality tools for interacting with graphs and networks
*   Benchmarks and experimental studies in the context of graph drawing and network visualization
*   Cognitive studies on network visualization aesthetics and user interaction
*   Visualization of networks in real-world applications
*   Machine learning methods in graph drawing & network visualization
*   Graph drawing & network visualization for AI explainability

## Short Papers

In addition to the above two tracks, there will be a separate category for short papers. Smaller and less elaborate contributions on relevant topics are welcome, and will be assigned a shorter presentation time.

## Remote Presentation

A limited number of remote presentations are allowed. Authors must declare this at submission time and register for the conference. A recording of the presentation must be submitted two weeks after paper submission. The quality of the recorded talk will be assessed.

## Posters & Contest

Submissions of posters on graph drawing, network visualization, and related areas are solicited. An abstract must be submitted together with the poster. Details about the Graph Drawing Contest can be found at [https://mozart.diei.unipg.it/gdcontest/2025/](https://mozart.diei.unipg.it/gdcontest/2025/).

## Important Dates

All deadlines are understood to be 23:59 AoE.

1.  **Abstract submission deadline:** June 3, 2025
2.  **Paper submission deadline:** June 10, 2025
3.  **Notification of paper acceptance:** July 23, 2025
4.  **Poster submission deadline:** August 22, 2025
5.  **Notification of poster acceptance:** September 1, 2025
6.  **Final versions due:** TBA
7.  **Symposium:** September 24–26, 2025

## Rules for Submission

*   Results previously published or submitted elsewhere are not permitted, except for poster submissions.
*   Except for remote presentations, each paper or poster must be presented at the conference by an author.
*   ChatGPT and similar large language models may be used for language improvement but must be mentioned as a footnote. Unattributed use for scientific content is forbidden.

## Submission Format

Submissions must be prepared in accordance with the [LIPIcs author instructions](https://submission.dagstuhl.de/series/details/LIPIcs#author), using the provided LaTeX class file `gd-lipics-v2.cls`.

**Limits:**

*   **Lines:** 500 lines for full papers, 225 lines for short papers, 80 lines for posters’ abstracts (excluding front matter, references, and appendices).
*   **Pages (excluding references):** 15 pages for long papers, 7 pages for short papers, 3 pages for posters’ abstracts.

Authors are encouraged to name all authors in citations instead of using "et al." where feasible.

## Paper Submission, Proceedings and Special Issues

Papers should be submitted electronically via [Easychair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=gd2025).

The proceedings will be published in the Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) series.

Selected papers will be invited for submission to a special issue of the Journal of Graph Algorithms and Applications (JGAA). Two selected papers from Track 2 will be invited to submit to IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (TVCG).

## Review Process

*   **Papers:** Lightweight Double-Blind Review Process. Authors must not reveal their identity in submitted papers.
*   **Posters:** Single-blind mode. Authors’ names, affiliations, and email addresses must be included in the submitted abstract.

## Awards

*   Best Paper Award (per track)
*   Best Presentation Award
*   Best Poster Award

callForPapers:
# FUZZ-IEEE 2025: Call for Papers

The **IEEE International Conference on Fuzzy Systems (FUZZ-IEEE)** is one of the premier international conferences in the field of fuzzy sets and systems and related areas. The **2025 edition** will be held in **Reims, France**, from **July 6-9, 2025**.

FUZZ-IEEE 2025 will serve as a unique meeting point for scientists and engineers from academia and industry to discuss the latest advancements and innovations in fuzzy set theory and its hybridizations with other artificial and computational intelligence techniques.

## Topics of Interest

The conference topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Mathematical and theoretical foundations of fuzzy sets, measures and integrals,
*   Fuzzy control, robotics, sensors, fuzzy hardware and architectures,
*   Fuzzy data analysis, fuzzy clustering, classification and pattern recognition,
*   Type-2 fuzzy sets, computing with words and granular computing,
*   Fuzzy systems with big data and cloud computing, fuzzy analytics and visualization,
*   Fuzzy systems design and optimization,
*   Fuzzy decision analysis, multi-criteria, decision making and decision support,
*   Fuzzy modelling, identification and fault detection,
*   Fuzzy information processing, information extraction and fusion,
*   Fuzzy web engineering, information retrieval, text mining and social network analysis,
*   Knowledge discovery, learning, reasoning and knowledge representation,
*   Fuzzy image, speech and signal processing, vision and multimedia data,
*   Fuzzy databases and information retrieval,
*   Rough sets, imprecise probabilities, possibilities approaches,
*   Fuzzy logic and its Industrial, financial, biological and medical applications,
*   Fuzzy logic in civil engineering and geographical information systems,
*   Fuzzy sets and soft computing in social sciences, linguistic summarization, natural language processing,
*   Computational intelligence in environmental sciences,
*   Computational Intelligence in safety of critical systems, cyber-physical systems and cyber-security,
*   Hardware/Software for fuzzy systems,
*   Fuzzy Markup Language and standard technologies for fuzzy systems,
*   Adaptive, hierarchical and hybrid (neuro- and evolutionary-) fuzzy systems,
*   Emerging related topics…

## Submission Guidelines

*   **EDAS Submission Portal:** [Click here to access the EDAS submission portal](https://edas.info/N33249)
*   **Paper Preparation:** Manuscripts should be prepared following the guidelines detailed on the [Authors Instruction page](https://fuzzieee2025.conf.lip6.fr/author-instructions/).
*   **Review Process:** Double Blind reviews will be performed. Authors should not include any author and affiliation information on their submitted PDF manuscript.
*   **Contribution Types:** Submissions are invited for regular papers, special session papers, late breaking papers, and Journal to Conference (J2C) papers.

## Important Dates

*   **Tutorials / Special Sessions Proposal:** November 1st, 2024 - November 15th, 2024
*   **Tutorials / Special Sessions Notification:** December 1st, 2024
*   **Competition Proposal:** January 31st, 2025
*   **Regular and Special Session Papers Submission Deadline (Final Extension):** February 10th, 2025 (23:59, Anywhere on Earth, i.e. UTC-12)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** April 2nd, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Papers / Early Registration Deadline:** May 10th, 2025
*   **“Celebration of 60 years of fuzzy sets” Submission Deadline:** June 16th, 2025 (AoE)

### Late Breaking and Journal to Conference (J2C) Papers Important Dates

*   **First Round Submissions:** April 22nd, 2025 (AoE)
*   **First Round Notification of Acceptance:** May 5th, 2025
*   **Second Round Submissions:** May 22nd, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Second Round Notification of Acceptance:** May 30th, 2025 (AoE)

## Contact

For more information, please contact: [fuzz-ieee2025@univ-reims.fr](mailto:fuzz-ieee2025@univ-reims.fr)

## Sponsors

Special thanks to our sponsors.

callForPapers:
# GECCO 2025: Call for Papers

The Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference (GECCO 2025) will present the latest high-quality results in genetic and evolutionary computation. The conference will take place from **July 14 - 18, 2025**, in **Málaga, Spain**, and will be a **hybrid event**.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include:

*   Genetic algorithms
*   Genetic programming
*   Ant colony optimization and swarm intelligence
*   Complex systems
*   Evolutionary combinatorial optimization and metaheuristics
*   Evolutionary machine learning
*   Learning for evolutionary computation
*   Evolutionary multiobjective optimization
*   Evolutionary numerical optimization
*   Neuroevolution
*   Real-world applications
*   Search-based software engineering
*   Theory, benchmarking, reproducibility
*   Hybrids and more

A href="Tracks" - full list of tracks is available.

## Paper Categories

### Full Papers

*   **Description:** Present original work that meets the high-quality standards of GECCO. At most 8 pages (excluding references).
*   **Publication:** Appear in the ACM digital library as part of the Main Proceedings of GECCO.
*   **Supplementary Material:** Allowed, must be anonymized.
*   **Abstract Deadline:** **January 22, 2025**
*   **Submission Deadline:** **January 29, 2025**

### Poster-only Papers

*   **Description:** Present original work that has not yet reached the maturity and completeness of research results that are published as full papers at GECCO. At most 4 pages (including references).
*   **Publication:** Appear in the ACM digital library as part of the Companion Proceedings of GECCO.
*   **Submission Deadline:** **January 29, 2025**

## Double-Blind Review Process

Each paper submitted to GECCO will be rigorously reviewed in a double-blind review process. Authors must anonymize their submissions, ensuring no author names, affiliations, or acknowledgments are present. References to the authors' own work should be made as if the work belonged to someone else.

## Publication Policy

All accepted papers will be published in the ACM Digital Library. Submitting substantially similar work to other conferences or journals is not allowed. Accepted papers may be extended and submitted to journals, provided the journal's policy permits.

## Supplementary Material

Supplementary material (e.g., videos, PDF appendix, source code, data) can be submitted alongside the paper and must also be anonymized. It is encouraged to submit source code for replication of experiments. Material can be uploaded as PDF, ZIP, or TGZ files (max 10MB).

## Requirements for Accepted Papers

Authors of accepted papers agree to:

*   Submit a final, revised, camera-ready version by the camera-ready deadline.
*   Register at least one author by **May 15, 2025** to attend the conference as an in-person or online PRESENTER.
*   Attend the conference (at least one author).
*   Present the accepted paper at the conference.

If an author presents multiple papers, additional registration fees may not apply.

## Submission Link

All contributions must be submitted via the paper submission website: [https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/gecco/](https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/gecco/)

## Important Dates

*   **Tutorial, Workshop, Competition proposals submission:** November 13, 2024
*   **Tutorial, Workshop, Competition proposals notification:** December 18, 2024
*   **Full papers abstract submission:** **January 22, 2025**
*   **Full paper submission:** **January 29, 2025**
*   **Poster-only paper submission:** **January 29, 2025**
*   **Notification of acceptance/rejection (papers & posters):** **March 19, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready deadline (papers & posters):** **April 9, 2025**
*   **Presenter mandatory registration:** **May 15, 2025**
*   **Workshop Papers Submission opening:** February 10, 2025
*   **Workshop Papers Submission deadline:** April 2, 2025
*   **Workshop Papers Notification:** April 28, 2025
*   **Workshop Papers Camera-ready:** May 12, 2025
*   **Humies deadline for entries:** May 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 14-18, 2025

## Contact

*   Email: [gecco2025@sigevo.org](mailto:gecco2025@sigevo.org)

callForPapers:
# Graphics Interface 2025: Call for Papers

The Graphics Interface (GI) 2025 program invites innovative technical and foundational contributions in graphics, HCI, and visualization. We seek submissions covering all aspects of graphics, HCI, and visualization.

GI 2025 will be held in **Kelowna, British Columbia, from May 26 to May 29, 2025**.

Graphics Interface is the only conference for computer graphics and human computer interaction, offering a unique venue for promoting interactions and collaboration on computer graphics and interactive techniques, with graphics and HCI having equal weights.

All paper submissions are rigorously peer-reviewed by at least three members of the international program committee.

The proceedings of GI ’25 will be published in the ACM International Conference Proceedings Series (ICPS).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline #1:** 16 December 2024
*   **Author Notification for Deadline #1:** 20 January 2025
*   **Submission Deadline #2:** 7 March 2025
*   **Author Notification for Deadline #2:** 8 April 2025
*   **Camera-ready Due:** 22 April 2025
*   **Conference:** 26 May 2025 to 29 May 2025

## Other Calls

We also invite submissions for:

*   [Call for Posters and Demonstrations](Call for Posters and Demonstrations)
*   [Call for Courses and Workshops](Call for Courses and Workshops)

## Sponsors

Graphics Interface is sponsored by the Canadian Human-Computer Communications Society, a non-profit organization dedicated to advancing research and education in the fields of computer graphics, visualization and human-computer interaction.

## Acknowledgement

We respectfully acknowledge the Syilx Okanagan Nation and their peoples, in whose traditional, ancestral, unceded territory UBC Okanagan is situated.

callForPapers:
# International Conference on Geometric Modeling and Processing (GMP 2025): Call for Papers

The International Conference on Geometric Modeling and Processing (GMP 2025) will be held in-person at **Washington University in St. Louis, USA**, from **May 28-30, 2025**.

GMP is an annual international conference series on geometric modeling, simulation, and computing. The conference provides a forum for exchanging new ideas, discussing new applications, and presenting new solutions in areas fundamental to many computer applications.

## Topics of Interest

The organizers invite submissions of full-length papers on topics including, but not limited to:

*   Computational design, manufacturing and 3D printing
*   Computational geometry and topology
*   Discrete differential geometry
*   Geometric content generation
*   Geometric feature modeling and recognition
*   Geometric learning/data-driven approaches
*   Isogeometric analysis
*   Image based modeling
*   Material modeling
*   Mathematical foundations of computer aided geometric design
*   Multi-resolution and heterogeneous modeling
*   Shape and solid representation
*   Shape optimization

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission (mandatory):** December 9, 2024
*   **Full paper submission:** December 16, 2024
*   **First review notification:** February 17, 2025
*   **Revised papers:** March 10, 2025
*   **Second review notification:** April 14, 2025
*   **Early registration:** Until April 20, 2025
*   **Regular registration:** Until May 1, 2025
*   **Conference date:** May 28-30, 2025

## Paper Submission

*   The official language of the conference is English, and manuscripts must be written in English.
*   Submitted papers should present previously unpublished, original results that are not simultaneously submitted elsewhere.
*   All papers will be rigorously peer-reviewed by members of the international program committee of GMP.
*   The review process will be **double-blind**.
*   Please use the provided LaTeX template for your submission. The expected length is **10 to 15 pages**.
*   **Submission link:** [https://srmv2.eg.org/COMFy/Conference/GMP_2025](https://srmv2.eg.org/COMFy/Conference/GMP_2025)

## Publications

The conference proceedings will be published in a special issue of **Computer-Aided Geometric Design (CAGD, Elsevier)**.

Papers will undergo a two-stage review process to meet the high standards of the journal. Authors of papers acceptable with minor revisions will be invited for a second review cycle. Submissions with strong potential but requiring major revisions will be recommended for a fast-track submission process to Computer-Aided Geometric Design with optional reviewer continuity.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## Introduction

Green computing, in the context of cloud and pervasive computing, is an emerging research field in computer science and engineering. Pervasive and cloud computing are promising paradigms that have been seeing exponential growth in the deployments and poised to take major roles in human's daily life. But in order to realize this potential, both are facing the critical challenges related to energy consumption, for example, controlling the energy spent by the large-scale data centers and prolonging the battery life of mobile devices in pervasive computing and Internet of Things (IoT). New concepts and technologies such as mobile cloud computing (MCC), software-defined networking (SDN), Edge / Fog and hybrid cloud services can be explored to make data centers and wireless devices more energy efficient.

The 20th International Conference on Green, Pervasive, and Cloud Computing (GPC 2025) focuses on pervasive and environmentally sustainable computing. GPC 2025 will be held on **09th-12th December 2025** at **Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia**, and will provide a forum for researchers and practitioners to discuss and exchange novel ideas, results, experiences and work-in-process on the Green, Pervasive, and Cloud Computing.

## Topics And Scope

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Pervasive and Green Computing
    *   Ubiquitous computing and mobile human-computer interaction
    *   Intelligent digital health care, education, media games, etc.
    *   Smart factory and intelligent industry
    *   Green urban computing
*   Wireless and Ubiquitous Networking
    *   Energy efficient communication
    *   Slicing
    *   Ubiquitous communications and networks
    *   Internet architecture
    *   Robotic and drone-based networking
*   Mobile Sensing and Computing
    *   Applications of machine learning to mobile computing systems/wireless research
    *   Implanted and wearable sensing and computing
    *   Mobile data science and analysis
    *   Mobile health, web, video, virtual reality, and other applications
*   Edge Intelligence
    *   Cloud, edge / fog, cluster, and grid computing systems
    *   Robotic and drone-based networking
    *   Low-latency and energy-aware processing
    *   Artificial intelligent in distributed computing systems
*   Cyber-Physical-Social Systems
    *   Socially-aware computing
    *   Green cyber-physical systems
    *   Human-machine intelligence
    *   Human-centered computing
*   Industrial Digitization and Applications
    *   Internet of things
    *   Big data and digital twin
    *   Infrastructure softwarization
    *   Self-organization and organic computing
    *   Service level agreements (SLAs) guarantee

## Paper Submission Guidelines

Submission will be electronic in **PDF format** through the CCF system at [https://conf.ccf.org.cn/en/gpc2025/paper](https://conf.ccf.org.cn/en/gpc2025/paper). The submitted materials should not be submitted or published elsewhere. Each paper is limited to **16 pages** including figures and references using Springer LNCS template. Papers will be selected based on their originality, timeliness, significance, relevance, and clarity of presentation. Submission of a paper should be regarded as a commitment that, should the paper be accepted, at least one of the authors will register and attend the conference to present the work.

Manuscript templates for the Conference Proceedings can be found at: [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs)

### Important Note on CCF Account

For paper submission/registration, you must first register a CCF account:
*   Chinese: [https://web.ccf.org.cn/CCF/apply/user!reg.action?flag=8&url=https://web.ccf.org.cn/CCF/frame.action](https://web.ccf.org.cn/CCF/apply/user!reg.action?flag=8&url=https://web.ccf.org.cn/CCF/frame.action)
*   English: [https://web.ccf.org.cn/CCF/apply/user!register.action](https://web.ccf.org.cn/CCF/apply/user!register.action)

## Important Dates

1.  **Submission of Research Track Papers:** July 15, 2025
2.  **Acceptance Notification:** August 15, 2025
3.  **Camera-ready Submission:** September 15, 2025
4.  **Conference Date:** December 09-12, 2025

## Contact Us

For any question please do not hesitate to contact **CCF_tcpc@ccf.org.cn**

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IEEE GLOBECOM 2025

The IEEE Global Communications Conference (GLOBECOM) will be held in **Taipei, Taiwan**, from **8 to 12 December 2025**. Themed **“Sustainable Communications for Ubiquitous Intelligence,”** this flagship conference of the IEEE Communications Society will feature a comprehensive high-quality technical program.

Prospective authors are invited to submit **original technical papers** of their previously unpublished work. Only original papers that have not been published or submitted for publication elsewhere will be considered.

All papers for technical symposia (including Selected Areas in Communications) should be submitted via **EDAS**.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submissions:** 2 May 2025 (Final Extension, Firm)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** 1 August 2025
*   **Accepted Author Registration:** TBA
*   **Camera-Ready Submission:** 1 September 2025

## Technical Symposia

Original technical papers are sought in the following areas:

*   **COGNITIVE RADIO AND AI-ENABLED NETWORKS**
*   **COMMUNICATION AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS SECURITY**
*   **COMMUNICATION QOS, RELIABILITY AND MODELING**
*   **COMMUNICATIONS SOFTWARE AND MULTIMEDIA**
*   **COMMUNICATION THEORY**
*   **GREEN COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS AND NETWORKS**
*   **IOT AND SENSOR NETWORKS**
*   **MOBILE AND WIRELESS NETWORKS**
*   **NEXT-GENERATION NETWORKING AND INTERNET**
*   **OPTICAL NETWORKS & SYSTEMS**
*   **SIGNAL PROCESSING FOR COMMUNICATIONS**
*   **WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS**

## Selected Areas in Communications (SAC)

*   **SAC - AERIAL COMMUNICATIONS**
*   **SAC - BIG DATA**
*   **SAC - CLOUD COMPUTING AND NETWORKING**
*   **SAC - E-HEALTH**
*   **SAC - INTEGRATED SENSING AND COMMUNICATION**
*   **SAC - MACHINE LEARNING FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND NETWORKING**
*   **SAC - MOLECULAR, BIOLOGICAL, AND MULTI-SCALE COMMUNICATIONS**
*   **SAC - QUANTUM COMMUNICATIONS AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY**
*   **SAC - RECONFIGURABLE INTELLIGENT SURFACES**
*   **SAC - SATELLITE AND SPACE COMMUNICATIONS**
*   **SAC - SMART GRID COMMUNICATIONS**
*   **SAC - SOCIAL NETWORKS**
*   **SAC - TERAHERTZ COMMUNICATIONS**

## Author and Submission Guidelines

*   **Plagiarism and Double Submission:** IEEE policy strictly prohibits plagiarized material and papers submitted to other conferences simultaneously. Violators may face action.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** An author of an accepted paper must register for the conference and present the paper. Failure to present may result in exclusion from distribution (including IEEE Xplore).
*   **Page Length Limits:**
    *   Initial submissions for review: **SIX (6) printed pages** (10-point font).
    *   Final submissions: Maximum **SIX (6) printed pages** (10-point font), including figures. One (1) additional page is allowed at an **over length page charge of US$100**.
*   **Templates:**
    *   Microsoft Word: [A4](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html), [US letter](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
    *   LaTeX: [Standard IEEE conference templates](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   **Publication:** Accepted and presented technical papers will be published in the IEEE GLOBECOM 2025 Conference Proceedings and submitted to IEEE Xplore®.
*   **EDAS Submission:** All papers must be submitted to the official GLOBECOM 2025 submission system via EDAS.

IEEE GLOBECOM 2025 will also feature workshops, tutorials, and various industry program proposals. Details for these can be found on the conference website.

callForPapers:
# Visualization in Science and Education (GRC) - Call for Papers

The **Gordon Research Conference (GRC) on Visualization in Science and Education** will be held from **July 13 - 18, 2025**, at **Bates College, Lewiston, Maine**.

## Conference Theme: "Visualization for Impact"

The 2025 conference continues the tradition of bringing together a multi-disciplinary group including researchers from the social and natural sciences, artists, technologists, journalists, educators from formal and informal settings, and others engaged in the production, study, and application of visualizations to advance and promote scientific understanding. The theme "Visualization for Impact" explores transdisciplinary and multi-dimensional topics such as:

*   Machine learning and visualization
*   Visualization for impact in AR/VR/XR
*   Visualization for action and social good
*   Visualization for education (literacy, activities, pedagogy)
*   Visualization of earth and environmental science
*   Visualization of uncertainty and qualitative data

The conference will explore how visualizations can inspire change, influence policies, and inform better decision-making. It will also examine how visualizations clarify or intensify uncertainty in data, how the mind understands complex data, and how visualizations support or obstruct mental models, applying technical, ethical, artistic, scientific, educational, and philosophical lenses.

## Conference Format

The conference is a premier, international scientific event focused on presenting cutting-edge and unpublished research, prioritizing time for discussion after each talk, and fostering informal interactions among scientists of all career stages. It is a five-day residential conference designed to increase camaraderie and create scientific communities.

## Deadlines and Application Information

*   **Application Deadline:** The application deadline for this meeting was **June 15, 2025**. You may still submit an application, which may be considered by the conference chair if there is still room available.
*   **Eligibility:** Undergraduates or those who have not obtained a bachelor's degree in science/engineering (or acceptable equivalent) are not eligible to apply to attend Gordon Research Conferences.
*   **Application Submission:** Apply now at [https://my.grc.org/event-application/19055](https://my.grc.org/event-application/19055).

## Related Meeting

This GRC will be held in conjunction with the "Visualization in Science and Education" Gordon Research Seminar (GRS). Those interested in attending both meetings must submit an application for the GRS in addition to an application for the GRC. Refer to the [associated GRS program page](http://www.grc.org/visualization-in-science-and-education-grs-conference/2025/) for more information.

## Registration Fees

*   **Conferee Single Room:** $990.00
*   **Conferee Shared Room:** $940.00
*   **Conferee Off-Site:** $765.00
*   **Guest Single Room:** $800.00
*   **Guest Shared Room:** $750.00
*   **Guest Off-Site:** $575.00
*   **Child 4-12 yrs Shared Room:** $375.00
*   **Child 4-12 yrs Off-Site:** $288.00
*   **Child Under 4 yrs Shared Room:** Free
*   **Child Under 4 yrs Off-Site:** Free
*   **Bus Arriving:** $62.00
*   **Bus Departing:** $62.00

## Poster Information

Poster sessions are an integral part of the conferences, offering all attendees an opportunity to discuss their research. Visit [Preparing your GRC poster](http://www.grc.org/posters/default.aspx) for more information.

## Funding Opportunities

Financial assistance is available beginning in 2026 for qualified applicants through the Carl Storm Opportunity Fellowships program.

## MyGRC Account

Check your application status, complete your registration, update your poster, change your rooming preference, make a bus reservation, print an invitation letter, print a receipt, or print an invoice by logging into your [MyGRC Account](http://my.grc.org).

## Phishing Alert

GRC SPEAKERS AND DISCUSSION LEADERS ARE BEING TARGETED BY PHISHING ATTEMPTS DESIGNED TO COLLECT PAYMENT FOR REGISTRATION OR LODGING. [CLICK HERE FOR MORE DETAILS](http://www.grc.org/phishing-alert/).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - GPCE 2025

The ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Generative Programming: Concepts & Experiences (GPCE) is a programming languages conference focusing on techniques and tools for code generation, language implementation, and product-line development. This is the 24th edition of the conference.

## Topics of Interest

GPCE seeks conceptual, theoretical, empirical, and technical contributions to its topics of interest, which include but are not limited to:

*   program transformation, staging,
*   macro systems, preprocessors,
*   program synthesis,
*   code-recommendation systems,
*   domain-specific languages,
*   generative language workbenches,
*   language embedding, language design,
*   domain engineering,
*   software product lines, configurable software,
*   feature interactions,
*   applications and properties of code generation,
*   language implementation,
*   AI/ML techniques for generative programming,
*   generative programming for AI/ML techniques,
*   low code / no code approaches.

GPCE promotes cross-fertilization between programming languages and software development and among different styles of generative programming in its broadest sense. Authors are welcome to check with the PC chair whether their planned papers are in scope.

## Paper Categories

GPCE solicits four kinds of submissions:

*   **Full Papers:** Reporting original and unpublished results of research that contribute to scientific knowledge for any GPCE topic. Full paper submissions must not exceed 12 pages excluding the bibliography.

*   **Short Papers:** Presenting unconventional ideas or new visions in any GPCE topics. Short papers do not always contain complete results as in the case of full papers, but can introduce new ideas to the community and get early feedback. Note that short papers are not intended to be position statements. Accepted short papers are included in the proceedings and will be presented at the conference. Short paper submissions must not exceed 6 pages excluding the bibliography, and must have the text `(Short Paper)` appended to their titles.

*   **Tool Demonstrations:** Presenting tools for any GPCE topic. Tools must be available for use and must not be purely commercial. Submissions must provide a tool description not exceeding 6 pages excluding bibliography and a separate demonstration outline including screenshots also not exceeding 6 pages. Tool demonstration submissions must have the text `(Tool Demonstration)` appended to their titles. If they are accepted, tool descriptions will be included in the proceedings. The demonstration outline will only be used to evaluate the planned demonstration.

*   **Generative Pearl:** An elegant essay about generative programming. Examples include but are not limited to an interesting application of generative programming and an elegant presentation of a (new or old) data structure using generative programming. Accepted Generative Pearl papers are included in the proceedings and will be presented at the conference. Generative Pearl submissions must not exceed 12 pages excluding the bibliography, and must have the text `(Generative Pearl)` appended to their titles.

## Paper Selection Criteria

The GPCE program committee will evaluate each submission according to the following selection criteria:

*   **Novelty:** Papers must present new ideas or evidence and place them appropriately within the context established by previous research in the field.
*   **Significance:** The results in the paper must have the potential to add to the state of the art or practice in significant ways.
*   **Evidence:** The paper must present evidence supporting its claims. Examples of evidence include formalizations and proofs, implemented systems, experimental results, statistical analyses, and case studies.
*   **Clarity:** The paper must present its contributions and results clearly.

## Best Paper Award

Following the tradition, the GPCE program committee will select the best paper among accepted papers. The authors of the best paper will be given the best paper award at the conference.

## Paper Submission

The submission page will be announced soon. The submission link is: [https://gpce25.hotcrp.com/](https://gpce25.hotcrp.com/)

All submissions must use the [ACM SIGPLAN Conference Format “acmart”](http://sigplan.org/Resources/Author/#acmart-format). Be sure to use the latest LaTeX templates and class files, the SIGPLAN sub-format, and 10-point font. Consult the sample-sigplan.tex template and use the document-class `\documentclass[sigplan,anonymous,review]{acmart}`.

### Double-Blind Review Process

To increase fairness in reviewing, GPCE uses the double-blind review process:

*   Author names, institutions, and acknowledgments should be omitted from submitted papers.
*   References to the authors’ own work should be in the third person.

No other changes are necessary, and authors will not be penalized if reviewers are able to infer authors’ identities in implicit ways.

### ACM Artifact Badges

Authors that want to apply for an ACM Artifact Badge are asked to add a brief paragraph in the ACKs section of their submission. The paragraph should indicate which ACM Badge is the submission aiming for and what is part of the artifact.

More information on ACM Artifact Badges: [https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/artifact-review-and-badging-current](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/artifact-review-and-badging-current)

## Important Dates (CEST)

*   **Conference:** Thu 3 Jul 2025
*   **Early-registration deadline:** Wed 28 May 2025
*   **Final Notification:** Mon 19 May 2025
*   **Author Response:** Mon 12 May 2025
*   **Review Notification:** Fri 9 May 2025

## Committees

### Organizing Committee

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 17th International Conference on Applications of Graph Theory in Wireless Ad hoc Networks and Sensor Networks (GRAPH-HOC 2025) will provide an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology and applications of Graph Theory in Wireless Ad hoc Networks and Sensor Networks. The conference seeks significant contributions to all major fields of applications in Graph Theory within Wireless Ad hoc Networks and Sensor Networks, in both theoretical and practical aspects.

GRAPH-HOC 2025 is a **hybrid** event, allowing registered authors to present their work **online or face to face**.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to contribute by submitting articles that illustrate research results, projects, surveying works, and industrial experiences describing significant advances in the following areas, but not limited to:

*   Algorithms for Scheduling and Resource Allocation Problems
*   Algorithms for Topology Control and Power Assignment
*   Applications of Random Graph Theory in Ad Hoc Networks and Sensor Networks
*   Approximation Heuristics for NP-complete problems related to Ad Hoc Networks
*   Connectivity Analysis under Different Mobility Models
*   Data Gathering Algorithms and Protocols for Sensor Networks
*   Distributed extensions of centralized graph theoretic routing algorithms
*   Evacuation Routing Algorithms and Protocols for Vehicular Ad Hoc Networks
*   Secure Routing Algorithms and Protocols Based on Graph Theory

## Paper Submission

Authors are invited to submit papers through the conference [Submission System](../submission/index.php) by **July 05, 2025**.

Submissions must be original and should not have been published previously or be under consideration for publication while being evaluated for this conference.

*   **Format:** Submit a full paper (CSCP format: **20 Pages** including figures and references).
*   **Templates:** Accepted papers will be given guidelines in preparing and submitting the final manuscript(s) along with the notification of acceptance.

## Post Conference Proceedings

The proceedings of the conference will be published by Computer Science Conference Proceedings in Computer Science & Information Technology (CS & IT) series (Confirmed).

All accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings.

## Selected Papers for Journals

Selected outstanding papers will be invited to submit extended versions for consideration of publication in the following journals:

*   International Journal of Ad hoc, sensor & Ubiquitous Computing (IJASUC)
*   International Journal of Advanced Smart Sensor Network Systems (IJASSN)
*   International Journal on AdHoc Networking Systems (IJANS)
*   Information Technology in Industry (ITII)

## Registration Requirement

At least one author of accepted papers is required to register at the full registration rate.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** **July 05, 2025**
*   **Authors Notification:** **July 12, 2025**
*   **Registration & Camera-Ready Paper Due:** **July 15, 2025**

## Contact Us

[graphhoc@cseit2025.org](mailto:graphhoc@cseit2025.org)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: HAIS 2025

The 20th International Conference on Hybrid Artificial Intelligence Systems (HAIS 2025) aims to combine symbolic and sub-symbolic techniques to construct more robust and reliable problem-solving models. This multidisciplinary research field provides opportunities to present and discuss the latest theoretical advances and real-world applications.

HAIS 2025 is a joint event with SOCO-CISIS-ICEUTE-HAIS & Startup OLÉ.

## Scope

HAIS focuses on hybrid intelligent systems due to their capabilities in handling complex real-world problems involving imprecision, uncertainty, vagueness, and high-dimensionality. For detailed topics, please visit: [https://haisconference.eu/general-information/scope](https://haisconference.eu/general-information/scope).

## Important Dates

*   **Special Sessions proposal deadline:** March 15, 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** June 10, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** June 25, 2025
*   **Submission of revised papers:** July 10, 2025
*   **Final version submission:** July 15, 2025
*   **Payment deadline:** July 20, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** October 16-17, 2025

## Paper Submission & Publication

*   All submissions will be refereed by experts based on originality, significance, quality, and clarity. Each paper will be reviewed by at least three members of the Program Committee.
*   **Publisher:** Springer, Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence – LNAI (part of LNCS).
*   **Paper Length:** Maximum of twelve (12) pages, including figures and bibliography. Additional pages (over 12) will be charged 150 euros per page.
*   **Formatting:** Papers must be prepared according to the LNCS-LNAI style template. Templates are available at: [https://haisconference.eu/general-information/paper-submission-publication](https://haisconference.eu/general-information/paper-submission-publication).
*   **Submission System:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=hais2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=hais2025).

## Special Issues

Accepted papers may be considered for inclusion in a special issue of **Neurocomputing (ELSEVIER)** with a 2024 JCR Impact Factor of 5.5 (Q1).

## Call for Special Sessions

Researchers interested in organizing special sessions are invited to submit proposals by **March 15, 2025**. Proposals should include:

*   Title of the special session and conference.
*   Name of chair/co-chairs, emails, and affiliations.
*   A description of the session's content.
*   A list of at least 10 international reviewers.
*   A description of the dissemination plan.

Send proposals to: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es).

## Registration

At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and pay the fee to ensure inclusion in the proceedings. For details on registration and fees, please visit: [https://haisconference.eu/registration/registration-fees](https://haisconference.eu/registration/registration-fees).

## Contact

For conference-related issues, please contact: [hector.quintian@udc.es](mailto:hector.quintian@udc.es).

callForPapers:
# HAI 2025: Call for Full Papers

The 13th International Conference on Human-Agent Interaction (HAI 2025) aims to be a major interdisciplinary forum for discussing and disseminating the latest research and results that have an impact beyond the boundaries of conventional interaction, including robots, software agents, and human-to-human communication via digital media. HAI brings together researchers from fields such as engineering, computer science, psychology, and sociology, and covers a wide range of topics, including human-robot interaction, affective computing, computer-supported cooperative work, games and serious games, and artificial intelligence, among others. This conference is held in cooperation with ACM.

The theme of HAI 2025 is **“Interaction and Imagination”**. With the development of generative AI, many agent systems have been proposed, and the methodology of human-agent interaction is at the stage of being implemented in society. At this stage, we believe it is necessary to re-examine the new future of human society that human-agent interaction will bring, from interaction to imagination. We welcome all submissions related to HAI, but especially encourage submissions that align with the theme of HAI 2025. The HAI conference welcomes submissions from a wide range of fields, including engineering, computer science, psychology, sociology, cognitive science, business, marketing, and design.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   studies of Human-Agent Interaction, with quantitative/qualitative results
*   theoretical models
*   technological advances
*   experimental methods
*   impacts of embodiment
*   character and avatar design
*   agents in applications, e.g. self-driving cars, social networks
*   agents in business and marking
*   experience design
*   autonomous and adaptive agents/systems
*   multi-agent interaction
*   social simulation

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** HAI 2025 will accept only online submissions of PDF files. All submissions will be reviewed by three reviewers and will receive a meta review for quality assurance. The paper will be evaluated on the basis of research originality, excellence, and significance, and relevance to HAI. We also invite position papers, preliminary (but high impact) studies, and concept papers.
*   **Page Limit:** The page limit for full papers is **8 pages** (+ extra pages for references only). Submissions exceeding eight pages of content, excluding references, will be subject to desk rejection and will not undergo review.
*   **Templates:**
    *   **LaTeX:** [https://portalparts.acm.org/hippo/latex_templates/acmart-primary.zip](https://portalparts.acm.org/hippo/latex_templates/acmart-primary.zip)
    *   **Microsoft Word:** [https://authors.acm.org/binaries/content/assets/publications/taps/acm_submission_template.docx](https://authors.acm.org/binaries/content/assets/publications/taps/acm_submission_template.docx)
*   **Anonymization:** All submissions should be anonymized. Please remove all author information, including references to your own work and institutions. If references must be made, make them in the third person. If a person appears in an image who may be recognized as an author, please blur their face. If possible, please list your paper number (assigned by the submission system) in your paper instead of your name.
*   **Duplicate Submissions:** HAI 2025 does not allow duplicate submission. These papers will be automatically rejected without further review.
*   **Preprint Repositories:** Authors may upload their papers to preprint repositories such as arXiv.org before submission. However, the authors should anonymize their submission because HAI 2025 uses a double-blind review.

## Important Dates

Note: All deadlines are based on end of day (23:59) AoE time zone.

*   **Full paper submissions Deadline (Extended):** June 17th, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** August 7th, 2025

## Submission Link

Please submit your papers here: [https://new.precisionconference.com/user/login?society=hai](https://new.precisionconference.com/user/login?society=hai)

## Contact

Any questions can be directed at the following address: [hailabsec@gmail.com](mailto:hailabsec@gmail.com)

callForPapers:
# BCS HCI 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to BCS HCI 2025! This year, Cardiff University is hosting the British Computer Society’s Special Interest Group in Human Computer Interaction Conference (BCS HCI 2025), taking place in-person from **November 8th to 11th, 2025**.

The conference theme is **HCI4AI – Human Centred Approaches and their Impact on AI system design, application, and evaluation**. We invite researchers, practitioners, and academics to submit their work.

## Conference Tracks

### Research Papers

We invite researchers, practitioners, and academics to submit original full research papers. This track provides an opportunity for authors to present comprehensive studies, groundbreaking research, and significant developments in the field of HCI.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Notification: **18th July 2025**.
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **31st August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Research Papers Chairs](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#papers).

### Futures

The Futures track offers a unique platform to envision the future of a specific area, discipline, or topic. It invites authors to submit forward-looking perspectives grounded in their expertise and existing scholarship, which may offer predictions or flesh out possibilities through speculative design, design fiction or visions of a future. Submissions should be thought-provoking and discussion-oriented.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Extended Submission Deadline: **27th June 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **18th July 2025** (Juried by committee).
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **31st August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Futures Chairs](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#futures).

### Workshops, Masterclasses, and Panels

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Participant submissions due (on or before): **July 4th, 2025**.
    *   Participants notified of acceptance (on or before): **August 8th, 2025**.
    *   Workshops and Masterclasses: **November 8th and 9th, 2025**.
    *   Panels: **November 10th and 11th 2025**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Workshops, Masterclasses, and Panels Chairs](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#workmap).

### Posters

The poster track provides an excellent opportunity for researchers, practitioners, and students to present and discuss work in progress, late-breaking results, and novel ideas in an interactive format.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Submission Deadline: **22nd July 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **22nd August 2025**.
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **29th August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Posters Chair](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#posters).

### Community

This track challenges traditional conference presentation formats. It invites researchers to dive deeper, reflect more critically, and engage the community in more meaningful conversations about already published, groundbreaking, work.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Submission Deadline: **8th August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **29th August 2025** (Juried by committee).
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Community Chairs](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#community).

### Interactions and Demos

The Interactions and Demos track provides a platform to showcase interactive artefacts, installations, novel systems, prototypes, and experiences.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Round 2 Submission Deadline: **17th June 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **18th July 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **1st August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Interactions Chairs](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#interactions).

### Late Breaking Work (LBW)

Late-Breaking Work (LBW) is an opportunity for researchers, practitioners, and industry professionals to present emerging ideas, preliminary results, and novel concepts in areas of HCI.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Submission Deadline: **22nd July 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **5th September 2025**.
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **9th September 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Late Breaking Work Chair](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#lbw).

### Doctoral Consortium

The Doctoral Consortium provides an opportunity for research students to present and discuss their dissertation research with senior researchers and other students.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Submission Deadline: **1st July 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **18th July 2025** (Juried by committee).
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **31st August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Doctoral Consortium Chairs](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#dc).

### Research and Design Competition

This competition challenges participants to envision and create innovative solutions to clearly identified problems within the scope of this year’s conference theme.

*   **Important Dates:**
    *   Submission Deadline: **22nd July 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
    *   Notification: **5th August 2025** (Juried by committee).
    *   Camera-Ready Deadline: **12th August 2025 @ 23:59 GMT**.
*   **Inquiries:** Contact the [Research and Design Competition](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/committee/#rand).

## Topics of Interest

The conference theme is **HCI4AI – Human Centred Approaches and their Impact on AI system design, application, and evaluation**. A wide range of topics are welcome, as listed on the main [programme page](https://users.cs.cf.ac.uk/FinneganD/hci-2025/programme/).

## Contacts

*   **General Chairs:**
    *   Daniel J. Finnegan and Nervo Verdezoto Dias
    *   Email: [general@britchi2025.co.uk](mailto:general@britchi2025.co.uk)
*   **Technical Programme Chairs:**
    *   Effie Law and Fernando Loizides
    *   Email: [programme@britchi2025.co.uk](mailto:programme@britchi2025.co.uk)
*   **Papers Chairs:**
    *   Corina Sas and Aneesha Singh
    *   Email: [papers@britchi2025.co.uk](mailto:papers@britchi2025.co.uk)

callForPapers:
# Global WordNet Conference 2025 (GWC2025): Call for Papers

Welcome to the website of the Global WordNet Conference 2025! The GWC2025 conference will be held in **Pavia, Italy**, from **January 27-31, 2025**.

The conference is organized under the auspices of the Global WordNet Association, the Dipartment of Humanities at the University of Pavia, and the Italian Association of Computational Linguistics (AILC), and is supported by Almo Collegio Borromeo, Fondazione Ghislieri, Comune di Pavia - Assessorato Pubblica istruzione e Formazione professionale, and NTT Data.

## Keynote Speakers

*   Rada Mihalcea (University of Michigan)
*   Marco Passarotti (Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore Milano)
*   Piek Vossen (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

## Important Dates

*   **New Paper Submission Deadline:** October 14, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** November 25, 2024
*   **Camera-Ready Submission Deadline:** January 10, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** January 27-31, 2025
*   **Final Paper Submission for Proceedings:** February 28, 2025

## Submission Information

We solicit contributions for the conference. More details can be found on the [Call for Papers](https://unipv-larl.github.io/GWC2025/cfp.html) page.

## Registration

Information about registration can be found at [Registration](https://unipv-larl.github.io/GWC2025/registration.html).

## Social Program

Details about the social program, including guided tours, can be found on the website. The deadline to sign up for the social program is Wednesday, January 15.

## Wi-Fi Information

*   Wi-Fi Network: `GLOBALWORDCONF2025`
*   Password: `W0rdgl0bal25!`

## Pre-conference Teach-in

A pre-conference teach-in titled "From Language to Action: How LLMs are Shaping Modern Business Strategies" by Angela Caiazza (NTT DATA Italia) will be held. Reservations are needed. [Register here](https://www.eventbrite.it/e/biglietti-global-wordnet-conference-gwc2025-1116337227699).

## Project Funding and Maintenance

This project is funded through the European Union Funding Program – NextGenerationEU – Missione 4 Istruzione e ricerca - componente 2, investimento 1.1” Fondo per il Programma Nazionale della Ricerca (PNR) e Progetti di Ricerca di Rilevante Interesse Nazionale (PRIN)” progetto PRIN_2022 2022YAPFNJ “Linked WordNet for Indo-European Languages” CUP F53D2300490 0001 - Dipartimento Studi Umanistici (Università di Pavia).

This project is maintained by unipv-larl and hosted on GitHub Pages.

callForPapers:
# Haskell Symposium 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM SIGPLAN Haskell Symposium 2025 will be co-located with the 2025 International Conference on Functional Programming (ICFP) and the 2025 International Conference on Systems, Programming, Languages and Applications: Software for Humanity (SPLASH).

The Haskell Symposium presents original research on Haskell, discusses practical experience and future development of the language, and promotes other forms of declarative programming.

## New this year

In addition to the regular **Call for Papers** track, a separate **Call for Talks** track is announced.

## Keynotes

*   **Simon Peyton Jones** (TBD)
*   **Richard A. Eisenberg** (TBD)

## Call for Talks

Talk proposals need not be full-length and should report work in progress relevant to Haskell language design, theory, tools, or applications. Proposals will be evaluated for novelty and relevance to the Haskell community, but finished results are not expected.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   **Language design:** Extensions, modifications, and critical discussions of Haskell.
*   **Theory:** Formal semantics, type systems, effects, metatheory, and foundations for program analysis and transformation.
*   **Implementations:** Program analysis, compilation (static/dynamic), memory management, foreign function interfaces.
*   **Libraries:** Demonstrating new ideas or techniques for functional programming in Haskell.
*   **Tools:** Profilers, tracers, debuggers, preprocessors, and testing tools.
*   **Applications:** Scientific computing, symbolic computing, databases, multimedia, telecommunication, the web, etc.
*   **Functional Pearls:** Elegant and instructive programming examples.
*   **Experience Reports:** Documenting general practice and experience in education, industry, or other contexts.
*   **Tutorials:** Explaining Haskell language features, programming techniques, tools, or libraries.
*   **System Demonstrations:** Showcasing running software rather than novel research results.

## Submission Details

*   **Formatting:** Papers should be in Portable Document Format (PDF), using ACM SIGPLAN style guidelines and the `acmart` format with the `sigplan` sub-format. Line numbers are recommended for reviews.
*   **Review Process:** Lightweight double-blind reviewing will be used. Authors must omit names and institutions and refer to their own work in the third person.
*   **Page Limits:**
    *   Regular paper: **12 pages**
    *   Functional pearl: **12 pages**
    *   Tutorial: **12 pages**
    *   Experience report: **6 pages**
    *   Demo proposal: **2 pages**
    *   *Note: References are not counted against these limits.* 
*   **Supplementary Material:** Optional, submitted as a separate PDF or tarball. Can be anonymized or non-anonymized.
*   **Resubmitted Papers:** Authors may attach annotated reviews from previous submissions.

## Deadlines

*   **Paper submission deadline:** **9 June 2025** (Monday, Anywhere on Earth - UTC-12h)
*   **Author Notification:** **17 July 2025** (Thursday)

## Submission Platform

Papers should be submitted through HotCRP at: [https://haskell25.hotcrp.com/](https://haskell25.hotcrp.com/)

## Proceedings and Artifacts

Accepted papers will be included in the ACM Digital Library. Authors will choose their copyright options. Accepted system demonstrations will be posted on the symposium website but not formally published. Authors are encouraged to make auxiliary material (artifacts) available, which can be published alongside their paper in the ACM Digital Library to qualify for the "Artifacts Available" badge.

## Contact

For questions, please contact the chairs at: ningningxie@cs.toronto.edu and garrett-morris@uiowa.edu.

callForPapers:
# HCist 2025: Call for Papers

It is our great pleasure to invite you to the **14th edition** of HCist - International Conference on Health and Social Care Information Systems and Technologies.

The conference will be held in **Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates**, from **November 26-28, 2025**, and will be co-located with the CENTERIS and ProjMAN conferences.

HCist is the place where academics, scientists, healthcare IT professionals, and solution providers from all over the world have the opportunity to share experiences, bring new ideas, debate issues, and introduce the latest developments in the largely multidisciplinary field embraced by Health and Social Care Information Systems and Technologies (HCist).

## Call for Papers

The **2nd call for papers for HCist 2025 is now open!**

## Topics of Interest

The conference embraces the multidisciplinary field of Health and Social Care Information Systems and Technologies. Topics include, but are not limited to, the latest developments and best practices in:

*   Health and Social Care IT/IS
*   Leveraging health and social care through people, processes, and information systems.

## Important Dates (2nd Call)

*   **Paper submission deadline:** July 31, 2025
*   **Notification of results:** September 15, 2025
*   **Revised version due:** October 3, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** November 26-28, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions will be reviewed on a **double-blind review basis**.
*   Only original contributions will be accepted.
*   **Submit a paper:** [https://www.scika.org/openconfs/openconfHCist](https://www.scika.org/openconfs/openconfHCist)
*   **Paper template:** Available via [Submission Guidelines](?page=submissionguidelines).

## Contribution Types

*   Full papers
*   Short papers
*   Poster papers
*   Industry papers

## Publications

*   All papers accepted as **full or short papers** will be in the conference proceedings, to be published by **Elsevier** as a Procedia Computer Science series volume. This series is indexed by **Scopus and Clarivate Conference Proceedings Citation Index - Web of Science (former ISI Thomson)** and will be available on Sciverse ScienceDirect.
*   **Poster papers and industry papers** will be published in a conference book of abstracts, industry and poster papers (with ISBN).
*   Authors of selected papers will be invited to extend their papers for publication in international journals or in edited books.

## Contact

*   Email: [secretariat@hcist.scika.org](mailto:secretariat@hcist.scika.org)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 10th International Conference on Computing and Informatics (ICOCI 2025), themed **"Beyond Binary: AI, Humanity, and The Dawn of IR 5.0"**, will be held from **25 - 27 June 2025** at the **Santika Dyandra Hotel & Convention, Medan, INDONESIA**.

ICOCI 2025 is organized by the School of Computing, Universiti Utara Malaysia (UUM) and provides a distinguished platform for researchers, academics, practitioners, and industry professionals to engage in discussions on cutting-edge research and innovations in computing and informatics.

## Topics of Interest

ICOCI 2025 invites submissions in the field of computing that foster the theme "Beyond Binary: AI, Humanity, and The Dawn of IR 5.0". Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
*   Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)
*   Natural Language Processing (NLP)
*   Cybersecurity & Privacy
*   Responsible AI and AI governance
*   AI for Social Good
*   Explainable AI (XAI)
*   AI in Education and Adaptive Learning Systems
*   IoT and network
*   Adaptive mobile and pervasive computing
*   Collaborative software and systems
*   Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality
*   Emerging Topics in AI: Emotional AI, Digital Twins, and Sustainable AI

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission:** **5 March 2025**
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Starting **18 March 2025**
*   **Camera Ready:** **18 April 2025**
*   **Registration & Payment Deadline:** **20 May 2025**
*   **Conference Date:** **25 - 27 June 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

### Format for paper submission

*   Authors must prepare manuscripts using Microsoft Word.
*   Manuscripts should be between **4,000 to 6,000 words** or a minimum of **12 pages**, not exceeding **14 pages**.
*   Strictly follow the [ICOCI2025 Template](ICOCI2025_Template.docx).

### Double-Blind Review Process

*   All submissions are subjected to a double-blind review process.
*   Authors must submit **TWO (2) manuscript files**:
    1.  A manuscript with complete authors’ names and affiliations, and acknowledgements.
    2.  A manuscript WITHOUT authors’ names, affiliations, and acknowledgements for the double-blind review process.
*   **Guidelines for anonymizing your paper:**
    *   Do not put author details on the front page.
    *   Avoid referring to your university, campus, or faculty by name; use generalities.
    *   Avoid statements like 'In the previous work, we...'.
    *   Omit the acknowledgment section (can be added in the final version).
*   Submissions containing identifying information will be returned for modification.

### Pre-review checklist

Ensure your manuscript fulfills the following requirements:

1.  Title – relates to the conference theme.
2.  Structures – Abstract, Keywords, Introduction, Related Work, Methodology, Results, Discussion, Conclusion.
3.  Pages – between 12 to 14.
4.  Figures, diagrams, charts, tables – visible, readable, clear, and comply to template style.
5.  Language & mechanics.
6.  Acknowledgement – include funding agencies (if any).
7.  Submit TWO (2) versions of files: (1) With author names and affiliations, (2) Without author names and affiliations.

### How to submit

Authors can submit their papers through the online submission system:

[== Submission System ==](https://icoci.soc-conferences.com/author/login.php)

## Contribution Types

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 6-10 pages, oral presentation) Included in proceedings, posted in digital library, sent for indexing.
*   **Short papers (work in progress):** (up to 4 pages, oral presentation) Published in conference proceedings, digital library, sent for indexing.
*   **Ideas contributions:** (2 pages, oral presentation) Published in conference proceedings, digital library, sent for indexing.
*   **Extended abstracts:** (2 pages, oral presentation) Published in conference proceedings, digital library, sent for indexing.
*   **Posters (paper-based):** (2 pages, oral presentation) Published in conference proceedings, digital library, sent for indexing.
*   **Posters (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation) Slide-deck posted on www.iaria.org.
*   **Presentations (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation) Slide-deck posted on www.iaria.org.
*   **Demos:** (2 pages) Posted on www.iaria.org.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published in one of the following SCOPUS-indexed publications:

*   Journal of Information and Communication Technology (JICT)
*   Jurnal Online Informatika (JOIN)
*   Book Series: From Smart Cities to The Metaverse (Publisher: Taylor & Francis)

## Registration Fees

| Category              | Local    | International |
| :-------------------- | :------- | :------------ |
| **Presenter**         | RM 1800  | RM 1800       |
| **Listener**          | RM 500   | RM 500        |

*   Authors must make the payment by **20th May 2025**. Failure to do so may result in the article not being published in the proceedings.
*   Standard registration fees (presenters) include conference admission, e-proceedings, and e-program book.
*   Each presenter (author) is allowed to register for only ONE additional paper and will receive only one set of conference materials.
*   Accommodation fee is not included.
*   There will be no refund for withdrawal made after 20th May 2025. A management fee of 6% from the total fee will be charged for refund made before or by 20th May 2025.

### How to pay

*   **Payment Evidence:** Please forward a scanned copy of the bank slip/telegraphic transfer receipt to ICOCI 2025 Secretariat (icoci@uum.edu.my and cc to anizamd@uum.edu.my). Include participant's name, date and time of transfer, and country & city of origin.

### International Presenters/Participants

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICONIP 2025

The **32nd International Conference on Neural Information Processing (ICONIP 2025)**, the annual flagship conference of the Asia Pacific Neural Network Society (APNNS) and the 35th Annual Meeting of the Japanese Neural Network Society (JNNS), will be held from **November 20th to November 24th, 2025**, at the **Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (OIST), Japan**.

ICONIP 2025 aims to provide a high-level international forum for scientists, researchers, educators, industrial professionals, and students worldwide to present the state of research and development, address new challenges, and discuss trends in neural information processing theory and applications.

The conference employs a **single-blind paper reviewing process**. The conference will be an **in-person event**, and authors must be available to present at the conference.

## Publication

Proceedings will be published in the **Springer series of Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) and Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS)**. All accepted papers will be open access from OpenReview about two weeks before the conference.

Detailed author instructions and the Springer template can be found [here](https://iconip2025.proofsheet-site.jp/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Springer_Instructions_for_Authors_of_Proceedings_CS.pdf).

## ICONIP 2025 Submission Instructions

*   **Paper Length:** Must be between **12 and 15 pages** (including figures, references, and appendix) in Springer LNCS/LNAI format.
*   **Format:** PDF submission using the Springer LNCS/LNAI style. LaTeX is highly recommended.
*   **Submission Portal:** Electronic submission to OpenReview at [https://openreview.net/group?id=apnns.org/ICONIP/2025/Conference](https://openreview.net/group?id=apnns.org/ICONIP/2025/Conference).
*   **Account:** An OpenReview account is required for submission. Create one as soon as possible.
*   **URLs:** Reviewers are not required to review URLs included in papers.

## Topics of the Conference

ICONIP2025 invites high-quality contributions covering, but not limited to, the following topics:

### Theory and Algorithms
*   Machine learning
*   Explainable AI
*   Neural network models
*   Neurodynamics
*   Responsible AI

### Computational Neurosciences
*   Models of learning and cognition
*   Neural data analysis
*   Brain-machine interface
*   Computational psychiatry

### Applications and Frontiers
*   Big data analysis
*   Generative AI
*   Natural language processing
*   Robotics and control
*   Healthcare
*   Information security
*   Neuromorphic hardware
*   Privacy and security for AI

## Important Dates

*   **Special session proposal deadline:** March 1st
*   **Workshop proposal deadline:** March 1st
*   **Tutorial proposal deadline:** May 1st
*   **Paper submission deadline:** May 15th / May 22nd AoE (May 23rd at noon UTC)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 15th
*   **Camera-ready submission:** August 15th
*   **Early registration deadline:** August 15th
*   **Conference dates:** November 20-24, 2025
