callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - ICMV 2025

## Welcome to ICMV 2025

The **18th International Conference on Machine Vision (ICMV 2025)** will take place from **October 19-22, 2025**, in **Paris, France**. ICMV has evolved into a premier platform for exploring the latest advancements in machine vision and its transformative applications. This year's conference will delve into the latest research, theories, and applications that are driving innovation in machine vision, emphasizing its role as a core driver of digital transformation.

We invite researchers, academics, and industry professionals to submit high-quality, original research papers that address all aspects of machine vision, including theory, principles, algorithms, practices, and applications. Selected papers will be presented through oral sessions, poster presentations, and invited talks.

## Topics of Interest

The theoretical bases of Machine Vision provide the groundwork for developing algorithms and systems that can analyze and interpret visual data effectively. These include:

### Theoretical Bases:
*   Image Formation
*   Image Processing
*   Feature Extraction
*   Pattern Recognition
*   Deep learning/Neural networks
*   Computer Vision Algorithms
*   3D Reconstruction
*   Geometric Transformations
*   Machine/Deep Learning
*   Human Vision Models

Machine vision fields leverage advanced technologies that enhance efficiency, accuracy, and decision-making across various sectors. These encompass:

### Machine Vision Fields and Applications:
*   Industrial Automation
*   Medical Imaging
*   Robotics
*   Autonomous Vehicles
*   Agricultural Technology
*   Surveillance and Security
*   Augmented and Virtual Reality
*   Retail and E-commerce
*   Sports Analytics
*   Environmental Monitoring

## Submission Guidance

*   **Submission Types:** Full paper and abstract are acceptable.
*   **Electronic Submission System:** Please send your contributions to [http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icmv2025](http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icmv2025).
*   **Special Sessions:** If you are interested in organizing special sessions, please email: [secretary@icmv.org](mailto:secretary@icmv.org).

## Key Dates

### For Papers and Abstracts:
*   **Submission Deadline:** July 05, 2025
*   **Notification Day:** by July 25, 2025
*   **Registration Deadline:** August 10, 2025

### For Special Sessions:
*   **Proposal Deadline:** August 05, 2025
*   **Notification:** August 10, 2025
*   **Complete Set of Special Session:** August 15, 2025

**Conference Dates:** October 19-22, 2025

## Publication

ICMV 2025 accepted and presented papers can be published by SPIE and will be included in:
*   SPIE Digital Library
*   Web of Science Conference Proceedings Citation Index-Science
*   Scopus
*   Ei Compendex

## Special Issues

Excellent papers with extensions from ICMV 2025 can be recommended for publication in SPIE Journals:
*   Journal of Electronic Imaging
*   Journal of Applied Remote Sensing
*   Journal of Medical Imaging
*   Journal of Optical Engineering

## Sponsor Opportunity

We are open to any kind of sponsorships. Should you have any further suggestions, please do not hesitate to contact us at [secretary@icmv.org](mailto:secretary@icmv.org).

## Conference Venue

The conference will be held in **Paris, France**. Further details are pending.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE ICNP 2025

The 33rd IEEE International Conference on Network Protocols (ICNP 2025) will be held in **Seoul, South Korea, September 22-25, 2025**.

ICNP 2025 is the premier conference covering all aspects of network protocol research, including design, analysis, specification, verification, implementation, and performance.

## Scope

The conference is soliciting paper submissions with significant research contributions to network protocol research. Both experimental studies and formal investigations are equally welcome. Topics traditionally of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Applying AI/ML to improve networks
*   Network protocols for improving AI/ML
*   Blockchain, distributed systems, network aspects of reliable systems
*   Data center and cloud networking
*   Host networking
*   Next-generation network architectures
*   IoT networks
*   Measurement, monitoring, and troubleshooting
*   Network management
*   Network virtualization
*   Programmable networks
*   Quantum networking
*   Routing and load balancing
*   Security and privacy, applied cryptography for supporting network functions
*   Software-defined networking
*   Testing and verification
*   Theoretical aspects, analysis, network algorithms
*   Transport and congestion control
*   Wide-area networks
*   Wireless networks, including cellular, satellite, and sensor networks

Authors unsure whether their submissions fit the scope are welcome to contact the Program Committee Co-Chairs.

## Important Dates

*   **Title / Abstract registration:** May 9, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Full paper submission:** May 16, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Rebuttal:** July 7-10, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 25, 2025
*   **Camera ready version:** August 18, 2025

## Paper Formatting

*   Paper submissions should adhere to the IEEE Conference formatting requirements using the templates available [here](http://www.ieee-icnp.org/).
*   Submissions should not exceed **10 pages** excluding references and well-marked appendices.
*   Authors are responsible for producing readable submissions that comply with the formatting constraints. Violating the formatting requirements will result in a submission being returned without review.
*   Authors who have developed software or collected data for the paper are encouraged to release their artefacts and describe them in the submitted paper. To preserve anonymity, artefacts should only be publicly released upon paper acceptance.

## Submission and Anonymity Policy

*   Papers submitted to the conference will be reviewed through a **double-blind review process**.
*   Authors must remove all identifiers (names, emails, affiliations) from the title page.
*   Remove acknowledgments of and identifiers of funding sources.
*   Use anonymous names for files.
*   Refer to your own related work in the third person.
*   While it is permissible for authors to give local talks and release their paper on a non-peer-reviewed location (e.g., arXiv), care should be exercised to limit public exposure.

## Submission and Plagiarism Policy

*   Papers must present original contributions and cannot be previously published or under review elsewhere.
*   Papers containing plagiarized materials will be subject to the [IEEE plagiarism policy](https://www.comsoc.org/publications/ieee-communications-society-policy-plagiarism-and-multiple-submissions) and will be rejected without review.

## Rebuttal Phase

Authors will have an opportunity to respond to preliminary reviews.

## Best Paper Award and Fast-Track Journal Publication

One accepted paper will receive the Best Paper award and will be fast-tracked to the IEEE/ACM Transactions on Networking.

## Presentation and Registration Requirements

ICNP 2025 will be held physically in person in Seoul, South Korea. At least one author of any accepted paper must register for the conference at the **full rate** and present the paper at the conference. Any paper not presented by an author will be withdrawn from the proceedings and IEEE Xplore.

callForPapers:
# ICTIR 2025: Call for Papers

The 11th ACM SIGIR / 15th International Conference on Innovative Concepts and Theories in Information Retrieval (ICTIR 2025) invites submissions with substantial and original research on innovative and foundational contributions to the field of Information Retrieval.

**Foundation** is defined as a scientific result that others can build upon and use for their own research. This includes original research on the theoretical aspects of Information Retrieval, topics from neighboring fields with a strong and clear connection to Information Retrieval, and novel approaches and methods for developing, improving, and evaluating models related to the field of Information Retrieval.

The conference welcomes papers on all aspects of Information Retrieval. See the [Call for Papers for SIGIR 2025](https://sigir2025.dei.unipd.it/call-full-papers.html) for a list of included topics. Topics from neighboring fields are also in scope, as long as there is a clear and significant connection to Information Retrieval.

## Submission Types

New to ICTIR, we welcome two types of submissions:

*   **Regular submissions**
*   **SIGIR-Revise-and-Resubmit (SIGIR-RR) submissions**

### SIGIR-Revise-and-Resubmit (SIGIR-RR) Submissions

SIGIR-RR submissions are for revised manuscripts of papers that were submitted to but not accepted by the SIGIR 2025 conference (only full and short paper tracks). Authors can use this option to address the issues raised in the SIGIR 2025 reviews and revise the paper accordingly.

In addition to the revised paper, the authors must attach the following information to the submitted PDF file:

*   **Explanation (1-3 pages with no style requirements):** A text including the SIGIR paper ID and responses to the SIGIR reviews, explaining how the issues raised by the SIGIR reviewers have been addressed in the revised paper.
*   **SIGIR submission:** The original anonymized submission file to SIGIR 2025.

## Special Theme

**“LLMs + IR, what could possibly go wrong?”**

Even though ICTIR 2025 welcomes papers on all areas of Information Retrieval as detailed above, its program especially welcomes research papers related to the following theme. This theme stands on the long-term relationship between LLMs and IR. In order to foster a lively discussion on this theme, we are seeking both innovative and foundational technical research papers and discussion papers that methodologically study this theme by providing impactful perspectives, opinions, or positions on the matter.

If you think you can make a strong contribution to the panel on this theme, but are unable to submit a paper, please reach out to the PC chairs at [pc-ictir2025@listes.isir.upmc.fr](mailto:pc-ictir2025@listes.isir.upmc.fr), with one abstract (1 page), articulating a talking point, and a short speaker bio.

## Double-blind Reviewing and Submissions to arXiv

The conference will employ a **lightweight double-blind reviewing process**.

*   A submission should not reveal the identity of the authors in any obvious way. In particular, the authors’ names, affiliations, or email addresses should be nowhere visible in the submission. Any reference to the authors’ own related work should be in the third person (that is, don’t say “our” when referring to such work).
*   If sharing code, make sure it is anonymous (e.g., using Anonymous GitHub and removing author names from it).
*   Nothing should be done in the name of anonymity that weakens the submission or makes the job of reviewing the paper more difficult. Important references should be neither omitted nor anonymized.
*   Authors may post drafts of their papers on the web, submit them to arXiv, or give talks about them.

## Submission Guidelines and Formal Requirements

*   We encourage authors to follow [this brief checklist](https://ictir2025.cs.umass.edu/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Checklist.pdf) to strengthen an IR paper.
*   Research papers must describe original work that has not been previously published, not accepted for publication elsewhere, and not simultaneously submitted or currently under review in another journal or conference (including any archival workshops at SIGIR 2025).
*   The page limit is **9 pages** in ACM SIGIR style, excluding the references and the optional appendix. Shorter papers are equally welcome; the 9 pages is an upper bound, not a target.
*   By submitting your article to an ACM Publication, you are acknowledging that you and your co-authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies, including [ACM’s new Publications Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/research-involving-human-participants-and-subjects).
*   Please ensure that you and your co-authors obtain an ORCID ID, as well as an OpenReview account.

### Format Requirements

*   Submissions must be in English, in **PDF format**.
*   The length limit is at most **9 pages** (including figures, tables, proofs, acknowledgments, and any content except references and optional appendices).
*   Use the current ACM two-column conference format.
*   Suitable LaTeX, Word, and Overleaf templates are available from the [ACM Website](https://authors.acm.org/conferences/production-information/acm-conference-author-instructions) (use the “sigconf” proceedings template for LaTeX and the Interim Template for Word).
*   For LaTeX, the following should be used when submitting the paper:
    ```latex
    \documentclass[sigconf,natbib=true,anonymous=true]{acmart}
    ```
*   Submissions must be anonymous and should be submitted electronically via [OpenReview](https://openreview.net/group?id=ACM.org/SIGIR/ICTIR/2025/Conference).

## Presentation at the Conference

*   At least one author of an accepted paper must register and present the work at ICTIR 2025.
*   The works will be presented either as a long or short talk, with an optional poster presentation or invitation to a panel.

## Key Dates

*   **Paper submission deadline:** Thursday, April 24, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** Thursday, June 5, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** Thursday, June 26, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Conference date:** Friday, July 18, 2025 (AoE)

## Contact Information

You can contact the PC chairs via [pc-ictir2025@listes.isir.upmc.fr](mailto:pc-ictir2025@listes.isir.upmc.fr) or the [SIGIR Slack](http://acmsigir.slack.com) channel #ictir2025. For more information, please visit the [Organizers page](https://ictir2025.cs.umass.edu/?page_id=44).

callForPapers:
# ICTERI 2025: Call for Papers (Main Conference)

The call for Papers for ICTERI-2025 Main Conference is **closed**.

This page presents the Call for Papers of the Main Conference track of ICTERI-2025.

## Focus and Approach

ICTERI focuses on **research advances**, **business/academic applications of Information and Communication Technologies**, and the **design and deployment of ICT Infrastructures**. The emphasis is also put on **real-world applications** of ICT solutions.

Therefore, all contributions are strongly encouraged to demonstrate how and to what purpose the proposed solutions are used or transferred into use, for example by:

*   A proof-of-concept implementation
*   A prototype in an advanced stage
*   A case study involving new tools and/or methodological approaches
*   Experimental studies with real use cases, including knowledge or technology transfer

Reports on academic-industrial partnerships for ICT innovation and knowledge transfer are as welcome as technological and methodological submissions.

We solicit submissions of original work, not previously published or submitted for publication elsewhere, that address one or more of the topics within one of the [Conference Tracks](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/main-conference-tracks/).

## Language

The language of the Main ICTERI Conference is **ENGLISH**. A paper submitted in any other language will be rejected without review. Presentations in any other language are also not accepted.

## Submission Types & Evaluation Criteria

For details on paper types and evaluation criteria, please refer to:

*   [Paper Types](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/submission-types/)
*   [Evaluation Criteria](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/evaluation-criteria)

## Presentation Policy

If your paper is accepted for ICTERI 2025, it **must be presented at the conference by one of its authors**, who commit to registering and attending the conference in person. The Program Chairs reserve the right to exclude papers that have not been presented physically at the conference from the published proceedings.

## Important Dates (Main Conference)

All deadlines are "Anywhere on Earth" (23:59Hawaii) time:

*   **Paper abstract submission:** Monday, **April 21, 2025**
*   **Paper submission (all paper types) – extended deadline:** Monday, May 05, 2025 – Monday, **May 12, 2025**
*   **Acceptance notification:** Monday, **July 07, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready papers submission:** Monday, **August 04, 2025**
*   **Registration (authors of accepted papers):** Monday, **August 04, 2025**

## Formatting and Submission Instructions

*   [Formatting Instructions](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/formatting-instructions/)
*   [Annotation Instructions](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/annotation-instructions/)
*   [How to SUBMIT your PAPER](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/paper-for-review/)

## Proceedings and Indexing

ICTERI publishes its proceedings with [Springer in their CCIS Series](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/proceedings-and-indexing/) (pending approval for 2025). Springer CCIS volumes are indexed by:

*   DBLP
*   EI-Compendex
*   Mathematical Reviews
*   SCImago
*   Scopus

## Fees

ICTERI 2025 does **not charge any conference fee**. Participation is **free**. Travel and accommodation are paid by the participants. Sponsors cover the rest of the conference expenses.

## Conference Tracks

For a list of main conference tracks, please visit: [Main Conference Tracks](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/main-conference-tracks/)

## Download Call Leaflet

[Call for Papers in PDF](https://icteri.org/icteri-2025/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/ICTERI-2025-CFP-MC-v.02.pdf)

callForPapers:
# Call for Contributions

The ACM/SPEC International Conference on Performance Engineering (ICPE) is the leading international forum for presenting and discussing novel ideas, innovations, trends, and experiences in the field of performance engineering.

ICPE brings together researchers and practitioners to report state-of-the-art and in-progress research on performance engineering of software, networks, and systems. The conference covers performance modeling, analysis, measurement, benchmark design, and run-time performance management, focusing on classical metrics like response time, throughput, resource utilization, and energy efficiency, as well as their relation to scalability, availability, reliability, cost, and sustainability.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   **Performance Measurement and Empirical Evaluation**: Data collection techniques, simulation, measurement, instrumentation, profiling, controlled experiment design, data-driven experiments, diagnostics, data management and interchange, tool interoperability, statistical analysis, exploration, visualization, visual data mining.
*   **Performance Benchmarking**: Design and standardization process, benchmark suites, investigative benchmarks, benchmark synthesis, benchmark workload generation, benchmarking energy efficiency, resilience, stability, security, and related quality metrics.
*   **Performance Modeling of Software and Systems**: Approaches and metrics for describing performance and related quality attributes, modeling languages and formalisms, modeling methods and tools, explanatory and predictive models, online models, model learning and extraction techniques, model validation and calibration, workload characterization.
*   **Design and Development Processes**: Requirements engineering, agile and experiment-driven techniques, devops, performance-oriented design, software architectures, performance patterns, performance testing, model-driven engineering, humans in the loop, ethical concerns.
*   **Run-time Performance Management and Adaptation**: Adaptive systems, monitoring, autotuning, elasticity and autoscaling, power management, virtualization and consolidation, resource scheduling, capacity management, anomaly detection, service level (definition and monitoring).
*   **Platform-Related Optimizations**: Parallel programming, multi-core and many-core systems, compiler optimizations, managed languages, and runtime optimization, performance and efficiency of hardware accelerators and novel memory systems.

## Systems of Interest

Systems of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Cyber-physical domain, IoT, industrial internet
*   Networked and embedded systems
*   Advanced computer architectures, including non-von Neumann
*   Communication networks, wireless and mobile
*   Peer-to-peer environments, ad-hoc networks
*   Machine learning and AI-based systems
*   SOA, microservices, web-based environments
*   Big data systems, stream, and graph processing
*   HPC systems, cloud, edge, grid, and fog
*   Social networks, multimedia systems, and applications

## Types of Submissions

ICPE has eight distinct submission tracks:

*   **Research track**: For regular research papers.
*   **Industry track**: For contributions connecting to the industry.
*   **Journal-first track**: For contributions from recent journal publications.
*   **Artifact track**: For sharing software and data artifacts.
*   **Emerging research track**: For discussing preliminary or vision contributions.
*   **Poster and demo track**: For short, interactive contributions.
*   **Tutorials track**: For presentations by leading scientists and practitioners.
*   **Workshops track**: For specific aspects of performance engineering.
*   **Data challenge track**: For addressing challenges presented by a performance dataset.

## Important Dates

*   **Research Track:**
    *   Abstract submission (optional): **October 25, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Paper submission: **November 01, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **December 20, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 12, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Industry Track:**
    *   Abstract submission (optional): **October 25, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Paper submission: **November 01, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **December 20, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 12, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Workshops Track:**
    *   Proposal submission: **October 11, 2024** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **October 18, 2024** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 19, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Artifact Track:**
    *   Proposal submission: **January 15, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **February 28, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 19, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Poster and Demo Track:**
    *   Paper submission: **January 20, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **February 10, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 19, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Industry Presentation Track:**
    *   Submission: **February 02, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Author Notification: **February 23, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Tutorial Track:**
    *   Paper submission: **January 20, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **February 10, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 19, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Data Challenge Track:**
    *   Paper submission: **January 20, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **February 10, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 19, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Journal First Track:**
    *   Paper submission: **January 20, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Notification: **February 1, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Emerging Research Track:**
    *   Paper submission: **January 26, 2025** (AoE)
    *   Camera-ready version: **March 19, 2025** (AoE)

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors should adhere to the specific requirements for each track.
*   Final author manuscripts will be 8.5" x 11", not exceeding 6 pages; max 4 extra pages allowed at additional cost for certain contributions.
*   Submissions should be made in PDF format.
*   LaTeX and MS Word templates are available. Authors are encouraged to use the provided templates for formatting.
*   A double-blind review process is followed, requiring authors to anonymize their submissions.

## Registration

Registration for ICPE 2025 is now open. Please visit the registration page for details.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IE 2025

The 21st International Conference on Intelligent Environments (IE 2025) will take place from **June 23-26, 2025**, in **Darmstadt, Germany**.

IE is a multidisciplinary event welcoming contributions from various relevant areas, including sensors and actuators, signal processing, networking, human-computer interaction, artificial intelligence, software engineering, context-awareness, internet of things, pervasive and ubiquitous computing, applied in domains such as healthcare, education, culture, building environments, and smart cities.

The event will include:
*   Full (8-page) and short (4-page) papers
*   2 special sessions
*   Workshops
*   3 tutorials
*   A doctoral colloquium
*   An industrial forum
*   Demos & videos session

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Smart spaces
*   Smart cities
*   Smart communities
*   Mobile computing
*   Multimodal interaction
*   Robotic companions
*   Artificial intelligence
*   Computational intelligence
*   Middleware
*   Architecture
*   Virtual/Mixed reality
*   Collaborative tools
*   Sensors and actuators
*   Industry 4.0
*   Smart buildings
*   Smart education
*   Smart healthcare tech
*   Pervasive computing
*   Context awareness
*   Energy Efficiency
*   Ambient Assisted Living
*   Evaluation and Corpora
*   Evaluation Paradigms
*   Data Acquisition
*   Labelling and Data Sets
*   User Studies
*   Signal Processing (incl. audio and images)

## Special Sessions

IE2025 will have 2 special sessions:

*   [Empowering the Elderly through Intelligent Technologies: Sociotechnical Approaches for Inclusive Aging](https://www.ie2025.fraunhofer.de/special-sessions-empowering-the-elderly-through-intelligent-technologies-sociotechnical-approaches-for-inclusive-agingspecial-sessions-announced/)
*   [Ecological and Human Synergies Intelligent Design for the Anthropocene](https://www.ie2025.fraunhofer.de/special-session-ecological-and-human-synergies-intelligent-design-for-the-anthropocene/)

## Workshops

The conference will start with a series of workshops:

*   QUITE – Quantum, IoT, and Technologies for Secure Environments
*   WITLE – Workshop on Intelligent Teaching and Learning Environments
*   WISHWell – Workshop on Intelligent Environments Supporting Healthcare and Well-being
*   WORIE- Workshop on the Reliability of Intelligent Environments
*   ALLEGET – Workshop on Artificial intelligence and machine learning for Emerging Topics
*   WISSA – Workshop on Intelligent Systems for Smart Agriculture
*   DiDiT – Workshop on Distributed Digital Twins
*   CLEAR-AI – Compliance, Legal, and Ethical Aspects of AI Regulation

[Read more about workshops](https://www.ie2025.fraunhofer.de/workshops/)

## Doctoral Colloquium

The aim of the colloquium is to provide research students an opportunity to meet other people in a similar position, make relatively informal presentations, receive feedback from experts in the field, exchange ideas and experiences with each other, and make connections and have fun! All accepted presentations will be submitted as short (4-page) papers and published in the IE2025 IEEE Proceedings. A prize will be awarded for the best colloquium paper.

## Industrial Forum

In the Industrial Forum, colleagues from the industry domain will have the opportunity to showcase their projects while attracting funding or further expand collaborations with industry and academia at an international level. A limited number of presentation/demo slots of up to 30 minutes including questions and answers will be available for industry partners. During these slots, it will be possible for companies to present products/solutions/projects related to Intelligent Environments.

## Publications

*   **Main Conference Proceedings:** Papers accepted at the main conference (short or full) will be published in **IEEE proceedings** and available through IEEE Xplore. They are expected to be ISI-indexed.
*   **Workshop Proceedings:** Papers accepted in the workshops will be published as a volume of the **IOS Press Ambient Intelligence and Smart Environments book Series**. These are published Open Access and indexed by Clarivate (Web of Science) and SCOPUS.
*   **Journal Publication:** A selection of papers will be invited to extend and submit extended versions to special issues of high-quality journals.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Main Conference:** Submit papers using the IEEE two-column conference A4 format. Word and LaTeX templates are available [HERE](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html). All papers should be submitted [HERE](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IE2025/).
*   **Workshops:** Use the IOS Press book format. Word and LaTeX templates are available [HERE](https://www.ie2025.fraunhofer.de/paper-submission/).

[Download Call for Papers](https://www.ie2025.fraunhofer.de/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/IE25-CFP-ver5.pdf)

## Important Dates

**Meeting Dates:**

*   Workshops & Tutorials: **June 23-24, 2025**
*   Main Conference & Industrial Forum: **June 25-26, 2025**

**Paper Submission (Main conference):**

*   Conference paper submission: **January 24, 2025**
*   Communication of results: **February 20, 2025**
*   Camera ready version: **April 7, 2025**

**Special Sessions:**

*   Special Session proposal: **September 10, 2024**
*   Special Session acceptance decision: **September 20, 2024**

**Workshops:**

*   Workshop proposal: **September 12, 2024**
*   Workshop acceptance decision: **September 20, 2024**
*   Workshop paper submission: **March 07, 2025**
*   Communication of results: **April 04, 2025**
*   Camera ready version: **April 11, 2025**

**Tutorials:**

*   Tutorial proposal: **September 10, 2024**
*   Tutorial acceptance decision: **September 20, 2024**

callForPapers:
# Call for Research Papers

The International Conference on Process Mining (ICPM) is the leading global forum for researchers, practitioners, and developers in process mining. ICPM 2025 will be held from **October 20 to October 24, 2025**, at **Facultad de Ingeniería (FING), Universidad de la República (UdelaR) in Montevideo, Uruguay**.

The conference covers theoretical advancements, algorithmic challenges, impactful applications, and interdisciplinary connections. It is co-sponsored by the IEEE Computational Intelligence Society.

## Topics for Research Papers

ICPM 2025 invites groundbreaking contributions in both technical and empirical process mining research. Authors are encouraged to provide supplementary resources like datasets and implementations to enhance replicability.

**Technical Research Areas:**
*   Process discovery
*   Conformance checking
*   Performance measurement
*   Predictive and prescriptive process monitoring
*   Comparative process analysis
*   Formal foundations of process mining
*   Conceptual models related to process mining
*   Process mining visualizations

**Empirical Research Areas:**
*   Case studies and applications
*   Experiments involving process mining algorithms
*   Humans-in-the-loop experiments
*   Surveys
*   Interview-based studies

Selected accepted papers may be invited for an extended and revised publication in a special issue of the journal **Process Science**.

## Types of Contributions & Submission Instructions

1.  **Regular Research Papers**
    *   Present completed research with clearly outlined contributions.
    *   Accepted papers will be presented in the main track and published in the conference proceedings.
    *   **Length:** Maximum of **8 pages**.
    *   **Format:** Adhere to IEEE Computational Intelligence Society conference proceedings guidelines (8.5″ × 11″, two-column format). Templates for LaTeX and Word are available [here](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).

2.  **Posters**
    *   Present new ideas or ongoing work, and gather feedback.
    *   Poster papers will be reviewed but **not published** in the conference proceedings.
    *   **Length:** Maximum of **4 pages**.
    *   **Format:** Use IEEE templates. Add "(Poster)" to the title.

## Submission Guidelines

*   All submissions must be original and not submitted elsewhere.
*   **Abstract submission is mandatory** prior to paper submission.
*   The use of AI-generated text must be disclosed in the acknowledgments section.
*   Submissions must be made through the ICPM 2025 submission system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icpm2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icpm2025) (ICPM 2025 track).
*   All papers must be written in English.

## Review Process

Each submission will be reviewed by at least one senior process committee member and two additional reviewers, followed by a discussion period.

## Presentation and Copyright

At least one author of each accepted contribution must register for the conference, present their work, and sign a copyright release form.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract submission:** **May 15, 2025** (AoE) (mandatory)
*   **Paper submission:** **May 22, 2025** / **May 29, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Notification:** **July 11, 2025** (AoE)
*   **Camera-ready:** **August 22, 2025** (AoE)

callForPapers:
# IDC 2025: Workshop on Intelligent Distributed Computing

## Introduction

Following the widespread adoption of distributed computing in fields like big data and cloud computing, researchers are advancing paradigms for intelligent distributed computing to meet new demands of AI-driven applications. To achieve enhanced computational efficiency and stringent data privacy, novel approaches (e.g., intelligent resource scheduling, federated learning, and privacy-preserving architectures) have emerged as foundations for next-generation systems. However, these approaches require adaptive optimization and secure multi-node coordination, thereby posing significant challenges for scalability and robustness in AI-integrated environments. To address such challenges, the integration of artificial intelligence techniques (e.g., multi-agent reinforcement learning, decentralized optimization, and AI-driven security mechanisms) offers transformative design pathways. Therefore, the synergy of AI and distributed computing is critical for enabling efficient, secure, and scalable intelligent computational platforms.

## Topics of Interest

We invite submissions from academia, government and industry that present novel research on the following areas:

*   Distributed Swarm Robotics Systems
*   Distributed / Decentralized / Federated Machine Learning
*   Intelligent Distributed Applications
*   Intelligent Distributed and High-Performance Architecture
*   Intelligent Distributed Knowledge Representation and Processing
*   Intelligent Distributed Ledgers, Blockchains and AI
*   Intelligent Energy Systems
*   Intelligent Production Systems, Intelligent Transportation Systems
*   Machine Learning Methods for Distributed Systems
*   Multi-Agent Systems
*   Multi-Agent Machine Learning
*   Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
*   Nature-Inspired Methods for Supervised and Unsupervised Data Mining
*   Networked Intelligence, Organization and Management
*   Parallel Metaheuristics for Optimization
*   Smart City Applications, Smart Grid Applications

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop Proposal:** July 15, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** July 15, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** September 10, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Submission:** September 30, 2025
*   **Registration Due:** September 30, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** October 30 - November 02, 2025

## Submission

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

IDC is the premier international conference for researchers, educators, and practitioners to share the latest research findings, innovative methodologies, and new technologies in the areas of inclusive child-centered design, learning, and interaction.

The theme for IDC2025 is **hope** – IDC2025 aims to join together different generations to dream about and act upon a better future for us all. Even if the world around us can be worrisome, and children can feel sad and helpless due to on-going discussions on wars, health problems, and political struggles, adults should try to find ways for supporting children to remain brave, hopeful, and kind towards all, also towards those who are different from us. IDC2025 envisions a life full of bravery, kindness, and hope.

## Areas of Interest

Please refer to the [Areas of Interest page](https://idc.acm.org/2025/interest/) for detailed topics.

## Submission Types

*   [Full and short papers](https://idc.acm.org/2025/full-and-short/)
*   [Pictorials](https://idc.acm.org/2025/pictorial/)
*   [Workshops](https://idc.acm.org/2025/workshop/)
*   [Demos](https://idc.acm.org/2025/demo/)
*   [Work in progress (WIP)](https://idc.acm.org/2025/wip/)
*   [R&D challenge](https://idc.acm.org/2025/challenge/)
*   [Doctoral consortium](https://idc.acm.org/2025/doc-consortium/)
*   [Plurality, Equity, and Accessibility in IDC](https://idc.acm.org/2025/plurality-equity-and-accessibility/)

## Important Dates

14. **June 23-26, 2025:** IDC Conference

## Publication

The IDC 2025 proceedings will be published and available.

## Sponsors

Platinum sponsors are acknowledged.

callForPapers:
# ICVR 2025: Call for Papers

The 11th International Conference on Virtual Reality (ICVR 2025) invites authors to contribute original works showcasing pioneering research results, transformative projects, surveys, and real-world industrial experiences that advance the fields of Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR), and Extended Reality (XR).

The conference will be held in **Wageningen, Netherlands, from July 9th to 11th, 2025**. ICVR 2025 serves as a forum for knowledge-sharing and fostering collaborations among an international community of experts.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to submit contributions covering a wide array of topics, including but not limited to:

### Topic Area #1 - Technologies & Applications

*   VR, AR, MR, and XR Applications
*   2D/3D and volumetric display and projection technology
*   3D authoring
*   Computer graphics techniques for VR, AR, MR and XR
*   Immersive 360° video streaming
*   Immersive analytics and data visualisation
*   Modeling and simulation techniques in VR, AR, MR, and XR
*   Multi-user and distributed systems
*   Multimodal capturing and reconstruction
*   Scene description and management issues
*   Software architectures, toolkits, and engineering
*   Games and storytelling in VR, AR, MR and XR
*   AI for VR, AR, MR, and XR

### Topic Area #2 - Multi-sensory Experiences and Techniques

### Topic Area #3 - Interaction

## Special Sessions

*   **Special Session 1:** Transforming Learning: Virtual Reality in Education
*   **Special Session 2:** Food xR – Immersive Technologies for Food and Nutrition Studies

## Important Dates

*   **Submission of Special & Invited Session Proposals:** May 1, 2025
*   **Submission of Tutorial & Workshop Proposals:** May 1, 2025
*   **Full Papers Submission:** June 1, 2025 - Final Call!
*   **Notification of Paper Status:** June 15, 2025
*   **Final Paper Submission:** June 20, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 9-11, 2025

## Submission

*   **Online Submission System:** [http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icvr2025](http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icvr2025)
*   **Author's toolkit:** [guideline.html](guideline.html)
*   **Templates:** [Word Template](toolkit.html), [LaTex File](toolkit.html)

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in ICVR 2025 conference proceedings, which will be published by **IEEE** and archived in **IEEE Xplore**. The proceedings will be submitted for indexing by Ei Compendex and Scopus, etc.

ICVR2025 is listed in the [IEEE Conference List](https://www.icvr.org/history/2025/icvr2025-video.mp4).

callForPapers:
# IDA 2025: Call for Papers (Regular Paper Track)

The Symposium on Intelligent Data Analysis (IDA 2025) will take place from **May 7-9, 2025**, in **Konstanz, Germany**.

## About IDA 2025

Advancing Intelligent Data Analysis requires novel, potentially game-changing ideas. IDA’s mission is to promote ideas over performance: a solid motivation can be as convincing as an exhaustive empirical evaluation. Therefore, IDA accepts inspiring papers for both presentation and publication. The IDA symposium is intentionally small-scale and single-track to create an open atmosphere that encourages discussion.

IDA awards the **Frontier Prize** every year, recognizing the most visionary contributions.

## Submission Guidelines

### Formatting Instructions

*   Contributions must be written in English and formatted according to the guidelines of the **Lecture Notes of Computer Science (LNCS) series** by Springer-Verlag.
*   Templates are available [here](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   The **LNCS template for LaTeX** is strongly recommended.
*   The page limit for any contribution, including figures, title pages, references, and appendices, is **10 to 12 pages** in LNCS format.
*   Camera-ready versions must include the authors’ consent to publish on the Springer LNCS website. The consent form is available [here](http://ida2025.blogs.dsv.su.se/files/2025/02/IDA2025-license-to-publish-agreement.docx).

### Submission Policy

*   Authors may not submit any paper that is under review elsewhere or that has been accepted for publication in a journal or another conference. Papers submitted to IDA 2025 cannot be submitted elsewhere during the review period.
*   Authors, their contact information, or affiliations may not be changed after the paper submission deadline.
*   If a paper is accepted, at least one of the authors must register for the conference and present the paper in person in Konstanz.

### Submission Process

*   Papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format.
*   The submission interface is available via [Microsoft CMT – Regular Track Submission](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IDA2025).

## Deadlines

All dates are specified as 23:59 SST (Standard Samoa Time / Anywhere on Earth).

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** November 22, 2024
*   **Paper submission deadline:** November 29, 2024
*   **Notification of acceptance:** February 3, 2025 (UPDATED)
*   **Camera-ready and registration:** February 28, 2025

## Review Process

*   Submissions will undergo a **single-blind review process**; author identities are known to reviewers.
*   Reviewers will evaluate papers based on novelty, technical quality, potential impact, and clarity.
*   Each submission will be reviewed by a senior program committee (SPC) member. Papers for which an SPC makes a convincing argument about how they address the symposium’s goals will be accepted independent of the overall review score.

## Publication

All accepted paper contributions will be published in the **Lecture Notes in Computer Science series** by Springer-Verlag.

## FAQ Highlights

*   **Double-blind peer-reviewing policy:** No, IDA uses standard single-blind peer-reviewing.
*   **Paper longer than page limit:** Submissions that deviate from the guidelines may be rejected without consideration. The length must be between 10-12 pages.
*   **PhD Forum:** A separate call for the PhD forum is available [here](https://ida2025.org/phd-forum/). PhD students submitting full papers should use the regular track. The PhD forum does not provide full-paper publications.
*   **Posting on ArXiv.org:** Posting submitted papers on self-archiving websites is allowed.

## Why Submit to IDA?

*   Focus on ideas and motivation.
*   Small-scale, single-track for open discussion.
*   Recognition through the Frontier Prize.
*   Publication in prestigious LNCS series by Springer-Verlag.

## Registration

*   Early registration deadline: **April 15, 2025**
*   [Register Now](https://ida2025.org/registration/)

# Call for Papers - ICRA 2025

The IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation (ICRA) 2025 will be held in Atlanta, USA, from **May 19 to May 23, 2025**.

As the flagship conference of the IEEE Robotics and Automation Society (RAS), ICRA brings together the world's top researchers and industry leaders to share ideas, exchange knowledge, and advance the field of robotics for the benefit of humanity.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 11:59 PM Pacific time:

1.  **Paper Submission Opens:** 15 July 2024
2.  **Paper Submission Deadline:** 15 September 2024
3.  **Workshop/Tutorial submission deadline:** 25 September 2024
4.  **Notification of Acceptance of Workshop and Tutorial Proposals:** 21 December 2024
5.  **Registration & Housing Opens:** 3 January 2025
6.  **Notification of paper acceptance/rejection:** 31 January 2025
7.  **Submission of final papers:** 6 March 2025

summary: The Twentieth International Conference on Software Engineering Advances (ICSEA 2025) will be held in Lisbon, Portugal, from September 28 to October 2, 2025. This conference, which is part of the SoftNet 2025 Congress, covers a broad spectrum of software engineering topics, from fundamentals to advanced applications, and offers both onsite and online participation options.
callForPapers:
# ICSEA 2025: Call for Papers

The Twentieth International Conference on Software Engineering Advances (ICSEA 2025) will be held from **September 28, 2025 to October 02, 2025 in Lisbon, Portugal**.

### Onsite and Online Options

To accommodate various situations, the conference offers the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos).

## Scope

ICSEA 2025 continues a series of events covering a broad spectrum of software-related topics, from fundamentals on designing, implementing, testing, validating, and maintaining various kinds of software. The conference covers classical and advanced methodologies, open source, agile software, software deployment, software economics, and education. It also addresses advanced practical aspects such as run-time vulnerability checking, rejuvenation processes, updates, and online software updates.

The conference solicits both academic, research, and industrial contributions, including technical papers, position papers, survey papers, short papers on work in progress, and panel proposals. Industrial presentations are also welcome.

## Conference Tracks

*   **Trends and achievements**
*   **Advances in fundamentals for software development**
*   **Advanced mechanisms for software development**
*   **Advanced design tools for developing software**
*   **Software engineering for service computing (SOA and Cloud)**
*   **Advanced facilities for accessing software**
*   **Software performance**
*   **Software security, privacy, safeness**
*   **Advances in software testing**
*   **Specialized software advanced applications**
*   **Web Accessibility**
*   **Open source software**
*   **Agile and Lean approaches in software engineering**
*   **Software deployment and maintenance**
*   **Software engineering techniques, metrics, and formalisms**
*   **Business technology**
*   **Software economics, adoption, and education**
*   **Improving productivity in research on software engineering**

## Submission Types

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 6-10 pages; 6 pages covered by registration, max 4 extra pages at additional cost) (oral presentation)
*   **Short papers (work in progress):** (up to 4 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Ideas contributions:** (2 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Extended abstracts:** (2 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Posters (paper-based):** (2 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Posters (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation)
*   **Presentations (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation)
*   **Demos:** (2 pages) [posted on www.iaria.org]
*   **Tutorial proposals**
*   **Panel proposals**

## Publication

Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to one of the IARIA Journals.

*   Publisher: XPS (Xpert Publishing Services)
*   Archived: ThinkMind™ Digital Library (free access)
*   Prints available at Curran Associates, Inc.

## Submission Format

*   Only .pdf or .doc files will be accepted for paper submission.
*   Final author manuscripts will be 8.5" x 11", not exceeding 6 pages; max 4 extra pages allowed at additional cost.

LaTeX Template:

*   A community-provided LaTeX template is available: the CTAN package iaria (with full IARIA formatting rules, including IARIA citation style). There is also iaria-lite (compatible with any TeX stack). A minimal working example as an Overleaf template is also available. Please adhere to the additional editorial rules .
*   Slides-based contributions can use the corporate/university format and style.

## Deadlines

*   **Submission:** Jun 27, 2025
*   **Notification:** Jul 27, 2025
*   **Registration:** Aug 10, 2025
*   **Camera ready:** Aug 24, 2025

Deadlines differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page for special tracks Call for Papers (if any).

# ICSE 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE) 2026, the premier software engineering conference, will be held from **April 12-18, 2026**, in **Rio de Janeiro, Brazil**, at the Windsor Convention Center and Hotels. ICSE provides a forum where researchers, practitioners, and educators gather to present and discuss research results, innovations, trends, experiences, and issues in the field of software engineering.

## ICSE 2026 Tracks

summary: The 22nd IEEE International Conference on Software Architecture (ICSA 2025) will be held in Odense, Denmark, from March 31 to April 4, 2025. The conference theme is 'Architecting for the Next Generation of Intelligent Systems' and it serves as a premier event for software architecture researchers and practitioners.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ICSA 2025

The IEEE International Conference on Software Architecture (ICSA) is the premier event for software architecture, component-based software engineering, and quality aspects of complex software systems. ICSA 2025, the 22nd edition, will take place in **Odense, Denmark**, from **March 31 to April 4, 2025**.

## Theme: Architecting for the Next Generation of Intelligent Systems

ICSA 2025 invites innovative contributions that explore the opportunities and challenges presented by the rapid development and integration of advanced AI technologies. We seek papers on new methodologies, tools, and best practices for integrating AI capabilities into software architecture, as well as case studies on their practical implications.

## Tracks

ICSA 2025 features multiple tracks to cater to diverse interests:

*   **Research Papers:** Original and significant results in software architecture.
*   **Software Architecture in Practice:** Contributions focusing on real-world applications and challenges.
*   **New and Emerging Ideas:** Proposals for novel concepts and future research directions.
*   **Artifacts Evaluation Track:** Evaluation of research artifacts supporting software architecture research.
*   **Early Career Track:** Contributions from emerging researchers in the field.
*   **Journal First:** Recent journal publications relevant to software architecture.
*   **Poster Track:** Presentations of ongoing research and work in progress.
*   **Tutorials/Tech Briefings:** Educational sessions on specific software architecture topics.
*   **Workshops:** Focused discussions on specialized areas within software architecture.
*   **Working Sessions:** Interactive sessions for practitioners and researchers to collaborate.

## Important Dates (for Research Papers)

*   **Abstract Submission:** **November 8th, 2024** (firm)
*   **Full Papers Submission:** **November 15th, 2024** (firm)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **December 15th, 2024**
*   **Camera-ready Due:** **January 27th, 2025**

*(Note: Deadlines may differ for other tracks. Please refer to the conference website for specific track deadlines.)*

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Technical Research Papers:** Submissions will be evaluated based on novelty, soundness, significance/relevance, open science principles, and presentation quality. Maximum length is **10 pages** for the main text (including figures, tables, appendices) with two additional pages permitted for references only.
*   **Review Process:** ICSA 2025 employs a **double-blind review process** for technical research papers. Submissions must be anonymized to ensure reviewer confidentiality.
*   **Open Science:** Authors are encouraged to follow principles of transparency, reproducibility, and replicability by disclosing data and open-source artifacts. Sharing research artifacts is desired but not mandatory.
*   **Submission Portal:** All submissions must be made electronically via the [EasyChair submission system](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icsa2025).
*   **Formatting:** Submissions must conform to the [IEEE paper formatting instructions](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html) and [IEEE Guidelines for Artificial Intelligence (AI)-Generated Text](https://www.ieeeauthorcenter.ieee.org/become-an-ieee-journal-author/publishing-ethics/guidelines-and-policies/submission-and-peer-review-policies/#maincontent).
*   **Originality:** Submissions must be original, unpublished, and not under review elsewhere.

## Publication

All accepted technical research papers will be published in the ICSA 2025 main proceedings and indexed in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library. Short papers and poster summaries will be published in the ICSA 2025 companion proceedings.

## Presentation Requirement

At least one author of each accepted contribution is required to register and present the work **in person** at the conference.

## Invited Submissions

Authors of distinguished papers will be invited to submit revised and extended versions to a Special Issue of ACM Transactions on Autonomous and Adaptive Systems (TAAS).

## Track Chairs

*   **Research Track Chairs:** Jan Bosch (Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden), Raffaela Mirandola (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Germany)

The conference is the premier annual event for Web Engineering and associated technologies, focusing on the design, creation, maintenance, operation, and usage of Web applications. This year's edition highlights the theme 'The Inclusive Web: Realizing Safe, Accessible, Inclusive, and Sustainable Web Engineering'.
callForPapers:
# Call for Contributions - ICWE 2025

The **25th International Conference on Web Engineering (ICWE 2025)** is the premier annual conference on Web Engineering and associated technologies. It will be held in **Delft, Netherlands**, from **June 30 to July 3, 2025**.

## General Theme

The 25th edition of ICWE particularly invites contributions under the following general theme:
**The Inclusive Web: Realizing Safe, Accessible, Inclusive, and Sustainable Web Engineering**
This theme focuses on designing innovative Web technology that is fair, ethical, transparent, privacy-preserving, trustworthy, and inclusive for all. Contributions on any other topic related to Web Engineering are also welcome.

## Topics of Interest

ICWE 2025 accepts contributions on a wide spectrum of topics related to Web Engineering, including but not limited to:

*   Safety, Inclusivity, and accessibility for the Web
*   Fair and explainable web technologies
*   Human-Centered vs. More-than-Human web
*   Conversational web
*   Fake news, misinformation, and online toxicity
*   Web security, identity, trust and privacy engineering
*   Participatory and deliberative web
*   Web application modeling and engineering
*   Web infrastructures and architectures
*   Web of things, social web and mobile web applications
*   Web mining, knowledge extraction and analytics of big data on the Web
*   Machine learning, AI and large-language models for web engineering
*   Web user interfaces and UX
*   User modeling and web-based recommender systems
*   Quality aspects of web applications
*   Performance, scalability, energy-efficiency and sustainability aspects of web applications
*   Semantic web, knowledge graphs, web ontologies, and linked open-data applications
*   Web crowdsourcing and human computation
*   Web composition and mashups
*   Web services, Microservice architecture, computing, workflows, and standards
*   Architecting the Web in the cloud continuum, e.g. cloud, fog, edge and server-less computing for Web applications
*   Web engineering processes, practices, experience and paradigms, e.g. Agile, Lean
*   Re-decentralization of the web
*   Web standards and disruptive web technologies
*   Comparisons, data sets, empirical studies of web technologies
*   Web programming languages, tools and frameworks

## Submission Tracks and Deadlines

All dates are according to the time zone “Anywhere on Earth”, i.e., UTC-12.

### **Research & Industry Track (Full/Short papers)**

*   Original Abstract submission: **February 6, 2025**
*   Original Paper submission: **February 13, 2025**
*   Extended Abstract submission: **February 13, 2025**
*   Extended Paper submission: **February 20, 2025**
*   Author notification: **April 3, 2025**
*   Camera-ready due: **May 1, 2025**

### **Posters and Demos Track**

*   Submission deadline: **April 9, 2025**
*   Extended Submission deadline: **April 16, 2025**
*   Author notification: **April 30, 2025**
*   Camera-ready due: **May 6, 2025**

### **Workshops Track**

*   Submission of proposals: **February 14, 2025**
*   Author notification: **February 21, 2025**
*   Workshop paper submission deadline: **April 19, 2025**
*   Notification deadline: **May 11, 2025**
*   Workshop Day: **June 23, 2025** (tentative)
*   Post-proceedings camera-ready deadline: **July 30, 2025**

### **Tutorials Track**

*   Submission deadline: **February 13, 2025**
*   Author notification: **April 3, 2025**
*   Camera-ready due: **May 1, 2025**

### **PhD Symposium Track**

*   Submission deadline: **March 27, 2025**
*   Author notification: **April 3, 2025**
*   Camera-ready due: **April 8, 2025**
*   Extended Camera-ready due: **April 15, 2025**

## Contribution Types

*   **Regular papers** (up to 6-10 pages) [in the proceedings, digital library]
*   **Short papers (work in progress)** (up to 4 pages long) [in the proceedings, digital library]
*   **Ideas contributions** (2 pages long) [in the proceedings, digital library]
*   **Extended abstracts** (2 pages long) [in the proceedings, digital library]
*   **Posters (paper-based)** (2 pages long) [in the proceedings, digital library]
*   **Posters (slide-based, only)** [slide-deck posted on www.iaria.org]
*   **Presentations (slide-based, only)** [slide-deck posted on www.iaria.org]
*   **Demos** (2 pages) [posted on www.iaria.org]

## Submission Guidelines

*   Contributions should be submitted via the conference website. Specific links for each track are available: [Call for Contributions](https://icwe2025.webengineering.org/call-for-contributions/)
*   Accepted contributions will be included in the **ICWE 2025 Springer LNCS proceedings**.
*   Only .pdf or .doc files will be accepted for paper submission.
*   Final author manuscripts for regular papers should not exceed 6 pages; max 4 extra pages are allowed at additional cost.

## Publication

*   Accepted contributions will be included in the **ICWE 2025 Springer LNCS proceedings**.
*   The best papers will be selected to be proposed, in extended form, as part of a special issue of the **Journal of Web Engineering**.

## Registration

Registration is open. Please visit the [Registration Details](https://icwe2025.webengineering.org/registration-details/) page for more information.

# Call for Papers: 30th International Conference on Systems Engineering (ICSEng 2023)

The **30th International Conference on Systems Engineering (ICSEng 2023)** was held from **August 22-24, 2023**, in **Las Vegas, NV, USA**, at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.

## Call for Papers

Please see the Call for Papers in PDF: [pdf version](./files/icseng2023_cfp.pdf)

## Important Dates

*   **Papers due:** April 24, 2023 (final extension: May 12, 2023)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** May 20, 2023
*   **Camera-ready (final) papers:** June 2, 2023
*   **Paper registration due:** June 2, 2023

## Conference Context

This series of International Conferences is jointly organized on a rotational basis among:

*   University of Nevada, Las Vegas, USA
*   Wroclaw University of Technology, Poland
*   Toyo University, Japan
*   University of Technology Sydney, Australia (joined in 2018)
*   Toyo University, Tokyo, Japan (joined in 2022)

## Publication

The proceedings are published in the Springer series **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems** and are indexed by ISI Web of Science Proceedings, DBLP, SCOPUS, Google Scholar, and Springerlink. Selected papers will be published in the **International Journal of Electronics and Telecommunications**.

## Contact

Conference Secretary, ICSEng 2023
Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering
Howard R. Hughes College of Engineering
University of Nevada, Las Vegas
Las Vegas, NV 89154-4026, USA

Phone: +1 702 895 1369
Fax: +1 702 895 1115
Email: [secretary(at)icseng.com](mailto:secretary(at)icseng.com)

You can learn more about ICSEng conference history at their Wikipedia page: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Conference_on_Systems_Engineering](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Conference_on_Systems_Engineering)

callForPapers:
# IDEAS 2025: Call for Papers

The 29th International Database Engineered Application Symposium (IDEAS 2025) will be held in **Newcastle Upon Tyne, United Kingdom**, from **July 14th to 16th, 2025**.

## About IDEAS 2025

IDEAS 2025 aims to explore and advance all data engineering and application aspects, regardless of the underlying database models. The symposium provides an international forum for discussing the problems of engineering data-driven systems involving not only database technology but also related areas of artificial intelligence, communication, information retrieval, human-machine interaction, multimedia, natural language processing, privacy, security, and others. IDEAS fosters closer interaction among the industrial, research and user communities.

## Topics of Interest

All data engineering and application aspects, including but not limited to:

*   Artificial intelligence
*   Communication
*   Information retrieval
*   Human-machine interaction
*   Multimedia
*   Natural language processing
*   Privacy
*   Security
*   And other related areas.

## Important Dates for Papers

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** May 29, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** June 19-20, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** July 6, 2025 (AoE)

## Submission Guidelines

Submissions should be made electronically through the following link:
[https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IDEAS2025/](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IDEAS2025/)

*(Note: Specific paper formatting details are typically provided on the submission portal.)*

## Registration

*   **Registration Deadline:** June 30, 2025, Midday (UK Summer Time)
*   **Registration Link:** [https://webstore.ncl.ac.uk/conferences-and-events/faculty-of-science-agriculture-engineering/school-of-computing/ideas-2025](https://webstore.ncl.ac.uk/conferences-and-events/faculty-of-science-agriculture-engineering/school-of-computing/ideas-2025)

## Publication

As per former editions, **Springer will publish the conference proceedings in the LNCS series**. Authors of selected papers may be invited to submit extended versions to a journal.

## Sponsors

*   QTS Data Centers
*   Neo4j
*   Red Hat
*   NICD

ICSME is the premier forum for researchers and practitioners to present and discuss recent innovations, trends, experiences, and challenges in software maintenance and evolution.
callForPapers:
# ICSME 2025: Call for Papers

The 41st IEEE International Conference on Software Maintenance and Evolution (ICSME 2025) is the premier forum for researchers and practitioners to present and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, experiences, and challenges in software maintenance and evolution.

## Goal and Scope

We invite high-quality submissions describing significant and unpublished results related to, but not limited to, the following software maintenance and evolution topics:

*   Change and defect management
*   Code cloning and provenance
*   Concept and feature location
*   Continuous integration/deployment
*   Empirical studies of software maintenance and evolution
*   Evolution of non-code artifacts
*   Evolution and maintenance of AI-based applications
*   Human factors and social aspects of software maintenance and evolution
*   Large Language Models for software evolution and maintenance tasks
*   Maintenance and evolution of model-based methods
*   Maintenance and evolution of mobile apps
*   Maintenance and evolution of service-oriented and cloud computing systems
*   Maintenance and evolution processes
*   Maintenance versus release process
*   Mining software repositories
*   Productivity of software engineers during maintenance and evolution
*   Release engineering
*   Reverse engineering and re-engineering
*   Run-time evolution and dynamic configuration
*   Software and system comprehension
*   Software migration and renovation
*   Software quality assessment
*   Software refactoring and restructuring
*   Software testing theory and practice
*   Source code analysis and manipulation
*   Technical Debt

ICSME welcomes innovative ideas that are timely, well-presented, and evaluated. All submissions must position themselves within the existing literature, describe the relevance of the results to specific software engineering goals, and include a clear motivation and presentation of the work.

## Evaluation

Submissions that do not comply with the required submission format or that are out of scope will be desk-rejected without review. All eligible submissions will be reviewed by at least three members of the program committee. Evaluation criteria include importance of contribution, originality, quality of presentation, soundness, evaluation (where applicable), and comparison to related work. Replicability will also be evaluated where applicable.

## Paper Submission

*   **Submission Link:** [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icsme2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icsme2025)
*   **Format:** Strictly adhere to the two-column IEEE conference proceedings format. Use the provided templates (LaTeX or MS Word).
*   **Page Limit:** Maximum 10 pages (including figures and appendices) plus up to 2 pages containing ONLY references.
*   **File Type:** All submissions must be in PDF.
*   **Policy:** Submitted papers must comply with IEEE plagiarism policy. Papers must be original, unpublished, and not under review elsewhere. Submitting the same paper to different tracks is not allowed.

## Double Anonymous Review

ICSME 2025 will use a double-anonymous reviewing process. Authors must omit names and affiliations, refer to their own work in the third person, and ensure the submission title differs from preprints on arXiv or similar sites. For more information, see [https://icsme.github.io/faq_double_blind.html](https://icsme.github.io/faq_double_blind.html).

## Special Issue

Authors of select papers from the research track will be invited to submit extended versions to a special issue of the Springer International Journal of Empirical Software Engineering (EMSE), requiring approximately 30% new material.

## Author Response Period

The author response period is scheduled from **May 8, 2025, to May 15, 2025**. Authors will have the opportunity to inspect reviews and respond to specific questions. Early decisions may be issued for papers with clear accept or reject outcomes.

## Publication and Presentation

Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings and submitted for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library. At least one author of each accepted paper must register for the conference and present the paper. Failure to register by the early registration date or present the paper may result in withdrawal from the proceedings.

## Open Science Policy

ICSME encourages open science, including sharing of data sets, replication packages, and preprints. Authors should make data available or provide justification for non-sharing. Artifacts should be anonymized. Sharing of accepted manuscripts on e-print servers like arXiv.org is encouraged.

## Important Dates

All submission dates are at 23:59 AoE (Anywhere on Earth):

*   **Abstract submission:** March 6, 2025 (passed; updates allowed until full paper deadline)
*   **Paper submission:** March 13, 2025
*   **Early Decisions notification:** May 7, 2025
*   **Author response period:** May 8, 2025 - May 15, 2025
*   **Final notification:** June 5, 2025
*   **Camera-ready submission:** July 27, 2025

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - ICSOC 2025

The **23rd International Conference on Service-Oriented Computing (ICSOC 2025)** serves as the premier international forum for academics, industry researchers, developers, and practitioners to present and exchange groundbreaking work in service-oriented computing. The conference aims to foster cross-community scientific excellence by bringing together experts from diverse fields such as services science, data science, management science, business-process management, distributed systems, cloud and edge computing, cyber-physical systems, Internet-of-Things (IoT), artificial intelligence, machine learning, and services and software engineering.

ICSOC 2025 will be held at the **Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen, China**, from **December 1st to December 4th, 2025**. The conference focuses on presenting results and discussing ideas related to Service Computing, with a particular emphasis on artificial intelligence, machine learning, big data analytics, IoT, and emerging technologies including quantum computing.

## Calls for Contributions:

We invite submissions for the following categories:

*   **Call for Research / Industry papers**
*   **Call for Workshops**
*   **Call for Ph.D. Symposium Papers**
*   **Call for Demos and Resources**
*   **Call for Tutorials**

## Important Dates:

### Conference Dates:
*   **December 1-4, 2025**

### Research / Industry Papers:
*   **Early paper submissions due:** 9 May 2025
*   **Regular paper abstract submissions due:** 7 July 2025
*   **Regular paper submissions due:** 14 July 2025
*   **Final notification to authors:** 15 September 2025

### Workshops:
*   **Workshop proposals submission due:** 20 June 2025
*   **Notification to applicants:** 27 June 2025
*   **Workshop date:** 01 December 2025

### Tutorials:

*   **Author Notification:** 20 October 2025
*   **Camera-ready:** 6 November 2025

### Ph.D. Symposium Papers:
*   **Submissions Deadline:** 7 October 2025

*   **Camera-ready:** 10 November 2025

### Demos and Resources:

*   **Camera-ready:** 1 November 2025

It serves as a multidisciplinary forum for researchers to share cutting-edge research on the interplay of the web and society, focusing on computational social science and social computing.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The **International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media (ICWSM) 2025** will be held in **Copenhagen, Denmark**, from **June 23-26, 2025**.

ICWSM is a premier venue for computational social science and social computing, bringing together researchers from various disciplines to investigate the interplay of the web and society. It focuses on research that blends social science and computational approaches to answer important questions about human social behavior through online traces.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include (but are not limited to):

*   Analysis of the relationship between social media and mainstream media
*   Qualitative and quantitative studies of online platforms
*   Subjectivity in textual data; sentiment analysis; polarity/opinion/stance identification and extraction, linguistic analyses of human behavior on the web
*   Information retrieval on online platforms
*   Credibility of online content
*   Measuring predictability of real-world phenomena based on digital trace data, e.g., spanning politics, finance, and health
*   Social network analysis; communities identification; expertise and authority discovery
*   Trust; reputation; recommendation systems
*   Text categorization; topic recognition; demographic/gender/age identification
*   Privacy and security on the web
*   Trend identification and tracking; time series forecasting for web data
*   New web applications; interfaces; interaction techniques
*   Engagement, motivations, incentives, and gamification on the web
*   Social innovation and effecting change through the web
*   Psychological, personality-based, and ethnographic studies of web-based platforms
*   Studies of digital humanities (culture, history, arts) using online traces
*   Internet usage on mobile devices; location, human mobility, and behavior
*   Organizational and group behavior mediated by web technology; interpersonal communication mediated by web and social media

## Submission Types and Deadlines

We invite original work for the following categories:

### Full Papers
*   **Submission Deadline:** **February 21, 2025**
*   **Notification:** **March 24, 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** **April 13, 2025**
*   Submission Link: [Full papers](submit/index.html#cfp-full-papers)

### Datasets, Posters, and Demos
*   Calls published: December 3, 2024
*   Submission Link: [Datasets, Posters, and Demos](submit/index.html#cfp-datasets-posters-demos)

### Workshops
*   Calls published: November 22, 2024
*   **Extended Submission Deadline:** **January 24, 2025**
*   Submission Link: [Workshops](submit/index.html#cfp-workshops)

### Tutorials
*   Calls published: November 22, 2024
*   Submission Link: [Tutorials](submit/index.html#cfp-tutorials)

## Important Dates Summary

*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline:** **February 21, 2025**
*   **Workshop Submission Deadline (Extended):** **January 24, 2025**
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **March 24, 2025**
*   **Registration Deadline:** **April 05, 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** **April 13, 2025**
*   **Student Travel Grant Application Deadline:** **March 31, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **June 23-26, 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

*   Submissions should be made through the conference's submission system. Links are provided above for each category.
*   ICWSM has a competitive acceptance rate of approximately 20 to 30% for full-length research papers.
*   Papers are published in the proceedings by the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI).
*   Deadlines may differ for special tracks; please consult the conference home page.

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Adamic-Glance Plenary Talk:** Kiran Garimella
*   **Second Keynote Speaker:** Richard Rogers

## Other Information

*   **Mentoring Program:** Available for attendees.
*   **Awards:** Nominations are open for the ICWSM Adamic-Glance Distinguished Early Career Award, with a deadline of March 15, 2025.
*   **Student Travel Grants:** Applications deadline is March 31, 2025.
*   **EDI Special Session:** A special session on Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion will be held.

## Publication

The conference proceedings are available on the AAAI website.

*   Conference Proceedings: [https://ojs.aaai.org/index.php/ICWSM/issue/view/658](https://ojs.aaai.org/index.php/ICWSM/issue/view/658)

summary: The 41st Annual Conference of the IEEE Industrial Electronics Society (IECON 2025) will be held in Madrid, Spain, from October 14-17, 2025. It is the flagship yearly conference of the society, focusing on Robotics and Mechatronics, Power Electronics, Cybersecurity, Renewable Energy, Smart Grid, Digital Twins, AI for Industrial Processes, and Industry 5.0, featuring workshops, tutorials, panels, keynotes, and research presentations.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

IECON 2025 is the flagship yearly conference of the IEEE Industrial Electronics Society, devoted to the dissemination of new ideas, research, and works in progress in the fields of Robotics and Mechatronics, Power Electronics, Cybersecurity, Renewable Energy, Smart Grid, Digital Twins, AI for Industrial Processes, and Industry 5.0, among others.

The IECON 2025 program includes workshops, tutorials, panels, keynotes, and the presentation of original research and industrial applications. The conference is organized into three main tracks:

*   **IECON Green Tech**
*   **IECON ICT & AI in Industry**
*   **IECON Integration, Control & Robotics**

## Technical Areas:

### IECON Green Tech
*   Power Systems and Smart Grid
*   Power Electronics and Energy Conversion
*   Electric Machines and Industrial Drives
*   Renewable Energy and Energy Storage Systems
*   Transportation Electrification and Automotive Technologies
*   Resilient Control Architectures for Energy Systems
*   Smart Building Technologies

### IECON Integration, Control & Robotics
*   Control Systems and Applications
*   Mechatronics and Robotics
*   AI Applications in Control, Mechatronics, and Robotics
*   Instrumentation, Sensors, Actuators, and Micro-Nano Technology

### IECON ICT & AI in Industry
*   Cyber-Physical Systems and IoT in Industry
*   AI and Signal & Image Processing Methodologies
*   Industrial Informatics, Cloud Computing, and Big Data
*   Communications for Industrial and Factory Automation
*   Electronic System on Chip and Embedded Systems

## Paper Submission Guidelines:

*   Prospective authors are invited to submit their manuscript using the IEEE template.
*   **Submission Limit:** Up to 6 full pages (including title, authors, affiliations, figures, and references), with a maximum size of 2MB. Up to 2 additional pages are allowed for a fee.
*   **File Format:** Only PDF files are allowed.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://confcomm.ieee-ies.org/app/general/conferences/IECON25/initial-submission](https://confcomm.ieee-ies.org/app/general/conferences/IECON25/initial-submission)
*   **Template:** Download the IEEE template [here](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).

## Requirements for Accepted Papers:

For accepted papers to be included in the conference proceedings and submitted for possible inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library, the following must be satisfied by the corresponding deadline:

*   Submission of the final version of the paper.
*   Transfer of copyright of the paper to IEEE.
*   At least one of the authors must pay the full registration fee for the conference.
*   The paper must be presented at the conference.

## Important Dates:

*   **Early Paper Submission Due Date:** **31 March, 2025**
*   **Regular Paper Submission Due Date:** **23 May, 2025** (Extended deadline)
*   **Tutorial Session Proposals Due Date:** **31 March, 2025**
*   **Special Session Proposals Due Date:** **31 March, 2025**
*   **Panel Session Proposals Due Date:** **5 June, 2025**
*   **Early Acceptance Notification for Submissions:** **6 May, 2025**
*   **Regular Acceptance Notification for Submissions:** **30 June, 2025**
*   **Final Submission and Registration Due Date:** **31 July, 2025** (new date)
*   **Conference Dates:** **14-17 October, 2025**

**Note:** Early submission is strongly encouraged for authors requiring a visa. For detailed deadlines and other important dates, please visit [https://iecon2025.org/important-dates/](https://iecon2025.org/important-dates/).
