callForPapers:
# IEEE IV 2025: Call for Papers

The IEEE Intelligent Vehicles Symposium (IV 2025) is the premier annual forum organized by the IEEE Intelligent Transportation Systems Society (ITSS). IV 2025 will take place in **Cluj-Napoca, Romania**.

Researchers, academics, and practitioners from universities, industry, and government agencies are invited to submit their latest research papers, simulation challenges, and applications on Intelligent Vehicles and Intelligent Vehicle Infrastructures. The symposium will feature Plenary Talks, Technical Sessions, Poster Sessions, Tutorials, Workshops, Exhibitions, and Industrial Demonstrations and Challenges. It will also provide a memorable Social Program.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors are invited to submit **full-length papers up to 6 pages** for technical content, including figures and references.
*   **Additional pages** will be charged at the rate of **$100 per page**, limited to two pages per paper.
*   Each accepted paper must be covered by at least one **non-student registration**.
*   **Additional papers** by the same authors will be charged at a flat rate of **$400 per paper**.

## Topics of Interest

### Advanced Mobility Systems

*   Advanced Driver Assistance Systems
*   Automated and Autonomous Vehicles
*   Future Mobility and Smart City
*   Smart Infrastructure for Automated Vehicles

### Sensing, perception and scene understanding

*   Advanced Sensing and Perception: Image, Radar, Lidar
*   Multisensory Fusion for Advanced Perception
*   Perception in Adverse Conditions
*   Scene Understanding

### Localization and mapping

*   Sensor Fusion for Localization
*   Integration of HD map and Onboard Sensors
*   SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping)

### Connected and Cooperative vehicles

*   Cooperative Perception and Localization
*   Cooperative Scene Understanding
*   Cooperative Planning and Control
*   Cooperative Fusion for (Mis)Behavior Assessment
*   Vehicle-To-Everything (V2X) and Cellular V2X (C-V2X) Communications
*   Secure and Efficient Over-The-Air (OTA) Updates

### Neural Scene Representation in Automated Driving

*   Scalable Neural Scene Representation
*   Semantic Understanding and Decision-Making with Neural Fields
*   Integrating Diverse Data Sources (e.g HD maps, LIDAR) in Neural Scene Representations
*   Application of Neural Fields in Autonomous Driving
*   Dataset Augmentation Using Neural Fields

### Planning & Control

*   Intelligent Vehicle Control
*   Planning and Decision Making
*   End-to-end Motion Planning
*   Trajectories Prediction
*   Ethics Integration in Advanced Planning and Decision Making

### Safety & Security

*   Active and Passive Vehicular Safety
*   Collision Avoidance
*   Pedestrian and Vulnerable Road Users’ Protection
*   Self-diagnosis and Systems Supervision
*   Simulations and Real World Testing Methodologies
*   Intelligent and Safe Vehicle Software Architecture

### Intelligent Unmanned Aerial Vehicles

*   Remote Sensing & Perception & Scene
*   Understanding from UAVs
*   UAVs Planning and Control

### Human Interaction and Factors

*   Driver State and Intent Recognition
*   Human Factors for Intelligent Vehicles
*   Teleoperation of Intelligent Vehicles
*   Infotainment Systems and HMI Design

### Datasets

*   Automotive
*   UAV
*   Dataset Adaptation to Target Domain
*   Model Adaptation to Target Domain

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission Deadline (Regular Paper):** February 1, 2025 (No extension)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** March 30, 2025
*   **Final Paper Submission:** April 30, 2025
*   **Registration portal open:** March 31st
*   **Early bird registration by:** April 25th

## Submission Information

*   **Paper Submission:** [https://its.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl](https://its.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl)
*   **Download CFP:** [https://ieee-iv.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2024/07/pliant-A5-1.pdf](https://ieee-iv.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2024/07/pliant-A5-1.pdf)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IGARSS 2025

On behalf of the IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Society (GRSS) and the IGARSS 2025 Organising Committee, we invite you to submit your research papers to the **45th IEEE International Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium**, taking place from **3-8 August 2025**, in Brisbane, Australia.

## Conference Theme

**'One Earth'**: Highlighting the essential contribution of remote sensing in tackling global environmental issues and fostering international cooperation in developing global solutions to safeguard our planet.

## Topics of Interest

We encourage submissions covering a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

*   Imaging and Processing Techniques
*   Remote Sensing Data Analysis
*   AI and Big Data
*   Electromagnetic Emission and Scattering Modeling
*   Remote Sensing Applications to Atmosphere, Cryosphere, Land, or Oceans
*   Remote Sensing of Planetary and other Celestial Bodies
*   Mission, Platforms and Calibration
*   Sensors, Instruments and Calibration
*   Education and Policy
*   Societal Engagement and Impacts

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit abstracts or papers through the [IGARSS 2025 online submission portal](papers.php) by **17 January 2025** (extended deadline).

### Submission Options:

1.  **Full paper:** 4-page limit (excluding references); **required for inclusion in IEEE Xplore or consideration for the Student Paper Competition**.
2.  **Abstract:** 400-600 words; **will not be published in IEEE Xplore**.
3.  **Recently Published Article:** Papers published as peer-reviewed articles after January 1, 2024, in relevant journals ranked within Q1 based on ISI or SJR.

All submissions will undergo a peer-review process.

## Key Dates

*   **Abstract/Manuscript Submission System Online:** 14 November 2024
*   **Abstract/Manuscript Submission Deadline:** **17 January 2025**
*   **Student Paper Competition Deadline:** **17 January 2025**
*   **Notifications of Acceptance to Authors:** **20 March 2025**
*   **Final Paper Submission for Accepted Full Manuscripts:** 15 May 2025

For more details on paper submission, please visit the [paper submission web page](paper_submission.php).

callForPapers:
# IJCNLP-AACL 2025: Call for Papers

The International Joint Conference on Natural Language Processing (IJCNLP) and the Asian Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (AACL) 2025 invites the submission of **long and short papers** featuring substantial original, and unpublished research in all aspects of Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing.

## Research Contributions Welcome

In addition to traditional research results, papers may contribute negative findings, survey an area, announce the creation of new resources, argue positions, report novel linguistic insights, and reproduce or fail to reproduce previous work.

## Findings Publication

Papers not selected for the main conference will automatically be considered for publication in the Findings of the Association of Computational Linguistics.

## Special Theme Track

**Advanced Reasoning and Chain-of-Thought in Language Models**

Explore key aspects of advancing reasoning and chain-of-thought capabilities in language models. We welcome innovative approaches to enhance step-by-step logical deduction, verifiable reasoning, and fact-checking methodologies.

*   **Logical Deduction:** Step-by-step reasoning enhancement
*   **Fact-Checking:** Verifiable reasoning systems
*   **Cross-Domain:** Interpretable reasoning methods

## Submission Topics

IJCNLP-AACL 2025 welcomes submissions across all areas of NLP and Computational Linguistics, including:

*   Computational Social Science
*   Cultural Analytics
*   Dialogue and Interactive Systems
*   Discourse and Pragmatics
*   Efficient/Low-resource Methods for NLP
*   Ethics, Bias, and Fairness
*   Generation
*   Information Extraction
*   Information Retrieval and Text Mining
*   Interpretability and Analysis of Models for NLP
*   Language Modeling
*   Linguistic Theories, Cognitive Modeling and Psycholinguistics
*   Machine Learning for NLP
*   Machine Translation
*   Multilinguality and Language Diversity
*   Multimodality (Language Grounding to Vision, Robotics)
*   NLP Applications
*   Phonology, Morphology and Word Segmentation
*   Question Answering
*   Resources and Evaluation
*   Semantics (Lexical, Sentence-level, Textual Inference)
*   Sentiment Analysis, Stylistic Analysis, Argument Mining
*   Speech Processing and Spoken Language Understanding
*   Summarization
*   Syntax (Tagging, Chunking and Parsing)

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 11:59PM UTC-12:00 ("anywhere on Earth")

*   **ARR Submission Deadline:** July 28, 2025 (Long & Short Papers)
*   **Commitment Deadline:** October 10, 2025 (IJCNLP-AACL 2025)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** October 25, 2025 (Long & Short Papers)
*   **Camera-ready Papers Due:** November 10, 2025 (Long & Short)
*   **Main Conference:** December 20-24, 2025
*   **Workshops and Tutorials:** December 23-24, 2025

## Two-Stage Review Process

IJCNLP-AACL 2025 uses ACL Rolling Review (ARR) as the reviewing system.

1.  **Submit to ARR:** Submit articles to ARR for review. Receive reviews and meta-reviews. **Double-blind review process**. Option to make papers publicly visible.
2.  **Commit to Conference:** Commit reviewed articles to IJCNLP-AACL. Senior Area Chairs make decisions based on ARR reviews and meta-reviews. Option to revise and resubmit.

## Mandatory Reviewing Workload

Authors must specify which co-authors are committing to cover reviewing in the ARR submission cycle. This strengthens our commitment to the peer review process.

## Paper Submission Details

*   **Long Papers:**
    *   Length: **8 pages** (+ 1 additional page for camera-ready)
    *   Content: Substantial original research
    *   Presentation: Oral or poster as determined by committee
*   **Short Papers:**
    *   Length: **4 pages** (+ 1 additional page for camera-ready)
    *   Content: Focused contributions or preliminary results
    *   Presentation: Oral or poster as determined by committee

## Submission Requirements

*   Two-way anonymized review process
*   Follow ARR submission guidelines
*   Include responsible NLP research checklist
*   Specify limitations section
*   Proper authorship attribution
*   Citation and comparison guidelines
*   Optional supplementary materials
*   Writing assistance disclosure

## Contact Information

*   **General Chair:** Kentaro Inui (Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence)
*   **Program Chairs:** Sakriani Sakti (Nara Institute of Science and Technology), Haofen Wang (Tongji University), Derek F. Wong (University of Macau)
*   **Paper Submission & Reviews:** [editors@aclrollingreview.org](mailto:editors@aclrollingreview.org)
*   **Commitment & Post-Review:** [ijcnlp-aacl2025-pc@googlegroups.com](mailto:ijcnlp-aacl2025-pc@googlegroups.com)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IJCAI 2025

Welcome to IJCAI 2025, the 34th International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence! This premier international gathering of researchers in AI will take place in **Montreal, Canada, from August 16 to August 22, 2025**. A satellite event will be hosted in **Guangzhou, China, from August 28 to August 31, 2025**, to support authors who may experience difficulties obtaining Canadian visas.

Since its founding in 1969, IJCAI has been the leading conference for the global AI community, promoting the exchange of groundbreaking advancements and achievements in artificial intelligence research.

## Main Track

Submissions to IJCAI 2025 should report significant, original, and previously unpublished results on any aspect of artificial intelligence. Papers on novel AI research problems, AI techniques for novel application domains, and papers that cross discipline boundaries within AI are especially encouraged.

## Special Tracks

In addition to the main track, authors can submit papers to several special tracks:

*   **AI, Arts & Creativity**
*   **Human-Centred Artificial Intelligence**
*   **AI4Tech: AI Enabling Critical Technologies**
*   **AI And Social Good**
*   **Survey Track**
*   **Demonstrations Track**
*   **Art Gallery**
*   **Competitions and Challenges**

*Note: These special tracks will post their calls for papers later this year, and their deadlines, procedures, and policies may differ from those described for the main track.* 

## Submission Requirements

### Paper Length and Format

*   Papers must be no longer than **9 pages in total**: 7 pages for the body of the paper (including figures/tables) and up to 2 pages for references.
*   An optional ethics statement can be placed either in the main body or on the reference pages.
*   For accepted papers, the last two pages can also contain acknowledgements and an optional contribution statement.
*   Up to two additional pages may be purchased at an additional cost per page for accepted papers.
*   Overlength papers will be rejected without review.
*   Papers must be submitted in **PDF format** and adhere to the IJCAI 2025 guidelines. Submissions that violate the style (e.g., by decreasing margins or font sizes) may be rejected without review.
*   The updated LaTeX styles and Word template will be available in December 2024.

### Supplementary Material

*   Authors may submit up to 50MB of supplementary material (e.g., appendices, proofs, data, source code) in PDF or ZIP format.
*   Supplementary material must be **anonymized**.

### Anonymity

*   IJCAI 2025 uses a **double-blind reviewing process**.
*   Authors are responsible for anonymizing their submissions, including author names, affiliations, and any other identifying information (even in supplementary material).
*   Refer to your work in the third person (e.g., "Previously, Kwok et al. [8] have shown that...").
*   Remove identifying information from PDF metadata.
*   Submissions that violate anonymity will be rejected without review.

### Ethics Policy and Statement

*   IJCAI is committed to the highest standards of research integrity.
*   Submissions must adhere to fundamental ethical principles, including responsible data use and mitigating potential societal harms.
*   Reviewers will flag glaring ethical violations. Such submissions will be reviewed by the Ethics Chair.
*   Authors may include an ethics statement discussing ethical issues and mitigation strategies; this is optional but recommended for papers working with sensitive data or tasks.

### Dual Submissions

*   IJCAI 2025 will not accept papers that are currently under review, have already been published, or have been accepted for publication in a journal or another venue with formally published proceedings.
*   Authors are not permitted to submit their paper to another venue during the IJCAI 2025 review period.
*   Papers submitted to ICLR 2025 are eligible if notifications precede the IJCAI 2025 deadline. Resubmissions must include resubmission information, and a cover letter explaining how concerns from previous reviews were addressed is strongly encouraged.

### Generative AI Models

*   Generative AI models (e.g., ChatGPT, BARD, LLaMA) do **not** satisfy the criteria for authorship.
*   Authors using LLMs in the writing process assume full responsibility for content, including plagiarism and correctness.
*   Research on or involving LLMs is encouraged. Text generated by an LLM as part of the methodology or experimental analysis must be properly documented.

### Author Commitment to Reviewing

*   By submitting, authors volunteer to be potential PC members/reviewers for IJCAI 2025 and may be asked to review papers.
*   Exemptions apply to those already involved in the organizing committee or not qualified to be PC members.

## Important Dates (Main Track)

(All times are 23:59 Anywhere On Earth, UTC-12)

*   **Abstract submission deadline:** January 16, 2025
*   **Author information and Full paper submission deadline:** January 23, 2025
*   **Summary reject notification:** March 7, 2025
*   **Author response period:** April 6-9, 2025
*   **Paper notification:** April 28, 2025

## Review Process

*   **Two-phase reviewing:** Every paper receives two reviews in Phase 1. Papers advancing to Phase 2 will receive additional reviews and an author response opportunity.
*   **Summary rejects:** Papers with less positive Phase 1 reviews may be rejected without author response.
*   **Full paper review:** Papers passing summary reject will undergo a full review process, coordinated by Area Chairs (ACs) and Senior Area Chairs (SACs).
*   **Author response:** Responses should be concise and are not a dialogue. They will be visible to SAC, AC, SPC, and PCs.

## Publication Opportunities

A selection of distinguished papers will be invited for expedited reviewing and publication in the **Artificial Intelligence Journal (AIJ)** or the **Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research (JAIR)**.

## Contact

For inquiries not answered in the call for papers, please email: [pcchair@2025.ijcai.org](mailto:pcchair@2025.ijcai.org)

## Participation

At least one author of each accepted paper must participate in the conference at Montreal to present the work. Authors unable to obtain Canadian visas can request to participate in the Guangzhou satellite event. Papers not presented will be excluded from proceedings unless exceptional circumstances are approved.

callForPapers:
# IKE'25: Call for Papers

The 24th International Conference on Information & Knowledge Engineering (IKE'25) is being held jointly with The 2025 World Congress in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, and Applied Computing (CSCE'25) from **July 21-24, 2025, in Las Vegas, USA**.

IKE'25 aims to provide a platform for researchers, scholars, professionals, students, and academicians to foster working relationships and gain access to the latest research results. The primary goal is to offer an interdisciplinary venue for discussing ongoing innovations, applications, and solutions to challenging problems related to engineering human brain processes, learning mechanisms, and decision-making processes.

## Topics of Interest

Prospective authors are invited to submit papers on topics that include, but are not limited to:

*   Information Retrieval Systems
*   Knowledge Management and Cyber-Learning
*   Database Engineering and Systems

*   Transaction Systems
*   Search Methods
*   Ontologies and Semantics
*   Object-oriented Modeling and Systems
*   Case-based Reasoning
*   Digital Watermarking
*   Classical Aspects of Information Theory
*   Coding Theory
*   Quantum Information Theory
*   Applications (e-Commerce, Multimedia, Business, Banking, ...)
*   Emerging Technologies and Related Issues
*   Natural Language Processing
*   Information Integration
*   Multi-cultural Information Systems
*   Domain Analysis and Modeling
*   Metamodelling
*   Education and Training Issues
*   Knowledge Mining

## Information and Knowledge Engineering in the Context of Big Data

*   Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) Databases
*   Information Mining Grids
*   Distributed Databases
*   Cluster Analysis
*   Crowdsourcing
*   Data Fusion and Integration
*   Neural Networks
*   Pattern Recognition
*   Data Anomaly Detection
*   Supervised and Unsupervised Learning
*   Time Series Analysis and Visualisation
*   Search-based Applications

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Website:** Prospective authors are invited to submit their papers by uploading them to the evaluation web site at: [https://american-cse.org/drafts/](https://american-cse.org/drafts/)
*   **Paper Categories & Page Limitations:** Refer to [https://american-cse.org/csce2025/paper_categories](https://american-cse.org/csce2025/paper_categories) for categories and page limitations.
*   **File Formats:** Submissions must be in either PDF or MS WORD formats.
*   **First Page Requirements:** The first page of the paper should include:
    *   Title of the paper
    *   Name, affiliation, City, Country, and email address of each author (identify the name of the Contact Author).
    *   Abstract (between 100 and 120 words)
    *   A maximum of 6 topical keywords (Indexed Terms).
    *   The type of the submission (e.g., "Regular Research Paper", "Short Research Paper", or "Extended Abstract/Poster Research Paper").
*   **Formatting:** For draft papers, all reasonable formatting/typesetting are acceptable. Authors of accepted papers will receive specific typesetting instructions to prepare their final versions using the standard Springer Nature typesetting format available at: [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines).
*   **Originality:** All submissions must be original and must not have been previously published or currently under consideration for publication elsewhere.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published by **Springer Nature** in the proceedings (Research Books) and indexed in major Science Citation Indexation databases, including Scopus, DBLP, EI Engineering Index, Compendex, Inspec databases, Springer Link, Google Scholar, Conference CPCI Citation Index (part of Clarivate Analytics' Web of Science), ACM Digital Library, IO-Port, MathSciNet, and Zentralblatt MATH, among others.

## Presentation Modes

This year's Congress will be held in person (face-to-face); however, online presentation options will also be available for authors and speakers who are unable to attend physically. Most presentations are expected to be delivered face-to-face.

## Important Dates

*   **Conference Dates:** July 21-24, 2025
*   *Other deadlines such as submission, notification, and registration are not explicitly provided in the available text.* 

## Contact Information

Questions and inquiries should be sent to: **CSCE'25 Conference Secretariat: cs@american-cse.org**

callForPapers:
# IJCAR 2026: Call for Papers

The 13th International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) is a premier international conference that brings together the world's leading researchers in automated reasoning. It is part of the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC) 2026, which unites several major conferences in logic and computer science.

IJCAR 2026 will be held in **Lisbon, Portugal**, from **July 26 to July 29, 2026**, as part of the second week of FLoC. The conference focuses on logic and its applications in computer science, covering diverse fields such as artificial intelligence, computational complexity, distributed computing, database systems, hardware design, programming languages, and software engineering.

## Keynote Speakers

*   Alessandra Russo (Imperial College London)
*   Giuseppe De Diacomo (University of Oxford)
*   Işıl Dilling (University of Texas at Austin)
*   Leonardo de Moura (AWS and Lean FRO)

## Topics of Interest

IJCAR covers all aspects of automated reasoning, including but not limited to:

*   Automated theorem proving (propositional, first-order, higher-order)
*   Model checking
*   Satisfiability checking (SAT/SMT)
*   Constraint satisfaction
*   Automated deduction in various theories
*   Logic programming and automated reasoning
*   Knowledge representation and reasoning
*   Formal verification of hardware and software
*   Applications of automated reasoning in AI, mathematics, and other sciences

## Submission Guidelines

Detailed submission guidelines, including paper length, formatting requirements, and the submission system, will be announced closer to the submission deadline. Authors are encouraged to check the official IJCAR 2026 website for updates.

## Important Dates

*   **Summer School:** July 13-17, 2026
*   **Workshops:** July 18-19, 2026
*   **Week 1 Conferences (CP, FSCD, ICLP, KR, LICS, SAT):** July 20-23, 2026
*   **Workshops:** July 24-25, 2026
*   **Week 2 Conferences (CAV, CSF, IJCAR, ITP):** July 26-29, 2026

*Specific deadlines for IJCAR paper submissions (e.g., submission deadline, notification date, camera-ready deadline) will be published on the official conference website.*

callForPapers:
# Inscrypt 2024: Call for Papers

The 20th China International Conference on Information Security and Cryptology (**Inscrypt 2024**), in cooperation with IACR, will be held in **Kunming, China**, from **December 14 to 16, 2024**. The conference is co-organized by Yunnan University, Shandong University, Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd., Quan Cheng Shandong Laboratory, and the Chinese Association for Cryptologic Research of China.

Inscrypt is an annual conference targeting top research results in information security, cryptology, and their applications. It seeks high-quality research contributions in the form of well-developed papers, organized into two successive tracks for **crypto** and **security**.

The conference proceedings will be published by **Springer-Verlag in the LNCS series**.

This year, Inscrypt will be co-located with the 9th Security Standardisation Research (**SSR 2024**) Conference. More details can be found at [https://ssresearch24.github.io/](https://ssresearch24.github.io/).

## Topics of Interest

Authors are invited to submit full papers presenting new research results related to cryptology, information security, and their applications for either the Crypto Track or Security Track. Areas of interest include, but are not limited to:

### Cryptologic Track

*   Foundations of Cryptography
*   Provable Security
*   Sequences and Boolean Functions
*   Secure Multiparty Computation
*   Symmetric Key Cryptosystems
*   Public Key Cryptosystems
*   Implementation of Cryptosystems
*   Hash Functions and MACs
*   Block Cipher Modes of Operation
*   Key Management and Key Recovery
*   Security Protocols and Their Analysis
*   Information Hiding and Watermarking
*   Secure computation outsourcing
*   Functional computation and verifiable computation
*   Obfuscation
*   Leakage-resilient cryptography

### Security Track

*   Access Control
*   Authentication and Authorization
*   Biometric Security
*   Distributed System Security
*   Electronic Commerce Security
*   Intrusion Detection
*   Network Security
*   Security Modeling and Architectures
*   Intellectual Property Protection
*   Mobile System Security
*   Operating System Security
*   Risk Evaluation and Security Certification
*   Prevention and Detection of Malicious Codes
*   Privacy-enhancing technologies
*   Genomic privacy and SDN security
*   Big data and cloud security

## Important Dates

1.  **Submission Deadline:** September 5, 2024
2.  **Early Notification:** October 15, 2024
3.  **Notification of Acceptance:** November 10, 2024
4.  **Pre-proceedings Version Deadline:** December 1, 2024
5.  **Proceedings Version Deadline:** December 31, 2024

## Submission Guidelines

*   The conference language is **English**.
*   All submissions must be **anonymous**, with no author names, affiliations, acknowledgments, or obvious references.
*   Papers should begin with a title, a short abstract, and a list of keywords. The introduction should summarize the contributions at a level appropriate for a non-specialist reader.
*   Papers must be intelligible and self-contained within **20 pages** including references and appendices.
*   Submissions not meeting these guidelines risk rejection without consideration of their merits.
*   All submissions must describe **original research** that is not published or currently under review by another conference or journal.
*   It is highly advised to prepare the submissions in the **Springer LNCS format**.
*   Submissions should be made electronically via the EasyChair Conference System: [http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=inscrypt2024](http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=inscrypt2024).
*   More information on formatting can be found at the conference website: [https://inscrypt2024.github.io/#](https://inscrypt2024.github.io/#).

## Registration Fees

Registration fees for Inscrypt 2024 (co-located with SSR 2024) are as follows:

*   **Inscrypt&SSR Author Registration (Regular Author Registration):** **3900 CNY / 550 USD**
*   **Inscrypt&SSR Participant Registration (Participant Registration):** **3000 CNY / 420 USD**

> If a paper exceeds 20 pages, extra pages will cost **RMB 1,500** or **USD 200 per page**. The maximum number of additional pages cannot exceed 6 pages (total maximum 26 pages).

### How to Register

1.  Fill out the [registration form](download/Inscrypt2024-receipt.xlsx) with all required details.
2.  Email the filled form to `inscrypt2024@163.com` with the subject: `Inscrypt 2024 Registration for #PAPER-ID (if applicable) #NAME #Work unit`.
    *   Include a copy of the bank draft or bank wire receipt or Transaction ID of your registration fee payment.
    *   (For Author registration only) Include the name of the author who will give the presentation during the conference.

### Modes of Payment

*   **For Foreign Residents (Payment in USD ONLY):**
    *   Transfer your registration fee to the following banking account:
        *   **Account Name:** Kunming Network Security Association
        *   **Account No:** 53050189534500000675
        *   **SWIFT Code:** PCBCCNBJYNX

*   **For Chinese Residents (Payment in CNY):**
    *   Transfer your registration fee to the following banking account:
        *   **开户银行名称:** 中国建设银行股份有限公司昆明海源北路支行
        *   **账号:** 53050189534500000675
        *   **户名:** 昆明市网络安全协会
        *   **开户银行行号:** 105731003300
        *   **汇款备注信息:** `Inscrypt2024#论文编号(如适用)#姓名#单位`
    *   Alternatively, payment can be made by scanning the provided QR code (for WeChat Payments). In this case, please mention the **Transaction ID** in your registration email.

Should you have any questions about registration or need assistance, please contact `inscrypt2024@163.com`.

## Contact Information

*   **General Inquiries & Registration Support:** `inscrypt2024@163.com`
*   **Submission System:** [http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=inscrypt2024](http://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=inscrypt2024)

callForPapers:
# InfVis: Call for Papers

The **Information Visualisation Theory & Practice (InfVis)** conference focuses on presenting current research, state-of-the-art developments, and future directions in visualization and graphics.

InfVis 2025 is a **hybrid event**, offering both in-person and online participation options.

## Themes

The conference covers salient aspects and sub-areas of visualisation and graphics through various symposia. The "Information Visualisation" symposium seeks original projects dealing with, but not limited to, the following topics:

*   Information Appliances & Tools
*   Information Visualisation Metaphor
*   Visual Information Seeking mantra: Overview first, Zoom and filter, then Details on demand
*   Visual Exploration, Interaction, and Navigation
*   Direct manipulation and dynamic queries
*   Distortion Techniques
*   Hierarchical and tree-structured data
*   Network information visualization
*   Focus + Context vs. Overview + Detail
*   Coordination of visualizations
*   Zooming interfaces
*   Temporal data visualization
*   Transformation of Information
*   Web-Based Information Visualisation
*   Information Filters
*   Visualisation for Knowledge Discovery
*   Trend Analysis
*   Information Spaces
*   Large – Scale Data & Information
*   Database Visualisation Systems
*   Framework for Information Visualisation
*   Perception and Cognition – cognitive modeling

## Submission Types

Your work may be submitted as:

*   **Full paper:** (6 pages * IEEE format / per registration) - 4 more pages are possible, subject to excess fee charges.
*   **Short paper:** (4 pages * IEEE format / per registration)
*   **Poster presentation:** Accepted poster contributions are presented as posters and accompanied by a 4-page paper in the proceedings.

*Paper format – IEEE format:* [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)

## Important Dates

*   **30 Sept 2024:** Opening date for paper submissions / Registration online
*   **01 February 2025:** Symposium submission deadline
*   **1 March 2025:** Digital Art Gallery D-ART2024 deadline
*   **15 May 2025 (Revised Date):** Closing date for paper submissions (Some symposium submission deadlines extended to 8 June 2025)
*   **15 June 2025 (Revised Date):** Notification of Reviewing Result – acceptance or rejection
*   **25 June 2025 (Revised Date):** Submission of camera-ready
*   **20 June 2025 (Revised Date):** Early registration closes (reduced fee applies)
*   **30 June 2025:** Closing date for submission of the Video / Poster display version
*   **30 June 2025:** Doctoral Research Workshop – closing date for abstract submission
*   **30 June 2025:** Tutorial Registration Cancellation & Refund date
*   **20 July 2025:** Registration closing dates (Pre-Registration date)
*   **5 Aug 2025:** Tutorial Day and Doctoral Research Workshop
*   **06 – 08 Aug 2025:** Conference Days

## Publication

Accepted and presented papers will be published in the IV 2025 Conference Proceedings and submitted to Conference Publishing Services, as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases. Extended versions of selected papers will be published as a special issue or edited books.

## Awards

*   IV2025 Best Paper of the Year Award
*   IV2025 The Young Researcher of the Year Award
*   Best Oral Presentation Award
*   Best Research Award [For poster presentations]

## Submission & Registration

For submission and registration, please visit: [https://www.conftool.org/IV-cgiv-2025/](https://www.conftool.org/IV-cgiv-2025/)

## Contact

*   General enquiries: [iV_CGiV@graphicslink.co.uk](mailto:iV_CGiV@graphicslink.co.uk)
*   Symposium-specific enquiries:
    *   Ebad Banissi: banissi (@) graphicslink.co.uk
    *   Tony Huang: Weidong.Huang (@) uts.edu.au
    *   Jie Hua: Jie.Hua (@) uts.edu.au

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: INISTA 2025

## About INISTA 2025

The 19th International Conference on Innovations in Intelligent Systems and Applications (INISTA 2025) invites prospective authors to submit their papers. The conference topics cover the entire spectrum of the multi-disciplinary fields of intelligent systems and related applications.

## Submission Process

All paper submissions for INISTA-2025 will be via **EasyChair**: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=inista2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=inista2025).

Prospective authors are encouraged to consult the [Call For Papers](https://conferences.sigappfr.org/inista2025/call-for-papers/) and [Important Dates](https://conferences.sigappfr.org/inista2025/important-dates/) pages for detailed information.

## Important Dates

### Main Conference
*   **Regular paper submission deadline:** **July 20, 2025** (Extended from June 30, 2025)
*   **Notification to authors:** **August 20, 2025** (Extended from July 30, 2025)
*   **Camera-ready and copyright submission deadline:** **September 10, 2025**
*   **Authors registration deadline:** **September 10, 2025**

### Special Tracks
*   **Special Tracks Submission:** **June 16th, 2025**
*   **Special Tracks Notification of Acceptance:** **June 30th, 2025**

### Tutorials
*   **Paper proposals due:** **July 05, 2025**
*   **Notification of acceptance:** **July 31, 2025**

## Calls for Special Tracks and Tutorials

INISTA 2025 welcomes and encourages the proposal of special sessions. Proposals for the Tutorial Track are also invited, focusing on state-of-the-art research, latest developments, and applications of specific intelligent systems.

## Participation Modes

*   **In-person conference:** INISTA 2025 is planned as an in-person event at the American University of Ras Al-Khaimah (AURAK) in Ras Al-Khaimah, UAE.
*   **Online attendance:** Online attendance is possible for authors who cannot attend in person. The organizers are monitoring the pandemic situation to determine if remote participation will be possible for those with travel restrictions.

## Guidelines for Authors

Detailed guidelines for authors, including formatting and submission requirements, can be found at: [https://conferences.sigappfr.org/inista2025/guidelines-for-authors/](https://conferences.sigappfr.org/inista2025/guidelines-for-authors/)

## Keynote Speakers

*   Ernesto Damiani
*   Ismail Hakki Toroslu
*   Jahna Otterbacher

## Publication

Selected papers may be invited for submission of extended versions to a IARIA Journal. The conference is sponsored by IEEE.

callForPapers:
# InSITE 2025: Call for Papers

## Conference Details

The InSITE 2025 conference, organized by the Informing Science Institute in collaboration with the Hiroshima Institute of Technology (HIT), will be held face-to-face in **Hiroshima, Japan**, from **July 20 to July 28, 2025**.

### Theme

"**Resilience and Innovation: Shaping the Future through Global Collaboration**"

## Submission Types

Submissions considered include:

*   Research (Empirical, Qualitative, Theoretical, Student, Research-in-Progress reports)
*   Panels
*   Project Reports
*   Case Studies
*   Abstract Only Submissions

## Important Deadlines

*   **December 15:** Reviewing Starts. Papers submitted in November and early December are most likely to be selected for fast-tracking.
*   **February 15:** Authors notified of decision regarding submission.
*   **March 15:** Final, revised, and camera-ready paper due. Last day to earn "early payment" discount by paying the conference registration fee.
*   **April 15:** For a paper to appear in the proceedings (web), at least one author must register and pay their registration fee by this date.
*   **May 1:** For a paper to appear in the schedule, at least one author must register and pay their registration fee by this date.

## Cancellation Policy

*   Cancellations before April 15 receive a full refund (minus a $25 administration fee).
*   Cancellations from April 15 to May 1 receive a refund of 75% of fees (minus a $25 administration fee), and the submission will not be published.
*   Cancellations after May 1 cannot be refunded, but a substitute may take the delegate's place.
*   Conference materials can be mailed for an additional $50 shipping and handling fee.

## Visa and Funding

Delegates are responsible for obtaining their own visa, securing accommodations, and covering their expenses. It is recommended to apply for a visa at least two months in advance.

## Registration Information

*   **Early Payment Discount:** $50 for payments received by March 15.
*   **Productive Reviewer Discount:** $50.

## Topics of Interest

*   Resilience and Innovation: Shaping the Future through Global Collaboration
*   Teaching Diverse Populations of Students
*   "Fake News": Bias, Misinformation, Disinformation, Propaganda, and fictitious reporting of news
*   Transdisciplinarity and Knowledge Transfer Across Sectors
*   Case Method of Teaching
*   Mentoring and Teaching Doctoral Students
*   Teach IT: Teaching and Learning of IT
*   Cyber Security
*   Accounting Education, Research, and Publication
*   Digital Excellence: Impact, Inclusion, and Imagination
*   Information Security (computer science perspective)
*   Informing Science Research and Application
*   Student Research: Masters & Doctoral Program Research in Progress

# 13th ACM Workshop on Information Hiding and Multimedia Security (IH&MMSec 2025) - Call for Papers

## Overview

The ACM IH&MMSec workshop is a prime event focusing on multimedia security and information-hiding topics. It attracts researchers from academia, industry, and government institutions worldwide.

## Dates

*   **Deadline for special session:** December 06, 2024 / December 13, 2024
*   **Submission site opens:** January 10, 2025
*   **Submissions due:** February 14, 2025 / February 28, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** April 12, 2025
*   **Camera-ready submission due:** May 2, 2025
*   **Workshop Dates:** June 18-20, 2025

## Topics of Interest

*   **Information Hiding:** Steganography, steganalysis, digital watermarking, anonymity, hard-to-intercept communications, and covert channels.
*   **Multimedia Security:** Multimedia authentication, multimedia forensics, biometrics, and privacy.

## Submission

*   Submissions should be made electronically via the CMT submission site: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/13IHMMSec2025/Submission/Index](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/13IHMMSec2025/Submission/Index)
*   For more details, please refer to the [Call for Papers](upload/2025/FormattedCFPwithLogo1.pdf).

## Special Events

*   **SAFE: Synthetic Audio Forensics Evaluation Challenge:** Website open now: [https://stresearch.github.io/SAFE/](https://stresearch.github.io/SAFE/)
*   **Special Sessions:** Two special sessions have been selected.

## Contact

For questions, please reach out to the program chairs at [acm.ihmmsec25@gmail.com](mailto:acm.ihmmsec25@gmail.com).

## Publication

*   Proceedings of the IH&MMSec'25 are now available [here](upload/2025/Proceedings_of_the_IHMMSec25_are_now_available_here). 
*   The workshop features four keynote talks, a panel discussion on content provenance and trust in digital media, and technical sessions on cutting-edge research.
*   Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to a IARIA Journal.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## About IJCB 2025

The IEEE International Joint Conference on Biometrics (IJCB) is the premier international forum for research in biometrics and related technologies. It combines two major biometrics conferences, the IEEE Biometrics Theory, Applications, and Systems (BTAS) conference and the International Conference on Biometrics (ICB), and is made possible through a special agreement between the IEEE Biometrics Council and the IAPR TC-4. IJCB 2025 is the 9th iteration of this major joint event and will be held in Osaka, Japan between **8-11 September 2025** as an in-person conference.

## Call for Contributions

IJCB 2025 invites papers that advance biometric technologies, sensor design, feature extraction and matching algorithms, security and privacy, and the social impact of biometrics technology. Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Face, Iris, Fingerprint, Palmprint
*   Periocular, Ear, Vein, Speech
*   Gait, Gesture and Action Recognition
*   Multi-modal and Multi-Spectral Biometrics
*   Mobile-based Biometrics
*   Template Protection and Cryptosystems
*   Privacy, Demographic Bias, Fairness
*   Biometrics Explainability and Interpretability
*   Template Design, Selection and Update
*   Datasets, Evaluation, Benchmarking
*   Performance Modelling and Prediction
*   Large scale ID Management
*   Anti-spoofing, Presentation Attack Detection
*   Biometric DeepFakes, Digital Data Forensics
*   Biometric-related Law Enforcement and Forensics
*   Biometrics in Healthcare, Banking, IoT
*   Biometric-related Synthetic Realities
*   Ethical, Social and Legal Issues

## Paper Submission

Submitted papers may not be accepted or under review elsewhere. Submissions may be up to **eight pages**, plus additional references, in conference format. Please visit the submission page for additional details on paper formatting.

Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements.

Submission is through CMT: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IJCB2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IJCB2025).

## Awards and TBIOM Special Issue

Several awards will be given out to the best papers from IJCB 2025, including the best paper award, the best student paper award, and daily best poster awards. The awards will consist of a commemorative plaque as well as award money.

Additionally, the authors of the best-reviewed papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their papers to a special issue of the IEEE Transactions on Biometrics, Behavior, and Identity Science (IEEE-TBIOM).

## Important Dates

### Conference Dates

*   IJCB 2025 conference: **September 8-11, 2025**

### Main Conference Papers

*   Abstract and paper submission deadline: **April 11, 2025** / **May 5, 2025** (firm deadline)
*   Review comments to authors: **June 17, 2025**
*   Rebuttal deadline: **June 20, 2025**
*   Decisions to authors: **July 10, 2025**
*   Camera-ready submission: **July 25, 2025**

### Competitions

*   Deadline for submitting proposals: **February 28, 2025**
*   Decisions to organizers: **March 3, 2025**
*   Submission of summary papers: **June 23, 2025** / **June 30, 2025**
*   Notification to authors of summary papers: **July 14, 2025**
*   Camera ready papers: **July 23, 2025**

### Tutorials

*   Tutorial proposals due: **July 20, 2025**
*   Notification of acceptance of the proposed tutorial: **July 30, 2025**
*   Tutorial date: **September 8, 2025**

### Special Sessions

*   Special Session Proposals due: **April 12, 2025** / **April 19, 2025**
*   Notification of acceptance of the Special Sessions: **April 20, 2025** / **April 27, 2025**
*   Special session paper submission deadline: **July 15, 2025**
*   Decision notification: **July 31, 2025**
*   Camera-ready: **August 3, 2025**
*   Special Session Dates: **September 8, 2025**

### Demos and Exhibitions

*   Application deadline: **July 25, 2025**
*   Notifications to authors: **August 1, 2025**

### Doctoral Consortium

*   Application submission deadline: **July 17, 2025**
*   Notification of acceptance: **July 24, 2025**
*   Doctoral consortium date: **September 8, 2025**

### Registration

*   Early Registration Deadline: TBA

## Contact PC

For program related queries: [ijcb2025pcs@googlegroups.com](mailto:ijcb2025pcs@googlegroups.com)

For all other inquiries and questions including VISA and registration queries:

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

Welcome to Interspeech 2025!

Interspeech is the world’s largest and most comprehensive conference on the science and technology of spoken language processing. Interspeech conferences emphasize interdisciplinary approaches addressing all aspects of speech science and technology, ranging from psycholinguistic theories of human speech processing to advanced applications of speech technology.

The theme of Interspeech 2025 is **"Fair and Inclusive Speech Science and Technology"**. This theme aims to celebrate and incorporate the vast speech diversity both within and between individuals, as well as within and between languages. It emphasizes diversity as a source of richness and information, contributing to the development of fairer, more robust, and personalized speech technology applications and more accurate theories of human speech processing. By embracing this diversity, we can create theories and technologies that are inclusive of everyone, ensuring that speech science and technology benefit all individuals and communities.

Interspeech 2025 will feature oral and poster sessions, plenary talks by internationally renowned experts, tutorials, special sessions and challenges, show & tell, exhibits, and satellite events. Following Interspeech 2024, a **Blue Sky track** will be featured. Additionally, a **Speech Science Festival** for the general public will be held on the Sunday prior to Interspeech.

## Paper Submission

Please note that the paper submission deadline is earlier than previous years because the conference is held in August. The paper submission deadline is **February 12, 2025**.

Interspeech 2025 seeks original and innovative papers covering all aspects of human and machine speech science and technology. Papers must be written in English. The paper length is up to **four pages in two columns with an additional page for references and acknowledgments only**.

Submitted papers must conform to the format defined in the paper kit provided on the conference website (and as an overleaf template) and may optionally be accompanied by multimedia files. Interspeech 2025 will follow a **double-blind review process** so papers submitted for review should not reveal the identity or affiliation of the authors.

Authors must declare that their contributions are original and that they have not submitted their papers elsewhere for publication. Papers must be submitted electronically and will be evaluated through rigorous peer review on the basis of novelty and originality, technical correctness, clarity of presentation, key strengths, and quality of references.

The Technical Programme Committee will decide which papers to include in the conference programme using peer review as the primary criterion, with secondary criteria of addressing the conference theme and diversity across the programme as a whole. If accepted, each paper needs to be presented by one of the authors during the in-person conference.

## Blue Sky Track

Interspeech 2024 introduced the new **BLUE SKY track** for highly innovative papers in fields or directions that have not yet been explored. Large-scale experimental evaluation will not be required for papers in this track. The most experienced reviewers will assess the proposals for this track.

## Scientific Areas and Topics

Interspeech 2025 embraces a broad range of science and technology in speech, language and communication, including – but not limited to – the following topics:

*   Human Speech Perception, Production and Acquisition
*   Spoken Language Generation
*   Analysis of Conversation
*   Spoken Language Translation, Information Retrieval, Summarization
*   Speech and Audio Signal Analysis
*   Speech and Language Processing for Health
*   Speech Synthesis
*   Paralinguistics in Speech and Language
*   Spoken Dialogue and Conversational AI Systems
*   Speaker and Language Identification
*   Resources and Evaluation
*   Beyond traditional speech topics (not limited to the provided list)
*   Phonetics, Phonology, and Prosody
*   Automatic Speech Recognition
*   Speech, Voice, and Hearing Disorders
*   Technologies and Systems for New Applications
*   Speech Coding and Enhancement

## Keynote Speakers

*   Prof. Dr. Roger K. Moore
*   Prof. Dr. Alexander Waibel
*   Prof. Dr. Carol Espy-Wilson
*   Dr. Judith Holler

## Important Dates

*   Paper Submission Portal Open: **18 December 2024**
*   Paper Submission Deadline: **12 February 2025**
*   Paper Update Deadline: **19 February 2025**
*   Paper Acceptance Notification: **19 May 2025**

## Contact

*   For questions regarding the technical programme: [TPC-chairs@interspeech2025.org](mailto:TPC-chairs@interspeech2025.org)
*   For general questions: [pco@interspeech2025.org](mailto:pco@interspeech2025.org)

# INLG 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th International Natural Language Generation Conference (INLG 2025) will be held in **Hanoi, Vietnam** from **October 29 - November 2, 2025**. The event will take place at the **Vietnam Institute for Advanced Study in Mathematics**.

INLG 2025 will be taking place before EMNLP 2025 (November 5-9) in Suzhou, China.

## Submission Requirements

*   All accepted papers must be presented in person.
*   Remote presentations are not allowed without a compelling reason, such as visa or health problems, which must be approved by the organizer.
*   Submitted papers for review at INLG 2025 must not be published elsewhere until after the notification of acceptance.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are Anywhere on Earth (UTC-12):

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The IEEE International Joint Conference on Neural Networks (IJCNN) 2025 is the premier international conference in the area of neural networks theory, analysis, and applications. It serves as a leading platform for researchers and practitioners to interact and disseminate knowledge in neural networks and related facets of machine learning.

IJCNN 2025 will be held in Rome, Italy, from **June 30 to July 5, 2025**, at the Pontifical Gregorian University. The conference offers a comprehensive technical program covering various aspects of neural networks and learning systems, including supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, convolutional neural networks, spiking neural networks, cognitive algorithms, and deep learning, along with a wide spectrum of applications.

## Conference Theme

A special track is included dedicated to the conference theme on **“Human-AI interaction in creative arts and sciences”**.

## Paper Submission Types

*   **Regular Paper**:
    *   Description: Original papers submitted to the main conference track and related to the IJCNN 2025 topics.
    *   Length: 6 to 8 pages. 10-page papers are allowed at an additional charge of $100 per extra page.
    *   Publication Type: IEEE Proceedings.
    *   Presentation: Oral or Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **January 30, 2025**.

*   **Special Track Paper**:
    *   Description: Original papers on the conference theme “Human-AI interaction in creative arts and sciences”.
    *   Length: 6 to 8 pages. 10-page papers are allowed at an additional charge of $100 per extra page.
    *   Publication Type: IEEE Proceedings.
    *   Presentation: Oral or Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **January 30, 2025**.

*   **Special Session Paper**:
    *   Description: Original papers submitted to the conference special sessions.
    *   Length: 6 to 8 pages. 10-page papers are allowed at an additional charge of $100 per extra page.
    *   Publication Type: IEEE Proceedings.
    *   Presentation: Oral or Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **January 30, 2025**.

*   **Position Papers**:
    *   Description: Original positional papers submitted to the main conference track.
    *   Length: 6 to 8 pages. 10-page papers are allowed at an additional charge of $100 per extra page.
    *   Publication Type: IEEE Proceedings.
    *   Presentation: Oral or Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **February 15, 2025**.

*   **Competition Regular Paper**:
    *   Description: Original papers submitted to the conference competitions (top 3 teams only +1 paper from the organizers).
    *   Length: 4 to 8 pages. 10-page papers are allowed at an additional charge of $100 per extra page.
    *   Publication Type: IEEE Proceedings.
    *   Presentation: Oral or Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **March 1, 2025**.

*   **Competition Short Paper**:
    *   Description: Solutions and results submitted to the conference competitions.
    *   Length: 2 to 4 pages.
    *   Publication Type: No official publication.
    *   Presentation: Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **March 1, 2025**.

*   **Workshop Regular Paper**:
    *   Description: Original papers submitted to the conference workshops.
    *   Length: 6 to 8 pages. 10-page papers are allowed at an additional charge of $100 per extra page.
    *   Publication Type: IEEE Proceedings.
    *   Presentation: Oral or Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **March 27, 2025**.

*   **Workshop Short Paper**:
    *   Description: Ideas, already published works, or preliminary results submitted to the conference workshops.
    *   Length: 2 to 4 pages.
    *   Publication Type: No official publication.
    *   Presentation: Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **March 20, 2025**.

*   **J2C Paper**:
    *   Description: Papers accepted at selected journals related to Neural Networks.
    *   Length: Not specified.
    *   Publication Type: Poster.
    *   Presentation: Poster.
    *   Submission Deadline: **April 10, 2025**.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are at 11:59 PM AoE time:

*   **Special Session and Competition Proposals Deadline:** November 30, 2024
*   **Workshop and Tutorial Proposals Deadline:** January 5, 2025
*   **Paper Submission Deadline (Regular, Special Track, Special Session):** January 30, 2025
*   **Position Papers Deadline:** February 15, 2025
*   **Competition Paper Submission Deadline:** March 1, 2025
*   **Workshop Paper Submission Deadline:** March 27, 2025
*   **Paper Acceptance Notification (Regular, Special Track, Special Session):** March 31, 2025
*   **Competition Paper Acceptance Notification:** April 1, 2025
*   **J2C Paper Submission Deadline:** April 10, 2025
*   **Workshop Paper Acceptance Notification:** April 15, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Paper Submission Deadline:** May 1, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Prospective authors are invited to submit complete papers of no more than **eight (8) pages** in the IEEE two-column conference proceedings format.
*   Please refer to the [Paper Submission Guidelines](https://2025.ijcnn.org/authors/initial-author-instructions).
*   All the accepted and presented papers will be published on IEEE Xplore Digital Library and indexed by Scopus.
*   You can download the Call for Papers [here](https://confcats-siteplex.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/ijcnn25/ijcnn25_cfp_web_14_bfd31f0f4f.pdf).

## Virtual Participation

IJCNN 2025 will offer the option for authors to present their work remotely if necessary. If you plan to present remotely, you must clearly indicate this when registering for the conference by the deadline of **May 8, 2025**. Remote presenters are required to submit a pre-recorded video of their presentation, which will be made available on demand to conference attendees. Please note, there will be no live presentations for remote participants. No changes to your presentation format will be accepted after the strict deadline of May 8, 2025.

## AI-Generated Text Policy

The IEEE policy requires disclosure of AI-generated text in the acknowledgements section of any paper submitted to an IEEE Conference or Periodical. The sections of the paper that use AI-generated text shall have a citation to the AI system used to generate the text. Please check the "Guidance for IEEE Publications Regarding AI-Generated Text" in the MCE newsletter.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: 31st IEEE International Symposium on On-Line Testing and Robust System Design (IOLTS 2025)

The IEEE International Symposium on On-Line Testing and Robust System Design (IOLTS) explores emerging trends and novel concepts related to all aspects of the robustness of microelectronic circuits and systems. The 2025 edition of IOLTS will be a **full in-person event** organized in **Ischia island (Naples region), Italy, from July 7 to July 9, 2025**.

You are invited to participate and submit your contributions to IOLTS’25.

## Topics of Interest

The areas of interest include (but are not limited to) the following topics:

*   Dependable system design
*   Dependable Computer Architectures
*   Design-for-Reliability
*   Design for Reliability approaches for Low-Power
*   Cross-layer reliability approaches
*   Fault-Tolerant and Fail-Safe systems
*   Functional safety
*   Self-Test and Self-Repair
*   Self-Healing design
*   Self-Regulating design
*   Self-Adapting design
*   Reliability issues of Low-Power Design
*   Robustness evaluation
*   Quality, yield, reliability, and lifespan issues in nanometer technologies
*   Variability, Aging, EMI, and Radiation Effects in nanometer technologies
*   On-line testing techniques for digital, analog, and mixed-signal circuits
*   Self-checking circuits and coding theory
*   On-line monitoring of current, temperature, process variations, and aging
*   Power density and overheating issues in nanometer technologies
*   Field Diagnosis, Maintainability, and Reconfiguration
*   Design for Security
*   Fault-based attacks and countermeasures
*   Design for Robustness for automotive, railway, avionics, space, large industrial applications, IT infrastructure, cloud computing, and wired, cellular, and satellite communications
*   CAD for robust circuits design

## Key Dates

*   **Submission of title, abstract, and authors:** February 23, March 9, 2025
*   **Final Paper Submission:** March 2, March 16, 2025
*   **Author Notification:** April 18, April 30, 2025
*   **Camera-ready paper and author registration:** May 25, May 31, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 7 - 9, 2025

## Additional Opportunities

*   The best accepted papers of IOLTS 2025 will be invited to submit extended versions for an **IEEE Transactions on Device and Materials Reliability (TDMR) special issue** dedicated to IOLTS 2025.
*   There is a **Call for Project Dissemination** available.
*   **Guidelines for presenters** are available.

## Further Information

*   **Download the Call for Paper:** [CFP_25_v2.pdf](https://orion.polito.it/iolts/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/CFP_25_v2.pdf)
*   **Registration:** [Register to IOLTS 25!](https://orion.polito.it/iolts/registration/)
*   **Accommodation:** [Hotel special prices](https://orion.polito.it/iolts/hotels/)
*   **Camera-ready instructions:** [Camera-ready preparation](https://orion.polito.it/iolts/camera-ready-preparation/)

callForPapers:
# ACM Internet Measurement Conference (IMC) 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 Internet Measurement Conference (IMC) will be held in **Madison, Wisconsin, USA**, from **October 28-31, 2025**. This event, sponsored by ACM SIGCOMM, is the 25th in a series focusing on Internet measurement and analysis.

## Key Novelties for 2025

IMC 2025 introduces two deadlines per year (November 21st, 2024 and May 15th, 2025) with an optional one-shot-revision process. This aims to:

*   Further enhance the quality and timeliness of published papers.
*   Provide more flexibility in submission timing with guaranteed timeliness of reviews.
*   Allow papers that are promising but not yet fully ready to receive a one-shot-revision decision instead of rejection (allowed only for one round).
*   Enable researchers to spread out their submissions throughout the year and submit high-quality work.

## Important Dates

### Cycle 1 Deadline

*   **Paper registration (with abstract):** November 14, 2024
*   **Paper submission:** November 21, 2024
*   **Early reject notification:** Feb 19th, 2025
*   **Notification:** Mar 26, 2025
*   **Camera-ready due:** Apr 26, 2025

### Cycle 2 Deadline

*   **Expression of Interest (papers for the Replicability Track):** March 5, 2025
*   **Notification for the Replicability Track Expression of Interest:** March 7, 2025
*   **Paper registration (with abstract, including invited papers to Replicability Track):** May 8, 2025
*   **Paper submission (including invited papers to Replicability Track):** May 15, 2025
*   **Paper submission (one-shot review papers from Cycle 1 deadline):** June 20th, 2025
*   **Early reject notification:** July 10th, 2025
*   **Notification:** Aug 18, 2025
*   **Camera-ready due:** Sep 20, 2025

## Submission

*   For Cycle 2 submission (deadline May 15), please submit your paper at [https://imc2025-cycle2.hotcrp.com/](https://imc2025-cycle2.hotcrp.com/).
*   Please submit your Expression of Interest for the Replicability Track at [https://imc2025-repro.hotcrp.com](https://imc2025-repro.hotcrp.com).

## Replicability Track

*   **Call for Replicability Track Submissions:** Released on February 21, 2025.
*   **Apply by:** April 8, 2025 (for the Shadow TPC).

## Policy Against Discrimination and Harassment

ACM IMC 2025 strongly endorses the [ACM Anti-Harassment policy](https://www.acm.org/code-of-conduct).

## Conference Venue

Wisconsin Institute for Discovery on the University of Wisconsin - Madison campus.

## Sponsorship

Information about sponsors and supporters will be updated.

callForPapers:
# IMVIP 2025: Call for Papers

The International Machine Vision and Image Processing Conference (IMVIP 2025) will take place from **September 1-3, 2025**, at **Ulster University, Derry~Londonderry, Northern Ireland**.

IMVIP is the annual conference of the Irish Pattern Recognition and Classification Society, a member body of the International Association for Pattern Recognition (IAPR).

## Topics of Interest

Contributions are sought in all aspects of image processing, pattern analysis and machine vision, including but not restricted to the following topics:

*   Visually Guided Robot Manipulation and Navigation
*   Computer Vision for Autonomous Vehicles
*   Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality
*   Data Clustering and Texture Analysis
*   Image & Video Representation, Compression and Coding
*   Medical and Biomedical Imaging
*   Active Vision, Tracking and Motion Analysis
*   Object and Event Recognition
*   Face and Gesture Recognition
*   2D, 3D Scene Analysis and Visualisation
*   Deep Learning for Computer Vision
*   Image/Shape Representation and Recovery
*   Applications, Architectures and Systems Integration

## Submission Details

*   **Full Papers:** Must be a maximum of **8 pages** including references and appendices.
*   **Short Papers:** Must be a maximum of **4 pages** including references and appendices.

### Templates

*   [Latex Template](imvip_Formatting_Instructions.zip)
*   [Paper MS Word Templates](imvip_Formatting_Instructions.docx)

## Submission

*   Submit via Easychair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=imvip2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=imvip2025)

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Deadline:** May 16, 2025 (Extended to **June 6, 2025**)
*   **Short Paper Deadline:** **June 6, 2025**
*   **Acceptance Notification:** June 30, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** July 10, 2025
*   **Early Bird Registration:** June 30 - July 10, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** September 1-3, 2025

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Dr. Cornelia Fermuller**
    *   Research Scientist, Computer Vision and Human Vision, University of Maryland
    *   Keynote title: Learning to Play: AI Technologies for Supporting Violin Instruction and Motor Skill Acquisition

*   **Abulele Mditshwa**
    *   Amazon Web Services (AWS) Solutions Architect, Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa
    *   Keynote title: Leveraging AWS Rekognition for Advanced Computer Vision Applications: Industry Use Cases and Best Practices

*   **Oisin Mac Aodha**
    *   Reader in Machine Learning, School of Informatics, University of Edinburgh
    *   Keynote title: Learning from Visual Data in the Wild

## Registration

Fees include coffee breaks, lunch on Tuesday and Wednesday, and the conference dinner on Tuesday evening. Registration also includes annual membership to the IPRCS, IAPR, and IFCS. Each registration covers one paper only.

*   **Student rate early registration (before July 10):** £130
*   **Full rate early registration (before July 10):** £150
*   **Student registration (after July 10):** £190
*   **Full registration (after July 10):** £210

*   [Register Here](https://store.ulster.ac.uk/product-catalogue/faculty-of-computing-engineering/school-of-computing-and-intelligent-systems/imvip-2025)

## Travel Bursaries

IMVIP 2025 offers 4 travel bursaries for student attendance. To be eligible, you must have an accepted paper and be a registered student.

*   **Sponsorship:** Irish Pattern and Classification Society.
*   **Bursaries:** 2x National (€250 each) and 2x International (€500 each).
*   **Application Deadline:** July 30, 2025
*   **Application Form:** [https://forms.cloud.microsoft/e/A3QvDUDhbu](https://forms.cloud.microsoft/e/A3QvDUDhbu)

## Local Information

*   **Venue:** Ulster University, Derry~Londonderry
*   For information on accommodation, things to do, and travel, please visit [Visit Derry](https://www.visitderry.com/).

## Organising Committee

*   Prof. Sonya Coleman, Ulster University, Chair
*   Dr. Dermot Kerr, Ulster University, Chair
*   Deepika Nikam, Ulster University
*   Justin Quinn, Ulster University
*   Philip Vance, Ulster University

## Contact

For enquiries: sa.coleman at ulster dot ac dot uk

callForPapers:
# 2025 IFSA World Congress & NAFIPS Annual Meeting: Call for Papers

The 2025 IFSA World Congress and NAFIPS Annual Meeting will be held in **Banff, Alberta, Canada**, from **August 16-19, 2025**.

## Venue

The conference will take place in Banff, Alberta, known for its stunning Rocky Mountain scenery and cultural attractions.

## Aims and Scope

As a unique international conference in fuzzy sets and soft computing, the 2025 IFSA-NAFIPS Joint Congress aims to unite scientists, engineers, students, and practitioners to present recent research accomplishments and foster interdisciplinary research linkages.

## Topics

The congress covers all aspects of fuzzy systems and their applications, including but not limited to:

*   Fuzzy sets and fuzzy logic
*   Mathematical foundations of fuzzy sets and fuzzy systems
*   Approximate reasoning, fuzzy inference models, and soft computing
*   Fuzzy decision analysis, decision making, optimization, and design
*   Fuzzy system architectures and hardware
*   Fuzzy methods in data analysis, statistics, and imprecise probability
*   Fuzzy databases and information retrieval
*   Fuzzy pattern recognition and image processing
*   Fuzzy sets in management science
*   Fuzzy control and robotics
*   Possibility theory
*   Fuzzy sets and logic in ontology, web, and social networks
*   Fuzzy preference modeling
*   Fuzzy sets in operations research and manufacturing
*   Fuzzy database mining and financial forecasting
*   Fuzzy neural networks
*   Evolutionary and hybrid systems
*   Intelligent agents and ambient intelligence
*   Learning, adaptive, and evolvable fuzzy systems

## Focused Sessions

Proposals for focused sessions on fundamentals, algorithms, and innovative applications of fuzzy sets and soft computing are welcome. Session proposals should include a short description, relevance to the congress, and potential contributors. Focused sessions will be open to all participants.

## Important Dates

**Full Papers (6-12 pages, to appear in the Springer Proceedings):**

*   Submission due: ~~April 13, 2025~~ **April 27, 2025** (NEW)
*   Notification of Acceptance: June 1, 2025
*   Camera Ready: June 15, 2025

**Extended Abstracts (1-2 pages, to appear only in the Conference Booklet):**

*   Submission due: June 22, 2025
*   Camera Ready: July 7, 2025

**Late-Breaking Papers (4-6 pages, to appear in Springer Proceedings):**

*   Submission due: June 22, 2025
*   Camera Ready: July 7, 2025

**Conference Dates:** August 16-19, 2025

## Submission

Submissions for full papers, extended abstracts, and late-breaking papers can be made through the EasyChair system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ifsanafips2025ealb](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ifsanafips2025ealb)

## Registration

Registration is now open. Please visit the [registration page](href="registration") for details on fees and venue information.

## Travel Information

Banff Airporter is the preferred travel partner, offering a 15% discount on shuttle services from Calgary International Airport to Banff Centre with promo code **IFSA2025** for travel between August 13-22, 2025. Book at least 2-3 weeks in advance.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE International Scientific Conference on Informatics (ISI 2025)

The **2025 IEEE International Conference on Intelligence and Security Informatics (ISI 2025)** will be held on **July 12-13, 2025**, in **Hong Kong, China**.

Intelligence and security informatics (ISI) is an interdisciplinary field that bridges academic researchers and industry professionals in areas such as information technology, social and behavioral sciences, computer science, law, and public policy. The conference aims to advance the understanding of the interrelationships between technology, humans, organizations, and security.

## Topics of Interest

The conference invites submissions on a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:

### Artificial Intelligence Security
*   Adversarial example methods and applications
*   Robustness defense research and model enhancement mechanisms
*   Malicious attack detection and mitigation research
*   Transferability of machine learning applications
*   Privacy-preserving machine learning application development
*   Decentralized data processing and distributed security protocols
*   Fairness evaluation metrics for artificial intelligence applications
*   Artificial intelligence applications in cybersecurity scenarios
*   Intrusion detection using machine learning methods
*   Artificial intelligence bias identification
*   Governance of generative artificial intelligence misuse
*   Legal responsibility of artificial intelligence systems
*   Domain-specific artificial intelligence security
*   Human-AI interaction security

### LLM Security
*   Adversarial prompt research on LLM
*   Data privacy protection methods for LLM
*   Bias detection metrics for LLM
*   Fairness analysis methods for LLM
*   Transparency in LLM-based decision making
*   Ethical implications of LLM development
*   Privacy leakage from training datasets for LLM construction
*   Content Moderation of LLM against harmful or inappropriate outputs
*   Security of fine-tuning LLM in domain-specific scenarios
*   Misuse of LLM in security-critical applications
*   Human-LLM interaction risks

### Security Analytics and Threat Intelligence
*   Threat pattern models and modeling tools
*   Real-time situational awareness
*   Intrusion and cybersecurity threat detection and analysis
*   Cyber-physical-social system security and incident management
*   Computing and networking infrastructure protection
*   Crime analysis and prevention
*   Forecasting threats and measuring the impact of threats
*   Surveillance and intelligence through unconventional means
*   Information security management standards
*   Information systems security policies
*   Mobile and cloud computing security
*   Big data analytics for cybersecurity
*   Machine learning for cybersecurity
*   Transportation intelligence and security
*   Artificial intelligence for cybersecurity
*   LLM for cybersecurity

### Resilient Cyber Infrastructure Design and Protection
*   Data science and analytics in security informatics
*   Data representation and fusion for security informatics
*   Criminal/intelligence information extraction
*   Data sharing and information visualization for security informatics
*   Web-based intelligence monitoring and analysis
*   Spatial-temporal data analysis for crime analysis and security informatics
*   Criminal/intelligence machine learning and data mining
*   Cyber attack and/or bio-terrorism tracking, alerting, and analysis
*   Digital forensics and computational criminology
*   Financial and accounting fraud analysis
*   Consumer-generated content and security-related social media analytics
*   Security-related social network analysis (radicalization, fund-raising, recruitment, conducting operations)
*   Authorship analysis and identification
*   Security-related analytical methodologies and software tools

### Human Behavior and Factors in Security Applications
*   Behavior issues in information systems security
*   HCI and user interfaces of relevance to intelligence and security
*   Social impacts of crime, cybercrime, and/or terrorism
*   Board activism and influence
*   Measuring the effectiveness of security interventions
*   Citizen and employee education and training
*   Understanding user behavior such as compliance, susceptibility, and accountability
*   Security risks related to user behaviors/interactions with information systems
*   Human behavior modeling, representation, and prediction for security applications

### Organizational, National, and International Security Applications
*   Best practices in security protection
*   Information sharing policy and governance
*   Privacy, security, and civil liberties issues
*   Emergency response and management
*   Disaster prevention, detection, and management
*   Protection of transportation and communications infrastructure
*   Communication and decision support for research and rescue
*   Assisting citizens’ responses to cyber attacks, terrorism, and catastrophic events
*   Accounting and IT auditing and fraud detection
*   Corporate governance and monitoring
*   Election fraud and political use and abuse
*   Machine learning for the developing world
*   Artificial Intelligence methods and applications for humanitarian efforts

## Submission Guidelines

*   All papers must be original and not simultaneously submitted to another journal or conference.
*   Manuscripts should clearly articulate data, analytical procedures, and evaluation setup and results.
*   Making data, code, and processes publicly available is encouraged but not required.
*   The expected length of the manuscript is **6 pages**. A page charge applies for exceeding this limit, with a maximum of 2 additional pages allowed at extra cost per page.
*   Submissions must be in PDF format, following IEEE publication format. Use the template available at [IEEE – Manuscript Templates for Conference Proceedings](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   Papers should be submitted through the Papercept submission and review system: [https://its.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl](https://its.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl). Find ISI 2025 in the conference list.
*   To upload the final manuscript, at least one author must register for the conference.
*   Each accepted paper must be presented at the conference.
*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register as an IEEE member before the early registration deadline.
*   Accepted papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore, subject to meeting IEEE Xplore’s scope and quality requirements.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Open:** February 1, 2025
*   **Submission Deadline:** March 31, 2025, 11:59 PM (Pacific Time)
*   **Acceptance Notification:** May 1, 2025
*   **Final Paper Deadline:** May 31, 2025
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** May 31, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** July 12-13, 2025
