callForPapers:
# SETTA 2025: Call for Papers

The **11th International Symposium on Dependable Software Engineering: Theories, Tools and Applications (SETTA 2025)** will be held in **Oxford, United Kingdom**, at **St Catherine's College, University of Oxford**, from **1-3 December 2025**.

## Overview

SETTA aims to bring together international researchers to exchange research results and ideas on bridging the gap between formal methods and software engineering. The symposium encourages the participation of young researchers and students, aiming to become a flagship conference on formal software engineering. This year marks the first time the conference is being held outside its traditional home region in Asia.

## Topics and Scope

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Requirements specification and analysis
*   Formalisms for modeling, design and implementation
*   Model checking, theorem proving, and decision procedures
*   Scalable approaches to formal system analysis
*   Formal approaches to simulation, run-time verification, and testing
*   Integration of formal methods into software engineering practice
*   Contract-based engineering of components, systems, and systems of systems
*   Formal and engineering aspects of software evolution and maintenance
*   Parallel and multicore programming
*   Embedded, real-time, hybrid, probabilistic, and cyber-physical systems
*   Mixed-critical applications and systems
*   Formal aspects of service-oriented and cloud computing
*   Safety, reliability, robustness, and fault-tolerance
*   Dependability of smart software and systems
*   Empirical analysis techniques and integration with formal methods
*   Applications and industrial experience reports
*   Software tools to assist the construction or analysis of software systems
*   Trustworthy and explainable AI

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Link:** [https://setta2025.hotcrp.com/](https://setta2025.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Format:** Submissions should not exceed **16 pages** (excluding references) in the LNCS format. Please follow [Springer's author instructions](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines) or use the template on Overleaf.
*   **Review Process:** SETTA 2025 employs **double-blind reviewing**. Submissions should not contain authors' names or other identifying factors.
*   **Language:** Papers should be written in English.
*   **Originality:** Submitted papers must be unpublished and not submitted for publication elsewhere.
*   **Presentation:** All accepted papers will have to be presented at the conference by one of their authors. Extended versions of selected papers will be recommended to a special issue of a reputable journal (TBA).
*   **Publication:** Peer-reviewed research papers will be published in the [SETTA 2025 proceedings](https://link.springer.com/conference/setta) as a volume in Springer's LNCS series.

## Important Dates (AoE)

SETTA 2025 will accept submissions in two rounds. All deadlines are at 23:59 AOE (Anywhere on Earth).

**Round 1:**

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** April 30, 2025
*   **Notification:** June 16, 2025

**Round 2:**

*   **Paper Submission:** August 20, 2025
*   **Notification:** October 8, 2025

# SGAI International Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AI-2025): Call for Papers

The AI-2025 is the forty-fifth Annual International Conference of the British Computer Society's Specialist Group on Artificial Intelligence (SGAI). It will be held in the attractive surroundings of **Peterhouse College in Cambridge, England, from December 16-18, 2025**.

This is the leading series of UK-based international conferences on Artificial Intelligence and the longest running AI conference series in Europe.

## Submission Types

*   **Full papers:** up to 14 pages.
*   **Short (Poster) papers:** up to 6 pages. Short papers are a forum for disseminating new developments and latest work in progress, especially suited to PhD students.

Both full and short papers will be fully refereed to a high professional standard and included in the published proceedings.

## Key Dates

*   **Paper Submission:** DEADLINE EXTENDED TO **Monday July 7th, 2025** at 5 p.m. UK time
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** August 29th, 2025
*   **Camera Ready Paper:** September 12th, 2025

## Associated Events

*   **Monday 15th December 2025:** FAIRS'25 - the Forum for AI Research Students (Free to all research students).
*   **Tuesday December 16th 2025:** Workshops - four half-day workshops in two parallel streams.

## Submission Information

*   **Paper Submission Portal:** [http://www.conferenceexpert.org.uk/?conf=ai2025](http://www.conferenceexpert.org.uk/?conf=ai2025)

## Proceedings Publication

The proceedings of the AI-20xx conference series are published by Springer in Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence (a sub-series of the Lecture Notes in Computer Science series).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - SIGCOMM 2025

The ACM SIGCOMM 2025 conference invites submissions detailing significant research contributions or deployment experiences in communication networks and networked systems. The conference embraces a broad view of networking, encompassing various network types, technologies, aspects, life cycles, and approaches.

## Submission Tracks

SIGCOMM 2025 accepts submissions in two tracks:

*   **Research Track:** Focuses on significant advancements in networking through novel ideas or rigorous evaluations.
*   **Experience Track:** Presents key insights from networking technique deployments, particularly at scale.

Survey and tutorial papers are out of scope.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Anonymity:** All submissions must be anonymous, without author names. Experience submissions may reveal the deploying organization or system name. Authors must be listed in HotCRP before the submission deadline to manage reviewer conflicts.
*   **Track Selection:** Authors must explicitly choose the research or experience track during submission. Submissions will only be considered for the selected track.
*   **Format:** Submissions should be in two-column, 10-point format.
*   **Length:** Up to 12 pages for the main content, with additional pages allowed for references and optional appendices. Reviewers are not required to read appendices.
*   **Shepherding:** Accepted papers may be shepherded by a program committee member.
*   **Presentation:** An in-person attendee is expected to present each accepted paper.
*   **Publication Date:** The official publication date is the earlier of the conference start date or when proceedings are made available in the ACM Digital Library.
*   **Submission Site:** [https://sigcomm25.hotcrp.com](https://sigcomm25.hotcrp.com)
*   **Detailed Instructions:** [https://conferences.sigcomm.org/sigcomm/2025/submission/](https://conferences.sigcomm.org/sigcomm/2025/submission/)

## New This Year

*   **SIGCOMM Shorts:** A select number of submissions will be invited for a "lightning" talk and a shorter version (up to two pages excluding references and appendices) for the proceedings. Authors can indicate suitability for this category at submission.
*   **One-shot Revision:** A limited number of submissions may be invited for a single revision cycle, addressing specific feedback for potential acceptance.

## Ethics and Policy

*   All papers must include a statement about ethical issues raised by the work. Sensitive data or human subjects require clear discussion.
*   Adherence to ethical research practices, norms around privacy, data security, informed consent, beneficence, and risk mitigation is mandatory.
*   Authors should consult the [Menlo Report](https://www.caida.org/publications/papers/2012/menlo_report_actual_formatted/) and [ACM ethics policy](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship).
*   Authors must comply with ACM Publications Policies and obtain an ORCID ID.
*   Ethical soundness will be evaluated independently by the Program Committee, though IRB approval is an important factor.

## Artifact Evaluation

Authors of accepted papers are invited to submit supporting materials for the voluntary Artifact Evaluation process, which assesses how well artifacts support the paper's claims. Successful submissions receive badges.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract registration deadline:** Friday January 24, 2025
*   **Paper submission deadline:** Friday January 31, 2025
*   **Review results’ notification:** Tuesday April 29, 2025
*   **One-shot revision deadline:** Friday June 27, 2025
*   **Revision results’ notification:** Friday July 11, 2025
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** Friday July 25, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** September 8 – 11, 2025

## Contact

*   [Contact the PC Chairs](mailto:gmporter@cs.ucsd.edu;kandula@gmail.com?subject=[SIGCOMM2025]%20PC%20Chairs%20-%20Question%20about%20)

# SEKE 2025: Call for Papers

The Thirty Seventh International Conference on Software Engineering and Knowledge Engineering (SEKE25) will be held both as a **live conference** at the **Hotel Habita79 Pompeii, Italy, from September 29 to 30, 2025**, and as a **virtual conference** at the **KSIR Virtual Conference Center, USA, from October 1 to 6, 2025**.

The conference aims to bring together experts in software engineering and knowledge engineering to discuss relevant results in either or both domains, with a special emphasis on the transference of methods between these fields. Submission of papers and demos are both welcome.

## Special Anniversary Issue

The best-ranked papers from the conference will be selected for a **special 35th anniversary issue of the International Journal of Software Engineering and Knowledge Engineering (IJSEKE)** to be published in December 2025 for early dissemination.

## Co-located Conference

The **International DMS Conference on Visualization and Visual Languages DMSVIVA25** ([http://ksiresearch.org/seke/dmsviva25.html](http://ksiresearch.org/seke/dmsviva25.html)) will be held both as a live conference from September 30 to October 1, 2025, and as a virtual conference from October 1 to 2, 2025. Authors are welcome to contribute papers and attend both conferences.

## Topics

*   **Software Engineering Methodologies**
    *   Agent-based software engineering
    *   Artificial intelligence approaches to software engineering
    *   Component-based software engineering

## Special Sessions

*   **Special Session on Social Computing and Applications (SEKESCA):** [seke25paper/seke25cfpSCA.docx](seke25paper/seke25cfpSCA.docx)
*   **Special Session on Data Modeling and Mining (SEKEDMM):** [seke25paper/seke25cfpDMM.docx](seke25paper/seke25cfpDMM.docx)

## Information for Authors

*   **Language:** Papers must be written in English.
*   **Submission Format:** Electronic version (Postscript, pdf, or MS Word format).
*   **Submission Method:** Using the URL: [https://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=seke25](https://www.easychair.org/conferences/?conf=seke25) (submission website will be open after January 1, 2025). Please use Internet Explorer as the browser.
*   **Manuscript Requirements:** Must include a 200-word abstract and no more than **6 pages** of double-column formatted manuscript for Conference Proceedings (including figures and references, but excluding the copyright form).

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission due:** Midnight EST, May 15, 2025 (extended hard deadline)
*   **Notification of acceptance:** June 20, 2025
*   **Early registration deadline:** July 20, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copy:** July 20, 2025

## Contingency Plan

In case the pandemic has not subsided by conference time, the conference will be held only as a Virtual Conference.

## Publication

*   Papers will be published in the conference proceedings.
*   SEKE is listed by DBLP and SCOPUS.
*   Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to the **International Journal of SEKE** ([http://www.editorialmanager.com/ijseke/](http://www.editorialmanager.com/ijseke/)).

## Registration and Contact

*   **Conference Registration:** [http://ksiresearchorg.ipage.com/seke/seke25regis.html](http://ksiresearchorg.ipage.com/seke/seke25regis.html)
*   **Contact Email:** [office@ksiresearch.org](mailto:office@ksiresearch.org)
*   **SEKE25 Conference Secretariat:** KSI Research Inc., 156 Park Square, Pittsburgh, PA 15238 USA

# SETIT 2022: Call for Papers

The 2022 IEEE 9th International Conference on Sciences of Electronics, Technologies of Information and Telecommunications (SETIT) will be held from **May 28-30, 2022**, jointly in **Genoa-Italy and Sfax–Tunisia**. The conference will operate as a **Hybrid Event**, offering online presentation facilities for authors unable to attend in person.

## Conference Scope

SETIT 2022 covers all topics in the fields of information and communication technologies and related sciences. It aims to foster a cross-disciplinary dissemination by bringing together researchers and developers from both academia and industry to report on the latest scientific and theoretical advances. The conference encourages the submission of both theoretical advances and interesting applications, with a special emphasis on interdisciplinary works at the intersection of two or more covered areas.

## Sponsorship

IEEE SETIT 2022 is technically sponsored by IEEE and co-sponsored by the IEEE Tunisia section and the IEEE Tunisia Section Signal processing Chapter.

## Publication

The Proceedings of the 2022 IEEE SETIT will be published by **IEEE** and available through the **IEEE Xplore Digital Library**. Accepted papers will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS and others. Extended versions of selected papers will be published in journals indexed by ISI/SCI.

## Topics of Interest

*   **Information Processing**

callForPapers:
# SIGDIAL 2025: Call for Papers

The 26th Annual Meeting of the Special Interest Group on Discourse and Dialogue (SIGDIAL) will be held in **Avignon, France** on **August 25-27, 2025**.

SIGDIAL provides a regular forum for the presentation of cutting-edge research in discourse and dialogue to both academic and industry researchers.

## Topics of Interest

SIGDIAL 2025 invites submissions of original research on all aspects of discourse and dialogue. We encourage formal, corpus-based, experimental, or analytical work, as well as work on implementations and applications, including but not limited to the following areas:

*   **Discourse Processing:** Research on rhetorical and coherence relations, discourse parsing, discourse connectives, reference resolution, event representation, and causality in narrative. This also includes work on argument mining, text quality and style, cross-lingual discourse analysis, and discourse considerations in applications like machine translation, text summarization, essay grading, question answering, and information retrieval. We particularly encourage submissions that explore discourse issues in text generated by large language models.
*   **Pragmatic and Semantic Modeling:** Investigations into the pragmatics and semantics of conversations, going beyond the single sentence level. This includes research on rational speech acts, conversation acts, intentions, conversational implicature, and presuppositions.
*   **Dialogue Systems:** Contributions related to task-oriented and open-domain dialogue systems, whether spoken, multimodal, embedded, situated, or text-based. This includes research on system components, evaluation, and applications. Specific areas of interest include knowledge representation and extraction for dialogue, state representation and tracking, policy learning, social and emotional intelligence, dialogue in virtual reality and human-robot interaction, entrainment, alignment, and priming. We also welcome work on generation for dialogue, style, voice, personality, and safety and ethics in dialogue systems.
*   **LLM-Based Dialogue Technologies:** Research on the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) in dialogue systems, including but not limited to areas like prompt engineering, fine-tuning for dialogue, data synthesis and augmentation for dialogue tasks, safety and ethics of LLMs in conversation, and evaluation of LLM-generated dialogue.
*   **Corpora, Tools, and Methodology:** Submissions focused on corpus-based and experimental work on discourse and dialogue. We encourage submissions related to annotation tools and schemes, crowdsourcing, evaluation methodologies, and corpora development.
*   **Applications of Dialogue and Discourse Processing Technology:** We welcome submissions showcasing innovative applications of dialogue and discourse processing technology in various domains.

## Submission Types

*   **Long Papers:** 8 pages max, excluding references and appendices; +1 page in the final version. Long papers should describe substantial, original, completed, and unpublished work. Include concrete evaluation and analysis where appropriate.
*   **Short Papers:** 4 pages max, excluding references and appendices; +1 page in the final version. Short papers should present focused contributions, such as concise descriptions of novel ideas, negative results, or interesting application notes.
*   **Demo Descriptions:** 4 pages max, including references. Also a separate 1-page document for equipment requirements. Demo descriptions should clearly outline the system to be demonstrated, its functionality, and its relevance to the SIGDIAL community.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Content Essential for Review:** All content crucial for understanding your contribution or assessing its technical correctness should be included in the main paper, not solely in appendices. Reviewers are not obligated to review appendices.
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Authors are encouraged to submit supplementary materials like corpora, code, videos, or sound files to ensure reproducibility and/or enhance their submissions.
*   **Multiple Submissions Policy:** SIGDIAL 2025 cannot accept work that is currently under review, or has been published elsewhere, including other conferences or journals with overlapping review periods.
*   **Blind Review:** Long and short papers will undergo double-blind review, following [ACL policies](https://www.aclweb.org/adminwiki/index.php?title=ACL_Author_Guidelines). Demo descriptions will NOT be anonymous.
*   **Submission Format:** All submissions must adhere to the two-column ACL format (Overleaf template and downloadable LaTeX/Word templates available). Submit electronically in PDF format.

## Submission Deadlines

SIGDIAL accepts both regular submissions via the Softconf/START system and commitments of papers previously reviewed through ACL Rolling Review (ARR).

*   **Regular Submission (Softconf/START):** [https://www.softconf.com/p/sigdial2025/](https://www.softconf.com/p/sigdial2025/)
    *   Submission deadline: **April 21, 2025**
    *   Paper update deadline (PDF only): **April 28, 2025**
*   **ACL Rolling Review (ARR) Commitment:** before **June 6, 2025**
    *   To commit your paper: fill the new submission form at [https://www.softconf.com/p/sigdial2025/](https://www.softconf.com/p/sigdial2025/) giving the ID of the paper on ARR and a brief statement (1-2 sentences) on why your paper is relevant to the SIGDIAL.

## Mentoring Program

SIGDIAL 2025 offers a mentoring program to assist authors whose submissions show promise but require improvement in language or organization.

## Best Paper Awards

SIGDIAL 2025 will recognize outstanding contributions with Best Paper Awards. All accepted papers are eligible.

## Presentation Format

All accepted papers must be presented in person at the conference venue in either oral or poster sessions. Remote presentations will only be considered in exceptional circumstances (e.g., visa or health issues) with prior approval from the organizers.

## Student Travel Grant

To broaden participation, SIGdial plans to support a number of selected students for paper presentations at SIGdial. Details of application for the grant will be announced soon.

SIGGRAPH 2025 invites contributors to submit their latest work, showcasing excellence and innovation across many disciplines and formats. callForPapers:
# ITiCSE 2025: Call for Papers

This page provides detailed information about paper submissions to the ITiCSE 2025 conference. The abstract submission is mandatory for all papers and is due a week before the deadline for full papers.

## Paper Tracks

Papers presented at ITiCSE address aspects of computing education. When making a submission, you will be asked to place it in one of three tracks:

1.  **Computing education research:** Papers that define research questions, describe data gathering and methods, present results, and discuss contributions to knowledge about teaching and learning computing.
2.  **Experience reports and tools:** Papers describing computing education experiences, including developed tools, with sufficient detail for adoption. These papers should highlight novelty and include a rich description of what worked and what didn't.
3.  **Position papers and proposals:** Papers articulating original and well-argued positions on computing education, or proposals for work in its early stages. These must offer value to the community.

All papers should explicitly state motivating questions, relate to relevant literature, and include an analysis of the intervention's effectiveness.

## Submission Process

*   **Abstract Submission:** Up to 250 words, plain text. Submit by the paper abstract deadline.
*   **Anonymous Version for Review:** Submissions must be fully anonymous, removing all author names, affiliations, and identifying information. Self-citations should be worded to maintain anonymity. Links to additional material are not permitted in the review version.
*   **Formatting:** The paper is limited to a maximum of six pages plus one page for references. Figures and tables must be readable in greyscale at 100% magnification. Ensure files are no more than 10MB.
*   **Submission:** Convert the anonymous paper to Adobe PDF format, ensuring no identifying information is in the PDF properties. Upload the file through the online submission system.

## Important Dates

*   **Mandatory abstract submission:** Sunday, January 12, 2025
*   **Full paper submission:** Sunday, January 19, 2025
*   **Author notification:** Monday, March 3, 2025

*All submission deadlines are 23:59 AoE – Anywhere on Earth (UTC-12).* 

## Important Notes

*   ITiCSE 2025 will be a face-to-face conference. At least one author must register, attend in person, present, and discuss their paper for it to be included in the proceedings.

## Contact

Questions regarding paper submissions should be addressed to the program chairs: [iticse2025papers@easychair.org](mailto:iticse2025papers@easychair.org).

callForPapers:
# ACM SIGMETRICS 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 ACM SIGMETRICS conference will be held at **Stony Brook University, New York, USA, on June 9-13, 2025**.

## Overview

We solicit papers on the **design, modeling, measurement, and performance analysis of computer systems**. A good submission typically focuses on a well-motivated problem in computer systems, proposes a principled solution using modeling, measurement, and performance analysis, and empirically validates the solution through simulations and/or implementation. The research may target systems in a broad range of domains, including networking, high-performance computing, machine learning, IoT, cloud, edge, multimedia, mobile, and cyber-physical systems. The work may target diverse system metrics such as latency, throughput, reliability, cost, accuracy, fairness, energy, and carbon footprint.

The conference presents papers that have been accepted to appear in the Proceedings of the ACM on Measurement and Analysis of Computing Systems (POMACS). Accepted papers are considered for Best Paper Awards and the Kenneth C. Sevcik Outstanding Student Paper Award. A selection of accepted papers may be nominated for publication as Research Highlights in the Communications of the ACM (CACM).

## Topics

We solicit papers describing original and previously unpublished research. Specific topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

### Quantitative measurement, design and evaluation studies of:

*   Computer and communication networks, protocols and algorithms
*   Wireless, mobile, ad-hoc and sensor networks, IoT applications, and blockchain networks
*   Systems for machine learning, Machine learning for systems
*   Computer architectures, hardware accelerators, multi-core processors, memory systems and storage networks
*   High Performance Computing
*   Operating systems, file systems and databases
*   Virtualization, data centers, distributed and cloud computing, fog and edge computing
*   Mobile and personal computing systems
*   Energy-efficient and sustainable computing systems
*   Real-time and fault-tolerant systems
*   Security and privacy of computing and networked systems
*   Software systems and services, and enterprise applications
*   Social networks, metaverse, multimedia systems, Web services
*   Cyber-physical systems, including the smart grid
*   Quantum computing and communication

### Methodologies, formalisms, metrics, solution techniques and algorithms for:

*   Machine learning, AI, Big data, data mining, graph analysis, optimization
*   Analytical modeling techniques and model validation
*   Workload characterization and benchmarking
*   Performance, scalability, power and reliability analysis
*   Sustainability analysis and power management
*   System measurement, performance monitoring and forecasting
*   Anomaly detection, problem diagnosis, and troubleshooting
*   Capacity planning, resource allocation, run-time management and scheduling
*   Experimental design, statistical analysis, simulation
*   Game theory, network economics, and platform design

## Important Dates

There are three submission opportunities:

### Summer Submission

*   Registration of abstract: **July 31, 2024**
*   Paper submission: **August 7, 2024**
*   Author notification: **September 24, 2024**

### Fall Submission

*   Registration of abstract: **October 2, 2024**
*   Paper submission: **October 9, 2024**
*   Author notification: **December 10, 2024**

### Winter Submission

*   Registration of abstract: **January 15, 2025**
*   Paper submission: **January 22, 2025**

*   Author notification: **March 18, 2025**

*Note: Deadlines are hard and at 23:59 AoE (Anywhere on Earth).* 

## Submission Instructions

*   Papers must be submitted electronically in printable pdf form via the submission site posted on this page. ([https://sigmetrics25summer.hotcrp.com](https://sigmetrics25summer.hotcrp.com), [https://sigmetrics25fall.hotcrp.com](https://sigmetrics25fall.hotcrp.com), [https://sigmetrics25winter.hotcrp.com](https://sigmetrics25winter.hotcrp.com))
*   **Soft Tracking:** Authors must select a track from among the four listed on the submission website: Learning, Measurement & Applied Modeling, Systems, Theory.
*   The submission may have up to **20 pages** for technical content (including all tables and figures), plus unlimited pages for references. No changes to margins, spacing, or font sizes are allowed from those specified by the style files. Papers violating the formatting guidelines will be returned without review.
*   **Reviewing is double anonymous.** Authors should not identify themselves in the paper either explicitly or by implication.
*   Authors must truthfully declare all conflicts with program committee members on the submission page.
*   Authors are encouraged to conform to the inclusivity guidelines provided in the Diversity and Inclusiveness section.

## Reviewing Process

There are three possible outcomes from the first round of submission:

*   **Accept with Shepherding:** Suggestions from reviewers will be incorporated into the final version.
*   **Reject:** If rejected, the paper cannot be resubmitted to any SIGMETRICS deadline within 12 months.
*   **Resubmit:** For papers close to acceptance but requiring major revisions, authors may resubmit a revision during one of the next three submission deadlines.

## Policies

*   **Anonymity guidelines:** Remove authors' names and affiliations, acknowledgments of identifying names and funding sources. Use care in file naming. Refer to your past work in the third person. Cite related anonymous work as "[Anonymous 2025] Under submission. Details omitted for double anonymous reviewing." Send deanonymized references to the PC chairs separately.
*   **Pre-submission versions:** Publication of a pre-submission version on a personal website or arXiv is allowed, but authors should avoid widely broadcasting it.
*   **Author list:** The list of authors should not change between submission and the final camera-ready copy.
*   **Title and Abstract:** Submissions must have a substantive title and abstract.
*   **Original Research:** Submissions must present original research. Preliminary work as an extended abstract at a workshop is acceptable if the submission includes substantial new material, with anonymous citation to the prior work.
*   **Simultaneous Submissions:** The same paper cannot be concurrently submitted to more than one conference/journal.
*   **Shepherding Process:** All accepted papers undergo a shepherding process. The camera-ready paper must be approved by the shepherd.
*   **Opt-Out Publication:** Authors can opt out of publication in ACM POMACS. An extended abstract must be included in Performance Evaluation Review with a link to the full paper. Accepted papers opting out may be considered for expedited review by specific journals.
*   **Ethical Considerations:** Papers describing experiments with users or user data must follow ethical research principles (beneficence, minimal risk, voluntary consent, respect for privacy). Authors must attest that their work complies with all applicable ethical standards.

## Contact

Contact the SIGMETRICS 2025 PC chairs at [sigmetrics25tpcchairs@sigmetrics.org](mailto:sigmetrics25tpcchairs@sigmetrics.org) for questions or concerns.

callForPapers:
# SIGGRAPH Asia 2025: Call for Submissions

SIGGRAPH Asia 2025, the premier event for computer graphics and interactive techniques in Asia, will take place from **15 – 18 December 2025** at the **Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre (HKCEC)**.

We invite professionals, researchers, artists, and innovators from around the world to submit their latest work and creative innovations. SIGGRAPH Asia 2025 offers a platform to showcase groundbreaking advancements across various fields.

## Programs and Submission Deadlines

Note: All deadlines are in **23:59 AoE (Anywhere on Earth)**, unless otherwise stated.

*   **Art Gallery:** 30 June 2025
*   **Emerging Technologies:** 30 June 2025
*   **XR:** 30 June 2025
*   **Courses:** 2 July 2025
*   **Computer Animation Festival:** 13 July 2025
*   **Student Volunteers – Team Leaders:** 13 July 2025
*   **Student Volunteers – Members:** 8 August 2025
*   **Posters:** 20 August 2025
*   **Technical Communications:** 20 August 2025
*   **Real-Time Live!:** 20 August 2025
*   **Educator’s Forum:** 25 August 2025
*   **Birds of a Feather:** 1 September 2025
*   **Technical Papers:** 
    *   Stage 1, Submission Form Deadline: **16 May 2025 (Closed)**
    *   Stage 2, Paper Deadline: **23 May 2025 (Closed)**
    *   Stage 2, Upload Deadline: **24 May 2025 (Closed)**
*   **Art Papers:** 23 June 2025 (Closed)

## Technical Papers Submission Details

Technical Papers is the premier venue for scholarly work in computer graphics and interactive techniques, featuring breakthroughs shaping the future of the field. SIGGRAPH Asia 2025 Technical Papers program covers areas including animation, simulation, imaging, geometry, modeling, rendering, human-computer interaction, VR/AR/MR, haptics, fabrication, robotics, visualization, audio, optics, generative AI, and machine learning for graphics.

There are two integrated paper tracks: **Journal** (ACM Transactions on Graphics) and **Conference**.

*   **Journal Papers:** Expected to satisfy ACM TOG criteria of excellence, presenting novel, well-validated, and comprehensive research. Published in ACM Transactions on Graphics (TOG).
*   **Conference Papers:** Expected to present novel research, but with potentially less comprehensive evidence than Journal Papers. Papers accepted to this track will be published in the SIGGRAPH Asia 2025 Conference Proceedings.

Authors can submit for **Journal track only** or as a **"dual-track"** submission (considered for both tracks).

### Submission Format & Guidelines

*   Submissions should be prepared in **ACM double-column format**, using the provided “acmtog” LaTeX Article Template Style.
*   Papers must be anonymized to preserve the double-blind review process.
*   All submissions must be in **Adobe PDF format**.
*   Supplementary materials (videos, code, data) are encouraged but must be anonymized.
*   Refer to **[Author Manuscript Guidelines](https://asia.siggraph.org/2025/submissions/art-papers/author-manuscript-guidelines/)** for detailed formatting requirements.

## Keynote & Featured Speakers

*   **Keynote Speakers:** Jun Murai, Joe Letteri
*   **Featured Speakers:** Masaki Takahashi, Koki Nagano, Stuart Adcock, Allison Orr, Hayden Jones, Alex Fry, Keith Miller, Aidan Martin, Daniel Macarin, Michael Chrobak, Philippe Lierena.

## Online Submission System

All submissions must be made through the online portal: **[https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/siggraphasia/](https://ssl.linklings.net/conferences/siggraphasia/)**

## Contact Us

For program-related inquiries, please contact: **[Carrie De Souza](https://asia.siggraph.org/2025/about-the-event/contact-us/?topic_of_interest=Conference+Management)**, SIGGRAPH Asia Conference Management.

For general inquiries and further information, please visit the **[Contact Us](https://asia.siggraph.org/2025/about-the-event/contact-us/)** page.

The Graduate School will take place from June 30 to July 1, 2025, followed by the main conference from July 2 to July 4, 2025. SGP covers mathematics, computer science, and engineering applications for 3D models, acquisition, analysis, manipulation, and simulation, and offers a Graduate School taught by leading experts.
callForPapers:
# Symposium on Geometry Processing (SGP) 2025: Call for Papers

SGP is the premier venue for disseminating new research ideas and cutting-edge results in geometry processing. This research area applies concepts from mathematics, computer science, and engineering to offer new insights and design efficient algorithms for acquisition, modeling, analysis, manipulation, simulation, and other types of processing of 3D models and shape collections.

## Conference Dates and Venue

*   **Graduate School:** June 30 - July 1, 2025
*   **Conference:** July 2 - 4, 2025
*   **Location:** Bizkaia Aretoa, Bilbao, Spain

## Submission Rounds and Important Dates

SGP 2025 utilizes a **double deadline format** to accommodate visa application timelines.

### First (Visa-Friendly) Round of Submissions

*   **First abstract submission:** February 4, 2025
*   **First paper deadline:** February 7, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** March 15, 2025
*   **Revision version due:** March 29, 2025
*   **Camera ready due:** April 5, 2025

### Second (Traditional) Round of Submissions

*   **Second abstract submission:** April 8, 2025
*   **Second paper deadline:** April 11, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** May 16, 2025
*   **Revision version due:** May 30, 2025
*   **Camera ready due:** June 6, 2025

**Note:** All deadlines are at 23:59 UTC/GMT.

## Topics of Interest

We invite submissions related to, but not limited to, the following topics:

*   Neural shape representations
*   Point cloud acquisition and processing
*   Processing of massive geometric datasets
*   Shape analysis and synthesis
*   Simulation and animation
*   Smoothing, filtering, and denoising
*   Surface and volume parameterization and deformation
*   Acquisition and reconstruction
*   Analysis and fabrication for 3D printing
*   Architectural geometry
*   Computational geometry
*   Differentiable rendering
*   Discrete differential geometry
*   Geometry and topology data structures and representations
*   Exploration of shape collections
*   Geometry compression
*   Geometric deep learning
*   Geometric representations for machine learning
*   Geometry processing applications
*   Interactive techniques
*   Meshing and remeshing
*   Multiresolution modeling
*   Multimodal shape processing

## Submission Types

*   **Technical Papers:** Papers should be up to 10 pages (including all images, but excluding references), though length should be justified by content. Supplementary documents are encouraged. Submitted in PDF format.
*   **Poster Presentations:** 1-page abstract summarizing the poster content. Posters are presented at the conference but not published otherwise.
*   **Dataset Papers:** Encouraged for submission to the technical papers program, focusing on datasets with larger or more challenging examples.

## Typesetting and Formatting

*   Please format your article using the template for SGP available on the SRMv2 website: [https://srmv2.eg.org](https://srmv2.eg.org).
*   Papers should be submitted in electronic **PDF format**.

## Anonymization

*   SGP uses a **dual-anonymous reviewing process**.
*   All submitted papers must be anonymized. Remove all personal data (such as authors, affiliations, etc.).
*   References to your own work should be made in the third person.

## Abstract Submission

*   While not mandatory, submitting an abstract by the deadline is strongly encouraged to help assign relevant reviewers.

## Reviewing Process

*   Submitted papers undergo a two-stage review process involving dual-anonymous assessment.
*   Articles are conditionally accepted after the first round, with final acceptance based on the revised version.

## Preprints and Anonymity Policy

SGP follows a policy similar to SIGGRAPH regarding preprints:

*   Authors must not discuss the research with the media.
*   Authors may archive submissions (e.g., on arXiv) without mentioning SGP.
*   No social media posts should link specific submissions to SGP.
*   Authors may present their work for job/funding applications without mentioning SGP.

## Proceedings

The SGP proceedings will appear as a regular electronic issue of the **Computer Graphics Forum**.

## Awards and Recognitions

*   Best Paper Awards
*   Software Award
*   Data Set Award
*   Reproducibility Stamp

## Call for Posters

Proposals for poster presentations highlighting innovative research, preliminary findings, novel ideas, ongoing projects, refined methods, or applications in geometry processing are invited.

*   **Topics:** Acquisition and reconstruction, 3D printing analysis and fabrication, Architectural geometry, Computational geometry, Differentiable rendering, Discrete differential geometry, Shape collections exploration, Data structures and representations for geometry and topology, Geometry compression, Geometric deep learning, Geometric representations for machine learning, Interactive techniques, Meshing and remeshing, Multiresolution modeling, Multimodal shape processing, Neural shape representations, Point cloud processing, Processing of large geometric datasets, Shape analysis, synthesis and animation, Surface and volume parameterization and deformation.
*   **Submission:** 1-page abstract via email to [chairs-sgp2025@eg.org](mailto:chairs-sgp2025@eg.org).
*   **Process:** The submission process is **not anonymous**.
*   **Timeline:**
    *   Poster Abstract Deadline: **June 1, 2025**
    *   Notification of Acceptance: **June 5, 2025**
    *   Camera-ready Posters: **June 15, 2025** (sent to sgp2025@bcamath.org, posters will be printed by organizers).

## Registration

Registration for the Conference and Graduate School is available via: [https://sgp2025.my.canva.site/registration-page](https://sgp2025.my.canva.site/registration-page)

## Sponsors

Information on sponsors can be found on the conference website.

summary: The ACM SIGMOD/PODS International Conference on Management of Data (SIGMOD/PODS) will be held in Berlin, Germany, from June 22-27, 2025. It is a leading international forum for data management research, bringing together researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and results. The conference features a technical program with research and industrial talks, tutorials, demos, workshops, a poster session, an industrial exhibition, and a careers-in-industry panel. SIGMOD 2025 emphasizes reproducibility, inclusion, and diversity, with a double-anonymous reviewing process for research papers.
callForPapers:
# SIGMOD 2025 Call for Research Papers

The ACM SIGMOD/PODS International Conference on Management of Data will be held in **Berlin, Germany, from June 22-27, 2025**. This conference is a premier international forum for exploring cutting-edge ideas and results in data management research, facilitating the exchange of techniques, tools, and experiences among researchers, practitioners, developers, and users.

## Major Changes from Prior Years

*   **1 Year Wait:** Rejected papers cannot be submitted to SIGMOD until a full year has passed.
*   **ORCIDs:** ORCIDs are required for all authors at the time of abstract submission.
*   **Abstract, COIs and Paper Submission Dates:** Abstracts and COIs are submitted a week ahead of the main paper submission.
*   **No Special Tracks:** Previous data-intensive and data science applications tracks are now folded into the main research track.
*   **No Author Feedback Phase:** There will be no author feedback phase this year.
*   **Shepherding:** Accepted papers may have revision requirements; a shepherd will assist authors.
*   **Posters and Random Selection for Presentation:** Every accepted paper will have a poster presentation slot. Speaking slots will be allocated via random sampling among accepted papers.

## Topics

We invite submissions in the following areas:

### Data Management Systems

*   Benchmarking, monitoring, testing, and tuning database systems
*   Cloud, distributed, decentralized and parallel data management
*   Database systems on emerging hardware
*   Embedded databases, IoT and Sensor networks
*   Storage, indexing, and physical database design
*   Query processing and optimization
*   Transaction processing
*   Data warehousing, OLAP, Analytics

### Models and Languages

*   Data models and semantics
*   Declarative programming languages and optimization
*   Spatial and temporal data management
*   Graphs, social networks, web data, and semantic web
*   Multimedia and information retrieval
*   Uncertain, probabilistic, and approximate databases
*   Streams and complex event processing

### Human-Centric Data Management

*   Data exploration, visualization, query languages, and user interfaces
*   Crowdsourced and collaborative data management
*   User-centric and human-in-the-loop data management
*   Natural language processing for databases

### Data Governance

*   Data provenance and workflows
*   Data integration, information extraction, and schema matching
*   Data quality, data cleaning
*   Data security, privacy, and access control
*   Responsible data management and data fairness
*   Metadata Management

### Modern AI & Data Management

*   Structured queries over unstructured data: images, video, natural language, etc.
*   Natural language queries
*   Machine learning methods for database engine internals
*   Machine learning methods for database tuning
*   Data management and metadata for machine learning pipelines
*   Knowledge base management
*   Data mining
*   Prescriptive Analytics

### Data-Driven Applications

*   Data-intensive (DI) applications
*   Data Science (DS) pipelines
    *   Note that submissions in this topic should focus on data life cycle and pipelines in DS applications OR novel data management in DI fields outside our core (e.g., graphics, networking, astronomy).
    *   Detail deployed solutions for DS or DI applications.
    *   Share real-world experiences.
    *   Provide access to systems, datasets, query logs, benchmarks.
    *   Describe the impact of the contribution on future research.

## Dates

All deadlines are 11:59 PM AoE.

### Round 1

*   **Abstract Submission and Declaration of COIs:** Weds, Jan 10, 2024
*   **Paper Submission:** Weds, Jan 17, 2024
*   **Notification of Accept/Review/Reject:** Thurs, Feb 29, 2024
*   **Submission of Revision Plan:** Thurs, Mar 7, 2024
*   **Revision Feedback:** Thurs, Mar 21, 2024
*   **Final Notification:** Thurs, May 2, 2024

### Round 2

*   **Abstract Submission and Declaration of COIs:** Weds, Apr 10, 2024
*   **Paper Submission:** Weds, Apr 17, 2024
*   **Notification of Accept/Review/Reject:** Thurs, May 30, 2024
*   **Submission of Revision Plan:** Thurs, Jun 6, 2024
*   **Revision Feedback:** Thurs, Jun 20, 2024
*   **Final Notification:** Thurs, Aug 1, 2024

### Round 3

*   **Abstract Submission and Declaration of COIs:** Weds, Jul 10, 2024
*   **Paper Submission:** Weds, Jul 17, 2024
*   **Notification of Accept/Review/Reject:** Thurs, Aug 29, 2024
*   **Submission of Revision Plan:** Thurs, Sep 5, 2024
*   **Revision Feedback:** Thurs, Sep 19, 2024
*   **Final Notification:** Thurs, Oct 31, 2024

### Round 4

*   **Abstract Submission and Declaration of COIs:** Thurs, Oct 10, 2024
*   **Paper Submission:** Thurs, Oct 17, 2024
*   **Notification of Accept/Review/Reject:** Thurs, Nov 28, 2024
*   **Submission of Revision Plan:** Thurs, Dec 5, 2024
*   **Revision Feedback:** Thurs, Dec 19, 2024
*   **Final Notification:** Thurs, Jan 30, 2025

### Industry Paper Submission

*   **Paper Submission:** Mon, Dec 9, 2024
*   **Notification of Accept/Reject:** Mon, Feb 24, 2025

### PODS Deadlines

#### First Submission Cycle

*   **Abstract deadline:** May 31, 2024
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** June 7, 2024
*   **Rebuttal:** July 29 - August 1, 2024
*   **Initial notification:** August 12, 2024
*   **Revision submission:** August 26, 2024
*   **Final notification:** September 2, 2024

#### Second Submission Cycle

*   **Abstract deadline:** December 2, 2024
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** December 9, 2024
*   **Rebuttal:** February 3-7, 2025
*   **Initial notification:** February 14, 2025
*   **Revision submission:** February 28, 2025
*   **Final notification:** March 7, 2025

## Review Process

*   Each submission will receive three reviews.
*   There will be no author feedback phase this year.
*   All papers will receive an initial Accept or Reject decision upon completion of reviews.
*   Accepted papers may be assigned a shepherd to guide authors through revisions.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Link:** [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/SIGMOD2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/SIGMOD2025)
*   **Submission Paper length:** 12 pages excluding references.
*   **Appendix:** No Appendix.
*   **Camera Ready Paper length:** 13 pages excluding references, no appendix.
*   **File type and size:** PDF (<= 10 MB).
*   **Paper size:** Letter (8.5” x 11”).
*   **Format:** 2-column ACM Proceedings format (Latex: sample-sigconf.tex, Word: Interim layout.docx, Overleaf: ACM’s official 2-column template).
*   **Anonymity:** Double-anonymity is required. Authors' names, affiliations, funding sources, acknowledgements, and file names must not reveal author identity.

### Declaring Conflicts of Interest (COI)

*   Each author must enter their ORCID, own individual domain, and PC conflicts on CMT.
*   Conflicts must be declared prior to paper submission.
*   It is the responsibility of all authors to identify all and only their potential conflict-of-interest PC members.

### Duplicate Submissions and Novelty Requirement

*   Papers submitted to SIGMOD 2025 cannot be under review for any other forum simultaneously.
*   Submissions must present substantial novel research not described in any prior publication.
*   Violation of this policy will result in immediate rejection.

### Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects

Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies, including the policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects.

### Inclusion and Diversity in Writing

Authors are encouraged to use inclusive language and avoid exclusionary examples. Reviewers will monitor and demand changes if issues arise.

### Policy on Authorship Requirements

*   Generative AI tools cannot be listed as authors. Their use must be fully disclosed in the paper.

## Anonymity Requirements

*   Authors' names and affiliations must not appear on the title page or elsewhere in the submission.
*   Funding sources must not be acknowledged.
*   Research group members, or other colleagues or collaborators, must not be acknowledged.
*   The paper’s file name must not identify the authors.
*   Avoid self-references that reveal identity. Reference past work in the third person.
*   Do not publicize or upload versions of submitted manuscripts to pre-publication servers during the reviewing period.

## Artifacts and Reproducibility

SIGMOD strives to encourage the sharing of research artifacts (data, results, code, and scripts).
*   While not mandatory for acceptance, providing materials can help reviewers evaluate work more thoroughly.
*   Papers with successfully reproduced artifacts will be recognized in the ACM Digital Library.
*   Links to materials should preserve anonymity (e.g., anonymous GitHub repository).
*   Materials should be live within one week of submission.

# Call for Proposals

Submissions for the ACM SIGUCCS Annual Conference 2025 are now closed.

## Abstract Information

Abstracts, which should be a 250-to-500-word summary of your idea, were to be submitted through the online portal: [https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=siguccs2025](https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=siguccs2025).

For any questions regarding the submission process, please email [siguccs2025@docs.siguccs.org](mailto:siguccs2025@docs.siguccs.org).

## Session Formats

Submissions were sought for a variety of session formats:

*   **SIGUCCS Academy:** Structured and interactive experiences tailored for learning useful skills. Presenters should submit sessions focusing on topics such as:
    *   Customer Service
    *   Student Employee Management
    *   Project Management
*   **Presentation:** Standard presentation format with a 60-minute duration, including time for Q&A.
*   **Panel:** Presenters from multiple institutions offer insights and lead discussions on a specific topic of interest. Panels are 60 minutes, including Q&A.
*   **Poster:** Authors present their topics in a poster format and engage in one-on-one discussions during an open forum.
*   **Lightning Talks:** A group presentation format where each member of a small group (approximately 5) has 7 minutes for a concise presentation on a specific topic. This is followed by 2 minutes of Q&A per presenter and an additional 15 minutes for questions directed to any presenter in the group.

Authors interested in submitting a research article or short paper should refer to the ACM Open Access Publishing information.

callForPapers:
# ACM SIGSPATIAL 2025: Call for Papers

The **33rd ACM SIGSPATIAL International Conference on Advances in Geographic Information Systems (ACM SIGSPATIAL 2025)** will be held from **Monday November 3 to Thursday November 6, 2025**, in **Minneapolis, MN, USA**.

The conference provides a forum for original research contributions covering all conceptual, design, and implementation aspects of geospatial data. It is the premier annual event of the ACM Special Interest Group on Spatial Information (ACM SIGSPATIAL).

## New Initiatives and Tracks

ACM SIGSPATIAL 2025 introduces several new initiatives:

1.  **Research Track:** Now includes **Experiment, benchmark, and experience papers**. ([CFP for Research Track](https://sigspatial2025.sigspatial.org/research-submission/))
2.  **Application Track:** ([CFP for Applications track](https://sigspatial2025.sigspatial.org/application-submission/))
3.  **Industrial Track:** ([CFP for Industrial track](https://sigspatial2025.sigspatial.org/industry-submission/))
4.  **Short Papers Track:** ([CFP for Short Papers Track](https://sigspatial2025.sigspatial.org/short-paper-submission/))
5.  **Tutorials:** ([Call for Tutorials](https://sigspatial2025.sigspatial.org/tutorials-submission/))
6.  **PhD and Graduate Studies Workshop with SRC:** ([CFP for PhD and Graduate Studies Workshop and SRC](https://sigspatial2025.sigspatial.org/src-submission/))
7.  **ACM TSAS Paper Presentations:** Papers accepted in ACM Transactions on Spatial Algorithms and Systems (TSAS) will be invited for presentation.

## Important Dates

### Research Papers (Regular & Experiment, Benchmark & Experience)

*   **Abstract Submission:** Friday, May 30th, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** Friday, June 06th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** Thursday, July 31st, 2025
*   **Camera-ready:** Thursday, August 21st, 2025

### Vision Papers

*   **Abstract Submission:** June 6th, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** June 13th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** July 31st, 2025

### Application Papers

*   **Abstract Submission:** June 6th, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** June 13th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** July 31st, 2025

### Industrial Papers

*   **Abstract Submission:** June 6th, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** June 13th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** July 31st, 2025

### Short Papers

*   **Abstract Submission:** June 6th, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** June 13th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** July 31st, 2025

### Demos

*   **Paper Submission:** June 15th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** July 31st, 2025

### Tutorials

*   **Proposal Submission:** July 3rd, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** July 25th, 2025

### PhD/Grad Workshop & SRC

*   **Paper Submission:** July 25th, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** August 15th, 2025

### GIS Cup

*   **Mid Submission:** July 30, 2025
*   **Mid Decision:** August 20, 2025
*   **Submission:** September 10, 2025
*   **Decision:** October, 2025

### Workshop Proposals (Past Due)

*   **Proposal Submission:** May 2nd, 2025
*   **Decision Notification:** June 2nd, 2025

## Topics of Interest

Suggested topics include, but are not limited to:

*   **Spatial AI:** Generative AI for spatial reasoning and simulation, Spatial foundation models, Causal reasoning in space and time, Spatial machine learning and explainability, Privacy and ethics, Spatial reasoning in robotics.
*   **Big spatial data:** Spatial and spatio-temporal analysis, Query processing and optimization, Spatial data mining, pattern analysis and knowledge discovery, Spatio-temporal data management, Spatial decision support, Spatial data quality and uncertainty, Geo-entity linkage, geo-enrichment, Distributed and parallel algorithms, Geospatial architectures and middleware, GPU and novel hardware solutions.
*   **Pervasive computing and internet of spatial things:** Localization and tracking indoors/outdoors, Contact tracing, Location-based services, Spatio-temporal sensor networks, Traffic telematics, Mobile systems and vehicular ad hoc networks.
*   **Spatial data acquisition, integration, processing:** Standardization and interoperability, Earth observation and satellite data processing, Computational geometry and computer graphics, Image and video understanding, Spatial, geo-social and trajectory Simulation, Spatio-temporal stream processing.
*   **Spatial search:** Geographic information retrieval, Human computer interaction and visualization, Similarity searching, Spatial data structures and algorithms, Spatial modeling and reasoning, Spatio-textual searching.
*   **Spatial intelligence at work:** Intelligent transportation and sustainable mobility, Autonomous vehicles, Spatial knowledge graphs, Epidemiology and health, Cyber and physical security, Smart cities and spaces, Geospatial computer vision applications, Location business intelligence, Personalized geospatial recommendation systems.

## Submission Guidelines

### General Information

*   **Regular Research Papers & Experiment, Benchmark & Experience Papers:** Up to 10 pages excluding references. Up to 2 additional pages after references can be used for appendices. Submissions exceeding page limits will be desk-rejected.
*   **Short Papers:** 4 pages (including references).
*   **Paper Titles:** For Experiment, Benchmark & Experience papers, include the suffix `[Experiment]` in the title (e.g., 'Evaluating spatial navigation systems on Mars [Experiment]'). This suffix will be removed for the camera-ready version.
*   **Authors:** ACM SIGSPATIAL 2025 is a **single-blind** conference. Author names and affiliations should be listed in the submitted version. The author list is final after the submission deadline.
*   **AI Disclosure:** Authors are responsible for all submitted manuscripts and must disclose the use of AI software tools in their paper.
*   **Conflict of Interest (COI):** Authors must review and follow the ACM Policy on Conflict of Interest for ACM Publications and mark any potential conflicts on the submission website. Doubts should be clarified with the PC Chairs.
*   **Inappropriate Content:** ACM Publications cannot be used to propagate political or religious views or denigrate individuals or groups. See [ACM Policy on inappropriate content](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/inappropriate-content-policy).

### Formatting and Camera-Ready

*   **Format:** Manuscripts must be submitted in PDF format using the [ACM camera-ready templates](http://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template), specifically the Conference Proceedings Primary Article template (two-column format).
*   **Submission Platform:** All papers should be submitted through EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sigspatial2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sigspatial2025)
*   **Camera-Ready:** Detailed instructions for preparing the camera-ready copy will be provided to accepted authors via email.

## Registration and Presentation Policy

Each accepted paper must have a **separate paid author registration**. At least one author must attend the conference **in person** to present the accepted submission. Failure to do so will result in the paper not appearing in the conference proceedings or the ACM Digital Library.

## Contact Information

**PC Chairs:**

*   Yao-Yi Chiang (University of Minnesota, USA)
*   Maria Luisa Damiani (University of Milan, Italy)
*   Moustafa Youssef (The American University in Cairo, Egypt)

callForPapers:
# SISAP 2025: Call for Research Contributions

The 18th International Conference on Similarity Search and Applications (SISAP) is an annual forum for researchers and application developers in the area of similarity data management. It aims at addressing the technological problems shared by numerous application domains, such as data mining, information retrieval, multimedia retrieval, computer vision, pattern recognition, computational biology, geography, biometrics, machine learning, and many others that rely on similarity search as a necessary supporting service.

SISAP 2025 will be held in **Reykjavik, Iceland**, from **October 1-3, 2025**.

## Submission Types

*   **Regular Papers:** Full papers (from **9 to 14 pages**) should describe complete technical work. Short papers (up to **8 pages**) can describe innovative approaches or preliminary results. Vision papers and other position papers should be submitted as short research papers.
*   **Special Session Papers:** These papers supplement the regular research papers and will be included in the proceedings.
*   **Demonstration Papers:** Submissions (up to **8 pages**, including references) must include a mandatory 1-page PDF appendix describing how the demo will be conducted on-site.
*   **Doctoral Symposium Papers:** For PhD students to present their research ideas and receive feedback.

## Special Sessions

*   **IRMC:** Interactive Retrieval for Multimedia Collections
*   **BRIDGES:** Bridging Past and Present: Similarity Search for Digital Cultural Heritage and GLAM Content

## Topics of Interest

Please refer to the [topics of interest page](href="/2025/topics-of-interest.html") for a detailed list.

## Important Dates

**For Regular and Special Session Papers:**

*   Abstract deadline: **June 1, 2025 (AoE)**
*   Paper submission deadline: **June 1, 2025 (AoE)**
*   Acceptance notification: **July 14, 2025 (AoE)**
*   Camera-ready due: **July 31, 2025 (AoE)**

**For Demonstration and Doctoral Symposium Papers:**

*   Paper submission deadline: **June 16, 2025 (AoE)**
*   Acceptance notification: **July 14, 2025 (AoE)**
*   Camera-ready due: **July 31, 2025 (AoE)**

**For Special Session Proposals:**

*   Special Session Proposal deadline: **February 24, 2025 (AoE)**
*   Notification: **February 26, 2025 (AoE)**

> All deadlines are given in Anywhere on Earth time.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Papers must be submitted in PDF format through [EasyChair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sisap2025).
*   Please refer to the [submission guidelines](href="/2025/guidelines.html") for detailed formatting instructions.

## Review Process

*   Regular and special session research papers will be peer-reviewed in a **double-blind review process**.
*   Demonstrations will be evaluated in a **single-blind review process**.
*   Doctoral symposium papers will be peer-reviewed in a **single-blind review process**.

## Publication

The conference proceedings will be published by Springer as a volume in the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series. A small selection of the best papers presented at the conference will be recommended for inclusion in a special issue of Elsevier Information Systems.

## Awards

The **Best Paper Award** will be recognized with a certificate and a monetary prize, thanks to Springer's sponsorship.

## Contact Information

For more details, please visit the [main website](/) or the [call for papers page](href="/2025/callforpapers.html").

callForPapers:
# ACM SIGCITE 2025: Call for Submissions

The 26th ACM Annual Conference on Cybersecurity and Information Technology Education (ACM SIGCITE 2025) will be held from **November 6th-8th, 2025**, at **Cosumnes River College in Sacramento, California, U.S.A.** Organized by the **ACM Special Interest Group for Cybersecurity and Information Technology (ACM SIGCITE)**, this year’s conference theme is **“Embracing Our exCITing Identity.”**

The conference aims to foster insightful discussions and collaborations to address the challenges facing Cybersecurity and Information Technology Education, inviting submissions and attendees from around the world.

## Submission Types

*   Papers
*   Student Papers
*   Lightning Talks
*   Panels
*   Tutorials
*   Posters

## Topics of Interest

Submissions are invited on a broad range of modern topics related to Cybersecurity and Information Technology Education, including but not limited to:

*   Artificial Intelligence
*   Blockchain
*   IT infrastructure design and management
*   Virtual and Augmented Reality
*   Cloud Computing
*   Big Data
*   Cybersecurity
*   User experience design
*   The current state of the IT industry
*   The Internet of Things
*   Distance and hybrid learning
*   Research and instruction techniques
*   Curriculum design
*   Learning assessment

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Deadline:** Sunday, **August 03rd, 2025**.
*   **Submission Platform:** All submissions must be uploaded via [EasyChair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=acmsigcite2025).
*   **Formatting:** Submissions must use and follow the [ACM Template](https://authors.acm.org/proceedings/production-information/taps-production-workflow) (available in DOCX, LaTeX, and Overleaf).
*   **Anonymization:** Submissions must be anonymized (authors' names removed), except for Panel submissions.
*   **Page Limits:** Submissions exceeding the specified page limits will be rejected without review:
    *   Papers & Student Papers: Maximum **six double-column pages**.
    *   Lightning Talks, Panels, Tutorials, Posters: Maximum **two double-column pages**.
*   **ORCID iD:** All authors must include their ORCID iD. Register for free at [orcid.org](https://orcid.org/).
*   **Review Process:** Most submissions undergo a blind peer review process. Panels are an exception and include author information.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** At least one author must attend the conference and present their accepted submission in person for it to be published in the proceedings.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** **August 03, 2025**
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **September 05, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready Deadline:** **September 19, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **November 06-08, 2025**

## Call for Reviewers

We need volunteers to serve as submission reviewers and session chairs. If you are interested, please sign up via the [Volunteer Sign-up Form](https://www.ccecc.acm.org/acm-sigcite-2025/committee).

## Publication Information

Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings. Authors are subject to all ACM Publications Policies, including those on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects. Ensuring you have an ORCID iD is crucial for the publishing process.

callForPapers:
# SIROCCO 2025: Call for Papers

The 32nd International Colloquium On Structural Information and Communication Complexity (SIROCCO 2025) will take place on **June 2-4, 2025**, in the historic town of **Delphi, Greece**, at the European Cultural Centre of Delphi.

## About SIROCCO

SIROCCO is devoted to the study of the interplay between structural knowledge, communication, and computing in decentralized systems of multiple communicating entities. Special emphasis is given to innovative methodological and solution approaches leading to a better understanding of the relationship between computing and communication.

## Keynote Speakers

*   Hagit Attiya, Technion
*   Joseph Y. Halpern, Cornell University
*   Christos Papadimitriou, Columbia University and Archimedes AI

## Topics of Interest

Original papers are solicited from all areas of study of local structural knowledge and global communication and computational complexities, in particular:

*   Distributed algorithms and computability
*   Distributed graph algorithms
*   Shared-memory algorithms
*   Network modeling and analysis
*   Fault tolerance
*   Self-stabilization
*   Security in distributed computing
*   Structural and communication complexity analysis
*   Epistemic modeling and analysis of distributed systems
*   Game theory in distributed computing
*   Topology in distributed computing
*   Wireless, ad-hoc, and peer-to-peer networks
*   Mobile agents and autonomous distributed systems
*   Blockchains and related distributed paradigms
*   Digital circuits and systems on chip
*   Biological and nature-inspired distributed algorithms

Keeping with the tradition of SIROCCO, new areas are also welcome.

## Important Dates

*   **Original Abstract submission Due date:** Saturday, November 2, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Full paper submission:** Friday, November 8, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Notification:** January 31, 2025
*   **Registration:** Early registration up to April 25, 2025. Late registration up to May 10, 2025.
*   **Conference:** June 2-4, 2025 (with welcome reception on June 1st)

## Submission Instructions

*   A submission must report on **original research** and contain results that have not appeared previously in a regular conference paper and have not been concurrently submitted to or previously appeared in a journal or a conference with published proceedings.
*   Submissions must be in **PDF format**.
*   Submit using **EasyChair**: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sirocco2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sirocco2025)
*   Submissions must be written in English.
*   Format: Single column on US letter-size or A4 size paper, use at least 11-point font, and have at least 2.5 cm margins.
*   All submissions must start with the paper’s title, author names, and a short abstract.
*   There is **no page limit**, but it is mandatory that the paper contains, within the first 14 pages, a concise and clear presentation of the primary content and merits of the paper. Everything beyond 14 pages will be read at the discretion of the reviewers only. An appendix is optional.
*   Submissions deviating from these guidelines as well as papers outside the scope of the conference may be rejected without consideration of their merits.
*   A submission that is not accepted as a full paper may be invited for a brief announcement.

## Proceedings and Special Issue

*   The proceedings of SIROCCO 2025 will be published by **Springer in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series**.
*   Inclusion in the proceedings requires a presentation by one of the authors at the conference site and at least one full registration for every full paper.
*   **Selected papers** from SIROCCO 2025 will be invited to a special issue of the journal **Theoretical Computer Science**.

## Awards

*   **Best Paper Award**: All regular papers are eligible.
*   **Best Student Paper Award**: All regular papers with at least one student author who has done most of the work are eligible. Please state eligibility on the first page.

## Registration Information

Registration is now closed.

callForPapers:
# SISY 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to the **IEEE 23rd International Symposium on Intelligent Systems and Informatics (SISY 2025)**, dedicated to the 65th birthday of Márta Takács.

This symposium aims to foster scientific relationships worldwide in the field of Intelligent Systems and Informatics.

## Venue & Modality

The symposium will be held in **Subotica, Serbia**, from **September 25-27, 2025**.

The conference is organized **in-person with onsite presentations only**. At least one author of each accepted paper must show up and present the paper at the conference to ensure its inclusion in the proceedings.

## Topics

The symposium invites papers addressing state-of-the-art research in all areas of Intelligent Systems and Informatics and their applications. Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   **Computational Intelligence** (track chair: Amir Mosavi)
    *   Machine Learning, Genetic Algorithms, Neural Nets, Fuzzy Systems
    *   Fuzzy and Neuro-Fuzzy Control, Knowledge Based Systems, Expert Systems
*   **Intelligent Robotics** (track chair: Enikő Nagy)
    *   Control, Flexible Arm Control, Perception and Recognition, Reasoning, Learning
    *   Robotic Systems, Human-Robotic Interaction, Service Robots, Surgery Robots, Machine Vision
*   **Intelligent Mechatronics** (track chair: Radu-Emil Precup)
    *   Sensing and Sensor Data Fusion, Motion Control, Intelligent Actuators
*   **Intelligent Manufacturing Systems** (track chair: László Horváth)
    *   Flexible Manufacturing Systems, Production Planning and Scheduling, System Simulation
    *   Rapid Prototyping, Concurrent Engineering, Virtual Reality
*   **Informatics** (track chairs: György Eigner and Gábor Kertész)
    *   The Web, Business & Digital Culture, Databases, Design & Graphics
    *   Digital Audio, Video and Photography, Hardware, Home & Office
    *   Networking & Sys Admin, Operating Systems, Programming, Science & Math
    *   Security Software Engineering, Healthcare Informatics, Teaching Informatics, Informatics in education process
*   **Applied Mathematics** (track chair: Ivana Štajner-Papuga)

### Special Sessions

*   **PhD Student Research in Applied Informatics** (organized by László Horváth)
*   **Digitalisation, Generation Research, Consumer Trends** (organized by Mónika Garai-Fodor, Ágnes Csiszárik-Kocsir and János Varga)
*   **5G and Cybersecurity** (organized by Anna Bánáti and Miklós Kozlovszky)
*   **Soft Computing-driven Intelligent Systems and Applications** (organized by Edit Laufer and Ákos Odry)
*   **Women in Engineering and Informatics** (organized by Melánia Puskás and Andrea Tick)

## Plenary Speakers

*   **Márta Takács**: Fuzzy Challenges
*   **Bernard De Baets**: “Fuzzy Sets”, 60 Years Later
*   **Robert Kozma**: Implementation of Brain-Inspired Multi-Sensory Integration and Decision Making using Embodied Robotic Platforms
*   **Ljiljana Trajković**: Data Mining and Machine Learning for Analysis of Network Traffic

## Submission of Papers

Authors are welcome to submit **original and unpublished papers** which are not currently under review by another conference or journal.

All paper submissions are processed **through the conference website**. Papers sent by e-mail are not acceptable.

### Instructions for Authors

*   The official language of the symposium is **English**.
*   Authors should submit **IEEE standard double-column paper** with a minimum of **4 full pages** and a maximum of **6 pages**.
*   The format of the final manuscript can be found on the conference web site of SISY 2025: [https://conf.uni-obuda.hu/sisy2025](https://conf.uni-obuda.hu/sisy2025).
*   **Plagiarism Policy:** Papers will be checked by IEEE plagiarism detection software. IEEE takes plagiarism very seriously. If a paper is not original, not the authors' own work, or submitted to other conferences or journals, or a copy of another paper, it will be removed. It is not even allowed to copy from the author's own previously published paper. The paper may be checked against plagiarism at any time from submission until publication.
*   By submitting your paper, you accept the [Terms and Policy](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sisy2025).

### Submission System

Submissions are open via the EasyChair Conference System: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sisy2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=sisy2025)

## Important Dates

| Event                    | Date             |
| :----------------------- | :--------------- |
| Full paper submission    | **May 30, 2025** |
| Notification             | **July 21, 2025**|
| Final manuscript submission | **August 18, 2025** |

## Publication

The conference appears on the IEEE Conference Search. Conference proceedings that meet IEEE quality review standards may be eligible for inclusion in the **IEEE Xplore Digital Library**.

> **IEEE Policy:** IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution after the conference (e.g., removal from IEEE Xplore), if the paper is not presented at the conference. 'Pay to publish' is not allowed by IEEE. So at least one author of a paper must show up and present the paper at the conference.

Selected papers may be published in a special issue of the journal *Acta Polytechnica Hungarica*.

## Organizers

*   Óbuda University, Budapest, Hungary
*   Subotica Tech, Serbia
*   University North, Croatia
*   Juraj Dobrila University of Pula, Croatia
*   IEEE SMC Technical Committee on Computational Cybernetics

## Technical Co-Sponsor

*   IEEE SMC Society

## In Technical Co-operation with

*   John von Neumann Computer Society
*   Hungarian Fuzzy Association
*   Department of Mathematics and Informatics, Faculty of Sciences, University of Novi Sad, Serbia
*   Mihajlo Pupin Institute, Serbia
*   IEEE Serbia and Montenegro Section

## Sponsors

*   IEEE Hungary Section
*   IEEE SMC Chapter, Hungary
*   IEEE IES and RAS Chapters, Hungary
*   IEEE Control Systems Chapter, Hungary

## Contact

**Secretary General:**
Anikó Szakál
Óbuda University, Budapest, Hungary
E-mail: `szakal@uni-obuda.hu`

The conference offers a platform for researchers and practitioners to share advancements in cybernetics, human-machine systems, and systems science and engineering.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - IEEE SMC 2025

## Overview

The 2025 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics (SMC) is the flagship conference of the IEEE Systems, Man, and Cybernetics Society. It provides an international forum for researchers, educators, and practitioners to learn, share knowledge, report most recent innovations and developments, and exchange ideas and advances in all aspects of systems science and engineering, human-machine systems, and cybernetics. The theme of the IEEE SMC 2025 conference is **“Navigating Frontiers: Smart Systems for a Dynamic World”**.

[SMC25-CFP - Deadline Extension.pdf](https://www.ieeesmc2025.org/call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/SMC25-CFP%20-%20Deadline%20Extension.pdf&cid=613) (pdf, 161.7 KiB)

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors must adhere to the IEEE conference written paper format (including paper title, authors and affiliations, figures, and references).
*   Submit draft versions of the paper for review before the due submission deadlines through the PaperCept submission system.
*   It is strongly recommended to use the provided IEEE templates in MS Word and LaTeX format. Use Letter page size.
*   Do not modify the style or format of the templates under any circumstances.
*   Submit only original work, not previously published or copyrighted, and not submitted elsewhere.
*   The conference utilizes a **single-blind review process**.
*   Accepted papers must be presented at the conference, either by the authors themselves or via proxy. Unpresented papers will be removed from post-conference distribution and will not be available in the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library.
*   Accepted and presented papers will be copyrighted to IEEE and published in conference proceedings, eligible for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore® Digital Library.
*   Papers will also be submitted to Scopus for indexing after the conference.

## Submission Templates

*   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc](https://www.ieeesmc2025.org/call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-Word.doc&cid=541) (doc, 74.0 KiB)
*   [IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip](https://www.ieeesmc2025.org/call-for-papers.html?file=files/content/test-files/IEEE-ConfPaper-Template-LaTeX.zip&cid=541) (zip, 100.4 KiB)

## Paper Types

*   **Regular Papers:** Up to 6 pages (max 2 overlength pages for an extra fee). Concise but with sufficient details and references for critical review. Reviewed (single-blinded) by at least two referees.
*   **Special Sessions Papers:** Focused discussion of new and innovative topics. Organizers should collect at least six papers. All submitted papers undergo the same review process as regular papers.
*   **Work-in-Progress and Industrial Papers:** Intended to show work-in-progress and promote contributions from industries. Limited to four (4) pages.
*   **Workshop Papers:** Intended to promote contributions from applied research and applications. All submitted papers undergo the same review process as regular papers.

## Topics

Contributions to theory and practice are invited in the following technical areas:

### Cybernetics (CYB)

*   Agent-Based Modeling

*   Artificial Immune Systems

### Human-Machine Systems (HMS)
