It serves as an international forum for sharing knowledge in the theory, methodology, and applications of security in information and networks, covering areas such as cryptographic algorithms, security schemes, cryptanalysis, and various domain-specific securities.
callForPapers:
# SINCONF 2024: Call for Papers

The 17th International Conference on Security of Information and Networks (SINCONF 2024) will be held in a **fully on-line mode** from **December 2-4, 2024**.

It is hosted by the **University of Technology Sydney, Australia**, and co-hosted by **Hasan Kalyoncu University, Gaziantep, Türkiye**.

SINCONF 2024 provides an excellent international forum for sharing knowledge and results in theory, methodology, and applications of Security in information and networks. The conference invites significant contributions from researchers and industrial workers in developing cryptographic algorithms, security schemes, cryptanalysis, application security, system security, cloud security, IoT security, and network security. All sessions will be broadcast via Zoom, and all delegates will present live via Zoom. The IEEE digital conference proceedings will be available for download at the beginning of the conference.

## Topics of Interest

Authors are solicited to contribute to the conference by submitting articles that illustrate research results, project outputs, surveys, and industrial experiences that describe significant advances in the following areas, but are not limited to:

*   Network Defence
*   Tools and development platforms
*   Malware Analysis
*   Security and privacy in social networks
*   Security in space science
*   Key management and distribution
*   Security in Mobile and IoT devices
*   Security in embedded systems and IoT
*   Cloud and system security
*   Security-aware software engineering
*   Security using Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Federated learning, and Artificial Intelligence
*   Security in cyber-physical systems, Security in Blockchain
*   Web and application security
*   Security education and innovative curriculum
*   Security in biometric systems
*   Privacy and trust management
*   Symmetric and asymmetric key cryptography
*   Computational intelligence techniques in security
*   Vehicular and Intelligent System Security
*   Security in Embedded Systems
*   Security ontology, models, protocols & policies
*   Standards, guidelines, and certification
*   Information assurance, security, and public policy
*   Interoperability, service levels, and quality issues

## Important Dates

| Event                           | Date               |
| :------------------------------ | :----------------- |
| Submission Site Opens           | **20th April 2024**|
| Full paper submission (Extended)| **31st October 2024**|
| Author Notification             | **15th November 2024**|
| Conference                      | **2nd - 4th December 2024**|

> Note: All submission and notification dates are already passed as per the provided information.

## Submission Guidelines

Authors are invited to submit papers of **no more than 8 pages** in double-column format. Papers must clearly state the objectives of the work, its significance in advancing the state of the art, and the methods and specific results in sufficient detail. The submission should include appropriate key equations, figures, tables, and references. Papers not conforming to these requirements will be rejected without review.

*   **Template:** Standard IEEE PES Conference template available at [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html)
*   **Review Process:** All submissions will go through a single-blind peer review process to ensure confidentiality and fair review.
*   **Publication:** Presented papers will be submitted to IEEE Xplore for publication.
*   **Submission System:** Submissions should be made electronically via **EDAS**.

## Workshops, Special Sessions, and Tutorials

Proposals for workshops, special sessions, and tutorials are welcomed. A Call for Workshop, Special Session and Tutorial Proposals document is available for download.

### DroneSense-AI 2024

The 1st Workshop on Artificial Intelligence for Networked Drone and Sensor Applications will be held in conjunction with SINCONF 2024 on **December 2, 2024**. This workshop will also be fully online.

A separate Call for Papers document for DroneSense-AI 2024 is available for download.

## Registration Fees

Prices are in **Australian dollars (AUD)**. Current exchange rates are **$AU1.0 = $US 0.66 = Euro 0.60**.

| Registration Category | Cost |
| :-------------------- | :--- |
| **IEEE life member**  | **$AU390** |
| **Student IEEE member** | **$AU390** |
| **Student**           | **$AU490** |
| **Full IEEE member**  | **$AU590** |
| **Full**              | **$AU690** |

For more information and to register, please visit the [Registration Page](https://academiceventservices.com/conferences/sinconf2024/).

## Keynote Speakers

*   **Prof. Sridevan Parameswaran** (Head of School and Professor, School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, The University of Sydney, Australia)
    *   **Topic:** *Side channel Attacks, Remote Power Attacks and Countermeasures*
    *   **Date/Time:** Day-1, Monday, 2nd December 2024, 9.15 AM - 10.00 AM
*   **Dr. Ian Oppermann** (Co-founder ServiceGen, Industry Professor, University of Technology Sydney)
    *   **Topic:** *Establishing Trustworthy Data Sharing and Use Frameworks*
    *   **Date/Time:** Day-2, Tuesday, 3rd December 2024, 9.00 AM - 9.45 AM
*   **Dr. Vanessa Teague** (Associate Professor (Adj.), College of Engineering and Computer Science, ANU College of Engineering, Computing and Cybernetics; CEO, Thinking Cybersecurity Pty. Ltd.)
    *   **Topic:** *Election verification for computer scientists*
    *   **Date/Time:** Day-2, Tuesday, 3rd December 2024, 9.45 AM - 10.30 AM
*   **Prof. Willy Susilo** (Distinguished Professor, Head of school of Computing and Information Technology, University of Wollongong)
    *   **Topic:** *Cloud Computing Security: Past, Present and Future*
    *   **Date/Time:** Day-3, Wednesday, 4th December 2024, 9.00 AM - 9.45 AM

## Presentation Guidelines

*   All on-line presentations will be made **live via Zoom** ([https://zoom.us/](https://zoom.us/)).
*   SIN2024 will have three Zoom rooms, each paired to a physical room at the conference venue.
*   On-site sessions will also be made available on-line via Zoom.
*   **Important:** The on-site and the on-line Zoom sessions **will not be recorded**.

## Contact Information

For general inquiries, please contact: [sinconf@sinconf.org](mailto:sinconf@sinconf.org)

summary: The ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Software Language Engineering (SLE) is dedicated to the principles of software languages, focusing on their design, implementation, and evolution. SLE 2025, the 18th edition, will be held in Koblenz, Germany, from June 12-13, 2025, and is co-located with STAF 2025. callForPapers:
# SLE 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Software Language Engineering (SLE) is devoted to the principles of software languages: their design, their implementation, and their evolution. Software language engineering (SLE) is the discipline of engineering languages and their tools required for the creation of software.

SLE 2025 will bring together researchers from different areas united by their common interest in the creation, capture, and tooling of software languages. It overlaps with traditional conferences on the design and implementation of programming languages, model-driven engineering, and compiler construction, emphasizing the fusion of these communities.

## Venue and Dates

*   **Location:** Koblenz, Germany
*   **Conference Dates:** **June 12 - June 13, 2025** (co-located with STAF 2025)

## Important Dates

All dates are **Anywhere on Earth (AoE)**.

1.  **Initial optional abstract submission:** **February 7, 2025**
2.  **Abstract and paper submission:** **March 4, 2025**
3.  **Authors response period:** **April 1 - April 5, 2025**
4.  **Notification:** **April 15, 2025**
5.  **Artifact Submission Deadline:** **April 23, 2025**

## Submission Information

Submissions should be made through the submission website: [https://sle25.hotcrp.com](https://sle25.hotcrp.com).

The conference also features an **Artifact Evaluation** process.

## Community and Conference Websites

*   **Community website:** [https://www.sleconf.org/2025](https://www.sleconf.org/2025)
*   **Conference website:** [https://conf.researchr.org/home/sle-2025](https://conf.researchr.org/home/sle-2025)

# SNPD 2025-Winter: Call for Papers

The 33rd IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Networking and Parallel/Distributed Computing (SNPD 2025-Winter) will be held from **December 3-5, 2025**, at the **National Chin-Yi University of Technology, Taichung, Taiwan**.

This conference brings together researchers, scientists, engineers, industry practitioners, and students to discuss, encourage, and exchange new ideas, research results, and experiences on all aspects of computer and information science. SNPD 2025-Winter aims to facilitate cross-fertilizations among key technology enabling areas and is soliciting papers in these areas.

## Important Dates

*   **Workshop/Special session proposal:** June 16, 2025
*   **Workshop/Special session acceptance notification:** June 30, 2025
*   **Submission Deadline:** September 1, 2025
*   **Acceptance Notification:** September 18, 2025
*   **Registration/Camera Ready Paper:** October 1, 2025

## About ACIS

ACIS provides a forum for researchers in education and industry from all over the world to interact with one another and disseminate the latest developments in the fields of computer and information science.
